ciBWLoVpNF37S5NGrMctWw.review_text: Even for a Wednesday night, Bloodhound is hopping. The hunter's lodge ambience is just enough to be charming without being overwhelming. Impressive variety of alcohol. The service was quick and the drinks are served in chunky mason jars - a cute touch. Added bonus, dogs are welcome!!

Dv_R505aiFkH1rTxrXbjaw.review_text: Great bar. Awesome beer selection great staff. Awesome place to bring the dog and hang out.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text: a korean lawyer lady moved into this nieghborhood so we came out to see her drunk ass here one night. its a rare occasion this ladys drunk so i try to make it out each and everytime. i like it whens shes drunk. she makes me smile. she hilarious!!! like me when im drunk, minus the stripping and swearing and self inflicted injuries.  they have a good selection of drinks and the folks working the bar were on point with the drinks. i loved the mason jars. sure its kitchy, but im a southern boy at heart i guess. i love shooting guns and drinking beer. i USED to jump cars on the balboa hill, but that was years ago when there was no stop sign at the bottom of the hill.....  i like the look of this place, i get a very cabin in the woods feel here. not sure if the hunting game is supposed to be ironic, but me being the excellent shot with a scatter gun and the finace, having shot a 30 ought 8 for the first time before she could stay out till dark *shes from the south... no explanation needed right?* we were right up in that. apparently, im a murdering maniac. doe, buck, turkey, innocent bystander standing next to the game... youre all getting shot.  i digress... yeah, so this place is comfortable enough. theres loungy couches to one side and a long bar on the other.   oh... but be warned.... apparently i wasnt paying attention to EXACTLY where i was.  *story time*  so after meeting up with drunk korean lawyer and fairly equally drunk messican and meeting the awesome couple maya and jaime and of course, after a couple beers, i walk outside to smoke. im standing in front of the large window of bloodhound and these two guys walking by keep staring at me. im thinking to myself, forget it. youre too old for this kind of crap. youre engaged for god sakes..  i go back inside. after a drink and some laughs, i go outside for another smoke. wtf!?!?!? a group of guys give me the stink eye while walking by. at this point im pretty intoxicated and feeling about two feet taller than i am and im thinking im about to bust some fucking heads.... thank god for the reality check of mr 6' 2', 230lb+ bouncer dude standing in front......   i go back in. drink. laugh and i head outside for another smoke.   W T F. another guys straight up dogging me (yes, i said dogging, yes im old. screw you).   fuck it. if i get arrested tonight, so be it.  i center my attention on the tallest/biggest guy in the group. ALWAYS take on the biggest guy of the group. the rest of his friends wont be expecting that. i stare at the guy, hes about 5' 10", skinny though.... i stare at him. follow him from the right side of me to the left...... oh shit....   OH SHIT.... OH SHIT!!!!!!!  apparently theres a gay bar next door to the bloodhound.   its friday night.   asian night.  i literally laugh out loud and run back inside.  i may be a moron, but daddys still got it!!!

NpU44ANnUUNQWY4U0eUGvA.review_text: this place was crowded on a friday night!  i felt like i hadnt been out in forever or maybe i hadnt been out in a place that crowded in forever.  reminded me a bit of rickhouse  the drinks are delicious!  i had a few too many Recoils here.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: for a wed night, this place was poppin'!  the drinks here are really tasty, but the place kinda smells.

yh8_9Ix1wp9dekvyOZbilQ.review_text: I'm really  mad that I hadn't visited Bloodhound sooner! I'm always in the area yet never heard of this great bar until last night. As soon as I walked in I felt comfortable - no scene, no pretension (though there is some noticeable antler decor).   I perused their cocktail menu but decided to go with the Greyhound, as I'm not a huge fan of Campari or of Bourbon, and there seemed to be a lot of both of those on their specialty drinks. It may have been one of the best greyhounds that I've ever had, and it was also the place where I learned of the Salted Dog, which is a greyhound with a salted rim. Yum!  The bar itself is super laid back and comfortable, with some big leathery couches that we all sprawled out on as well as some fun rolling office type chairs. The only reason I'm not giving it a full five stars (though my experience was pretty darn close) was that I really felt like I'd seen this concept before and it wasn't necessarily the most unique decor or ambiance. But hey, it works!

2kIEJGN66-1DwIhk5cPjXw.review_text: Bloodhound is great! The drinks are pretty strong so definitely worth the money. Their special drinks are particularly good, so try those (and the mason jars they use are cute too). Good beers on tap too, and the bartenders are friendly and willing to help you choose something and explain what's what.  The atmosphere was enjoyable as well, laid back but lively. And close to Bart!

iFWkpim7LPphSoJvKx1meQ.review_text: nice evening, not that personal.  Reasonable vibe, very friendly door staff

gOANenl1KF685ck9sft3hg.review_text: Nor me or girlfriend got in.  I didn't bring my passport and had only my non-american I.D so we couldn't get in.  That's cool, I get the point -it was our fault after all for not bringing it.  But my negative review is based on the following exchange of words with the bouncer:  After he saw my foreign ID and rejected it asked me for my passport: Me:  Sorry man, I didn't want to bring my passport to a bar.  B: WELL, YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO (yes, with that army treatment) Me: Maybe, but I didn't want to risk it, that's cool.  We won't get in. B: OK THEN KEEP WALKING. (He stood up and basically, kicked us out of the sidewalk) Me:  Alright, but you are not having the most polite attitude either man. B: F*CK YOU!!  (yes, he screamed that to me and my girlfriend) Me: ....wow B: GET THE F*CK OUT.  And he raised his middle finger to us.  Of course, I  was not going to fight it or exchange words with that gorilla.  He would've kicked my ass anyways and make Folsom a real bloodhound.  Don't know anything about the bar menu or decor or anything.  Maybe it's the best one in SF, but it was a wednesday, 9pm.  e were sober, just walking by, and there were probably 50 people inside  and no one else on the line.  What was the need to insult us? Don't know who is this guy used to deal with, but certainly that was not us.  It was shocking.  We will not get back to this place again.

NnzhHARuS94VzVQ-WqIdxw.review_text: Great vibe. Good drinks. A little on the pricey side...  I'll write a more thorough review when I go here first, rather than last.

oBgYDUYPl2yI_fD-cB_nIA.review_text: Finally, a reliably awesome bar in SOMA for all occasions! Football fan? They show the NFL ticket starting at like 10am. Bar crawl? You might find it hard to leave... unless you're female and REALLY have to pee. Happy hour? There's a decent crowd every day of the week, but if it's quiet just play a round of pool at the table in the back!  Get the Old Speckled Hen beer. Trust me, it has even converted non-beer drinkers and don't be fooled by what looks like a bad pour; it's supposed to be that way.   Warning: DO NOT let your date order you mixed drinks here - they are way stronger than you realize (but he probably does).

vI2Oc__Y4ehNoO0S_v1QOg.review_text: I was supposed to met a friend there, during HH which is 3-7 and drinks $1 off. The place has an interesting decor to say the least but it is so so laud. I ordered hefeweizen which was served in a mason jar :) and the guy took my credit card but when my friend got there we could not really talk because it was so  laud so decided to go bar next door and I wanted to close my tap and he asked for cash, I understand it was only $5 but still, it bothered me a bit.

SRz0Q-tsPd1SU8bvFi_ToA.review_text: Great local bar that hasn't faded over time like so many great bars due.  I love the liquor selection and the bartenders.  This place has a good mix of patrons and is a great place for meeting people.

n-LZIcHGmWfRl1GwdNlFzQ.review_text: 5 stars is perfect so consider this a 4.5 star rating. Very mixed crowd which was good so you don't feel out of place, but something felt missing so, no 5 stars.  PROS: -Drinks are cheap! -Ambiance is creative (little more could be done I to really drive it home) -Food guys at front door that will bring your food in for you (huge +) -Quick service and friendly bartenders

dv1CW8kaYbtasGIxYBpFbw.review_text: So I travel a lot for work, like if I was in the witness relocation program. Any given week could be in South America, Asia or Oklahoma or creating mayhem back home in San Francisco. This bar is rocking, let me go ahead and break it down for you:  - Always a cool crowd of easy to talk to people - The partners/bartenders remember your name and bring a drink pretty quickly - Friendly furry dogs roaming about - Free Internet access. Yes its at a bar, but man isnt always better to finish that last hour of work at a bar as opposed to your cubicle or at home watching another Law and Order SVU? - Good strong drinks - A pool table and a hunting game, I never play the hunting game all that often, but man it is the best when your pretty drunk - Comfortable sofa's and chairs that spin around, you need to spin around in them - Free BBQ from time to time on Saturdays

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: I reckon this here might be a nice saloon to grab yerself a whiskey when the mood strikes. Fix what ails ye.  That was certainly a pitiful attempt at cowboy lingo, but take a gander at the main pics of Bloodhound and you'll catch my drift. Lean against the wood slat walls and ponder the antler chandelier, tip back a booze filled mason jar or two, catch up with old pals or new. It's a bar I'd almost call "upscale" that still has the nonchalance of a saloon.  The crowd can be a touch pretentious, something I've notice about select bars in SOMA. Annoying customers be damned, the bartenders are thorough and will chat you up about their cocktail list to make sure you're comfortable with your drink selection.  Bonus points for the amazing ceiling. Simple yet repeatedly eye catching. Word to the wise, do NOT ogle the birds if you're traveling through 'tipsy' and on to 'drunk'. Don't even glance upward if nearing 'wasted'. I witnessed a girl, most definitely hammered, continuously look up at the ceiling. She was mumbling about the birds, how she loved birds, loved *these* birds, wished she had birds... You know, annoying alcohol induced repetition. She eventually stared at the birds so intently, drunk as shit, that she predictably toppled backwards, right into two people, drinks in hand. Some folks just can't handle the birds it seems. They're cool, but check them out before getting tanked ok?

Lr-B-r-KF80yFy-2u336bw.review_text: We ended up at Blood Hound after the Elite event at Pedro's. Its a nice little neighborhood bar. They have a Big Buck Hunter Game and a Bar Pool Table. It reminds me of a hunting lodge. They serve Draft Beers in Mason Jars that pretty novel. Plenty of seating. Nice looking Bartenders and a Chill Vibe.

sMfAazU842DN6NNTC7PUuQ.review_text: Only been here twice but I love the feel of this bar. Came for beers after a Superbowl Party and then another time for cocktails before heading to a show. This place has the same owners at Churchills and they stock the Chicharones that you see behind many of the bars in the city. A lot of space and a great central location to meet up after a long day or before a long night.

ejVXwDGUXK2iKl5or5twzQ.review_text: One of the best bars in the city for sure - great drinks, great bartenders, great ambiance. enough said!

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Pretty sweet bar, but not so sweet location. For me it was definitely a destination spot, but was well worth it. The selection of liquor is awesome as is their beer. Old Speckled Hen on tap was enough to make me happy along with the chiccarones that were available at the time. Great decor, just wish it was a little closer...

YBDuWLUgutvc8W_aASVGdg.review_text: Yep - a solid bar.  Read the other reviews for a sense of the hip crowd, lodge decor and to hear about the strong selection of upscale booze and the cocktails.  As to the beer on tap -- impressive.  Impressive for both the breadth and depth of selection covered across 10 taps.    Sporting 2 offerings from San Diego's Stone brewery -- their Pale Ale and the 'enjoy by 12-21-12' Double IPA.  Ballast Point Big Eye, another San Diego IPA rounds out the hoppy beers.  Nice.  A couple of seasonals -- Anchor's Christmas Ale and the Belgian Delirium Noel will help you find the that holiday spirit.  Drake's Stout gives you another dark selection.  Two Belgian styles -- PranQster Golden (CO) & Allagash White (ME) -- are friendly choices, along with England's Old Speckled Hen.  The 10th tap serves a lager - Berkeley's Trumer Pils.  A FIVE PINT salute to the Bloodhound's beer offering.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: Even before moving to the neighborhood, Bloodhound was the stuff of legend.  It's got that warm hunting lodge look and feel and carefully walks the line between svelte hipster bar and locals dive scene.  You can try any of the delicious (usually) bourbon based libations or go for a good ol glass of beer.  The selections on both are pretty great with the bartenders definitely paying attention to their craft.  Its tough to gauge a good night to come since weekends at just about any good bar are packed and random weekdays are prone to infestations of the start-up faux hipster crowd doing their post-work happy hour thing but overall this is my go to spot for enjoying a drink in the 'hood.  This place is quickly ascending the list of my favorite bars in SF.

a9XoYnZAJkQBfTKTAFqu-g.review_text: I haven't written up my San Francisco trip reviews yet, mainly because they would all be glowing but I have to talk about our experience here.  It is a dive bar close to where I am staying that yelp pointed out and I was excited to try.  Good beer selection? Nice whiskey cocktails? Funky dive bar decor? I was all about it.  Unfortunately we got treated to the worst service Ive ever gotten at a bar.  After announcing a premature closing time we were singled out from the other patrons still finishing and rudely asked to leave.  We tried to finish our drinks and a friend asked why they were closing early and the bouncer just took his drink and told him he was done. Of course I was like...what the hell man and was then threatened to have my drink taken away.  We were flabbergasted but all the the bartender did was chuckle and say he said they were closing.  Never gotten such rude service and they were clearly just amused at how upset it made us and could not care less.  Thought this bar would be right up my alley but it has been the worst experience of my vacation.  I would stay away unless you are okay with a place that would treat its customers so poorly.

6A0ZXMG_Cj5KKtUvmICuUg.review_text: The crowd at Bloodhound is fat chicks and short dudes, not what anybody is looking for. I've been here to Bloodhound a couple times and it's really the sort of place I wouldn't spend anymore time than I had to. The bartenders aren't particularly nice or good. A lot of attitude and more interest  what's going on behind the bar than with what's going on in front. The space is big, party big but inspired by nothing more than SF bar trends. Maybe that's the metta gag, it's a San Francisco bar theme bar. There's something about this place that makes one want to leave

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: Hands down one of my favorite dive bars in SOMA  Long bar  Great prices  Great bartenders  Pool table in the back  Old-School arcades  Awesome

GS3dtRV9ybRnCAH6K9MOvQ.review_text: Came here for a pint of Guiness and a meeting this evening. Didn't know they had that many skulls in San Francisco--Thought they disappeared with SF Gun Exchange. They like their antlers and horns here. Kind of reminds me of a pint-sized British Bankers Club, where I bartended about 5 years ago.  They don't have the big Cape buffalo heads the way they did at the BBC in Menlo Park, but they are giving the Menlo Park bar and grill a run for the money with a few mounted kudu skulls on the walls.   I would have given it 4 stars for a nice place to hang out and enjoy a Brit-style stout or mixed drink. But...the bartender for the evening didn't know what loud meant on the volume control. Almost got blown out the door by a song I can't even remember what it was other than I remember hearing it in high school--not something I wanted blasting in my ear while I'm trying to talk with a group of people.  Would like to try the pub food next time.

b0lXNnfnZpKPv7xNwpG3Ig.review_text: The mason jars are cute.  The space is big but a little too narrow and too long.  The decor is interesting.  BUT THE PLACE SMELLS!

MnY8gGqLdlcN2kLHdyQbhg.review_text: After departing the snooty City Beer Store & Tasting Bar ( see my review) we Yelped up this gem of a neighborhood bar. Great beers served cold in Mason jars, dogs roaming the area (including ours) and a great mix of people. Yes, the decor is awesome. Yes, the hunting video game is fun. Yes, the bartender was great! We will be back!

HpBvzMzchFrJ6XJmtRIsMg.review_text: + super friendly bartenders, quick & efficient service, reasonable drinks   + cute! love the birds on the ceiling... the vibe. the antler chandelier, the framed hunting themed art, duck hunt(!), the beer served in mason jars!   + GREAT jukebox   + comfy. we lucked out with claiming the black leather couch-like seats on the side where our pretty big sized group were able to spread out comfortably.   - no photo booth. that's what takes my bar reviews to 5 stars. it's also why my friend and i took off 30 minutes before closing time to try to make last call at annie's. a photo booth strip to commemorate a saturday night's debauchery is so obviously a necessity. fer reals.

W9RU376D6Ny0GzFKtc7uNQ.review_text: GET THE RECOIL (Bulleit, ginger beer, elderflower, lime). So tasty. I like this spot, but minus stars for the delirious bartender that thought we underpaid him. 2 drinks for $18, so we gave him a 10 dollar bill, 5 dollar bill, and five 1 dollar bills, and for some reason he thought we gave him two 5 dollar bills and four 1 dollar bills. When we explained it to him, he told us to 'get out of here'... ridiculous. Huge turn off that made me want to write this review.

FDRlrLDhgaQJ7Y0HwJypKg.review_text: A really interesting bar, with rustic chic decor and intriguing special cocktails. Also, they happen to allow any sort of dogs in their bar. As a vet student, I appreciated this enormously. The dogs were in some ways more interesting than the bar itself :)

muWo0gd3xEZHpq7Xty1-Dw.review_text: low-lit hunting decor, lounge seating, nice bartenders, and they allow dags (or dogs for you non-brad-pitt-pikey speakers).  what more could you ask for?  i've gotta come back and spend more time here next time i'm in the 'hood (and/or when i get a dag).

_VN7FUusKyPBvicljLsMww.review_text: Best Old Fashioned I've ever had. Also: Beer selection exceeds requirements/expectations. Staff keeps potentially d-bag crowd on their best behavior.

WpCW366f95XBYzXxq0SmZQ.review_text: I can't pinpoint what I like most--the Mason jars (hey, a lady's gotta have her Mason jar), the I-can't-figure-out-how-they-painted-that ceiling with Poe-esque in-flight ravens, the ambiance (interesting without trying too hard), or the legit beverages. Our most recent visit had me ordering an Allagash tripel. The only other local place I could find that beer was in the over-priced, over-refrigerated beer aisle in Whole Foods. Of course, you can have your fancy-pants beer while ordering a rum and coke next. Seems like all drinks are welcome here. Also, no cover.   Downside: can get packed (is that really a downside at a bar?).

83K9xn6m1Cx-WS4KIQgbIw.review_text: This is my new favorite place for drinks in SF.  The decor is awesome (cool birds on the ceiling? check!), the mason jars add a wonderful touch, and the drink list is creative and delicious.  Great vibe, perfect ratio of seats/standing spaces, good people, good volume level - all in all, perfect spot for late night drinks after work.

ScqX9likGEDdhJAeVolCMA.review_text: It was around 10pm on a wednesday night, and hubby and I wanted to go out for a couple of drinks. It was very crowded here (for what I'm used to, but I'm sure it wasn't that bad for SF), and it was a little difficult getting to the bar and trying to get the attention of the bartenders --partly because of the crowd and partly because I was a foot shorter than everyone else. However, the bartenders are very attentive, and I eventually got a drink. They have a small but good selection of beers, and mixed drinks. My hubby and I were pleasantly surprised by their recommendations (the bartenders are very knowledgeable about their drinks), and they kept checking up on us as our drinks got low.   They were out of the Old Speckled Hen beer, but the bartender recommended a dark nitro beer instead (I think it was Deschutes Armory XPA). It was very tasty (I like dark beers). Hubby was excited that they had a cocktail with pisco, so he ordered that. It was very strong, yet refreshing. The whisky drinks also looked really good, as the bartenders made them with such care and precision, so hubby got one of those too.  Tip: the crowd thinned out a lot as it got closer to midnight. By 10:30/11-ish, we got seats at the bar, which is why we had such good service.   Despite the tight space and crowd, the decor alone is worth a visit. I would've liked to return for drinks earlier in the day too, so as to avoid the crowd, but alas, so much to do in so little time!

u6PqJa4QFjPQzKgL-r6JEg.review_text: Nice place. Nothing special, cute bar, no music.

146hsaEzIGwTomLLJVEDDw.review_text: Huge fan of this place - No complaints!  Excellent and friendly staff. Pool table (in good condition and felted regularly). Good drinks and excellent beer on tap and affordable. Comfortable crowd, more local not "sceney" (for folks that want to go out but don't want to feel like they're out). It gets crowded on the weekends but there's always enough space Beautiful design (love the birds on the ceiling) Good juke box.  Again, no complaints!

-au0mPUn0w5HsF9HBLsJqQ.review_text: Bloodhound's centrality and open layout make for an excellent meeting place between friends new and old. The pool table, high tables, and long bar contribute to the standard bar features, but the capable mixology being conducted by its hosts will surprise you. Get the Moscow Mule-inspired Recoil -- truly refreshing!

cQSpN9xybR_pS2JlEVE3XQ.review_text: This place is pretty sure.  It's not the best place to go for a drink, but it gets the job done when you're in SOMA.  Nothing to write home about though in my book.  The drinks here in my experience are not very good-they are strong enough, but they never taste as good as some other places.  When I go to a chill bar like this, I want my drinks to be a little tastier cause I'm not getting wasted to drown out the taste)  The sitting area in the front is very nice and comfortable...great for a late night drink with friends or a date.

kHYU060QI2JsDf3TKnx70w.review_text: This place was awesome.  It's a totally chill place to enjoy cocktails (and some beers) in a very nicely designed environment.  They have a great list of house cocktails: Probably about 15, which aren't all listed on their web site.  I forget the one we liked the most, but it was a bourbon + cointreau kinda thing, served up.  The bartenders were also knowledgable about call drinks -- we always order some Vieux Carres, and they came up fast and perfect.  Prices weren't bad either!  Highly recommended for dates & chill evenings with friends.

gi9Hd9vYcQZWvYsrUABP6w.review_text: super groovy spot. Not a huge selection of beers, but I'm sure you can find a cocktail you'll like here. Be sure to go across the street and check out the City Beer Store while you're in the 'hood.

ha4DDPPKiMQcu8Hub9CAAQ.review_text: I like the look and feel of this bar.   There's actually loads of seating areas that aren't lounge sofas, which I like. Everytime I sit on those lounge seats I think of all the grime people have wiped on it. (yuck) Anyways, they have bar style seating and tables that are not as occupied as one would think, it seems like everyone enjoys standing around, chit chatting with a beer in hand.  They've painted birds all over the ceiling. I commented to my friend that it was a really cute idea to which they responded "what? they're just stencils, I can even do it for you. ezpz" (followed by roll of eyeballs) but amateur me, I'm still very very impressed.  I ordered beer and shots of Jameson. I don't know how their cocktails are, but as usual beer is great!

010pekBIqnWFg-wnN0W2HQ.review_text: This bar is a great spot to meet friends. The cocktails are delicious, the service reasonably quick and friendly, the atmosphere stylish and chill,  and my mut, Lola, is welcome. I'm sold.

1vXJWH7L0IMEz5-8aU3SOA.review_text: Nothing makes me feel more like I need an episode of intervention than a trip to SF. In fact, that's generally the reason why I don't have a ton of San Francisco reviews despite my many trips here - it's all a blur.  With that disclaimer in mind, this review may not be the most detailed or coherent in the world, but I can assure you, I fucking love this bar.   Why? Well, here's where it all gets hazy. A few reasons off the top of my head: -Old Speckled Hen served in mason jars... and only $5! -I usually stay at a hotel near this hood where there is a dearth of cool bars. -It's dark. -There's a good amount of seating. -Music is good. -They have just a really cool aesthetic.   Yeah, I'm kind of stretching here. But here's the thing, you can say Ryan Gosling is cool because he's good looking, and he's in a band, and he generally chooses good roles, and he owns 300 hipster v-necks... but you know those aren't the reasons WHY he's cool... he just is. The same goes for Bloodhound.  (Look, I warned you it was going to be semi-coherent.)

drI9J9xeWephVGlfMC487w.review_text: I've been to Bloodhound a couple of times in the last week or so and I have to say I'm a fan. I still haven't worked up the nerve to try the Big Buck Hunter, but that day will come. I've had the Recoil twice now. With it's mix of Bulleit Bourbon, St. Germain, ginger beer and lime, it has everything a girl needs to happily imbibe. For something else along those lines that will put a bit of hair on your chest (or add some pep to your step), go for the New Fashioned. It replaces the traditional sugar cube/simple syrup in an Old Fashioned with maple syrup. Somehow, this simple switch really elevates the flavor from the orange peel. If bourbon just isn't your thing, the Turf Cocktail has enough gin to really get your buzz on. The tiny sip I had of my friend's drink was plenty for me. The bartenders are really efficient and friendly and the bouncer complimented my dress. What's not to love?

3xrb0LpbaJ24Pkdyd55U8Q.review_text: I really wish this place wasn't so far from my house because I am newly obsessed! I'm from the South, so mason jars and Buck Hunter make me feel right at home. The drinks were knock you on your ass strong but still tasted great, and were very generously sized.  I went on a Wednesday, and the crowd was an impressive size and mix of types of people. I will definitely be back!

p8uV_DxFjjvDU_JJvaex6w.review_text: opens "friday", but i walked in last night and it was as open as it could be; and pretty crowded. I was a pretty big fan of cassidy's in terms of a local bar. 5 bucks for a beer (in a nifty mason jar) was a dollar more than i was hoping to pay (especially when i can walk across the street and get a 5 dollar beer from the city beer store that amazingly obscure and delicious), but owell.  beer list is just OK in my opinion, but again i'm biased based on what you can get next door. bar looked fully stocked though.  that said, it is really nice inside. i dig the lighting. i thought the mirrors up top where a little out of place compared to the rest of the rustic theme, but  all in all its very well put together. bathroom was very standard, and thus  lame in comparison to the rest of the bar, but it is a bathroom i guess.   probably the best part was the crowd, which was pretty mixed. better than the typical soma place, so hopefully that sticks around.  all in all, honestly it was the big buck hunter that made the place for me. i walked in really hoping for a foosball table, but being from ohio i was pretty much sold when i saw big buck hunter. not to mention last night it was free to play. i'm guessing its because they are just opening. or maybe it was a fluke. but i'm praying that it will just remain free all the time. then its 5 stars from me.

H3PFTHE-SL1gg2exnNy1jg.review_text: Great drinks with a big open space to chat and drink. I really like this place! All of the beers are served up in mason jars and they have a good selection of them on tap! But, before you go the beer route, may I tempt you with their cocktails? Delicious! Not too sweet, not too fancy, just good. I tried their namesake - the Bloodhound, but I didn't hear a bad thing all night about any of them.  Check it out!

HPWgwcbfIWxCGdMCWksrDw.review_text: This place delivers on decor. It has a rustic cabin vibe and has a mesmerizing ceiling (it has birds painted on it). I went to Bloodhound one day after work, so I wasn't surprised to see the bar filled with a bunch of young professionals.   I ordered the Pisco Punch, which was served in a mason jar (which, from what I could tell, all the drinks are). Dear heaven on earth, the Pisco Punch was DELICIOUS. When I go to a new  bar I usually try at least two drinks and never repeat an order. However, the Pisco Punch was so good that I couldn't  help myself and ended up ordering it twice.   I will be back!

tXW2clfGZ7dxVwDrVQcYCA.review_text: Very trendy, very loud, but great beers and cocktails. Nice to jump in for a bit and be overwhelmed by the ambience.

bxPYREtZeH98clXftApGhg.review_text: basically this place is awesome.  you should go here.  i'm not even joking.  a friend of mine declared this Our Bar before ever going to it because it was conveniently located almost equal distance between our apartments (we wanted to be able to text each other and say, "let's meet at our bar tomorrow at 7p").  thankfully it turned out to be a good choice.  on our first visit we camped out at a table and drank ourselves into a silly little stuper.  the second time we visited was about 6 weeks later and the bartender remembered our drinks.  this thoroughly impressed me -- or frightened me because either he has a great memory or my friend and i were so drunk that we were memorable.  let's just go ahead and say the bartender had a great memory and maybe my friend and i were extremely awesome and hilarious.  in any case... this place is awesome.  mason jars for beer.  great decor.  bartenders who remember you.  i wish there were more late night places to eat after a few hours of drinking but that's not Bloodhounds fault.  now, if only my friend would stop traveling europe and come drink with me...

dVHL4K-c50SgSDkawlZeVw.review_text: I give this place a 3.5.  I appreciate that the management followed up on my review to assure me that Bloodhound has never served food...  I've returned, and the place has grown on me a bit - hence the 0.5-star upgrade.  Summary: - good drinks (esp. the Recoil) at a reasonable price - good friends (but BYO of course), friendly crowd - could be more dive-y for my taste (so it's not so super crowded) - still wish I could order food, tho I appreciate that I can bring food in

o8h4yOIbvHRF1k5IRhz2kw.review_text: It's dark, smelly, and reminds me of Gaston's lair in Disney's "Beauty and the Beast," but I dig the pretty bird patterns on the ceiling.   Drinks are decent tasting, and decently priced for SF. My friends and I had fun here.

HT8kyFqLLDsyHGZ34LMtcw.review_text: I usually get freaked out when I see a stuffed animal bust on the wall... but for some reason it works here.  Seems like a upscale place at first glance, and then you see the moosehorn chandelier and realize it's more of a homey dive bar.

ITa3vh5ERI90G_WP4SmGUQ.review_text: Things I Like To Do Here:  1. Get down with the jukebox. 2. Drink the fabulously tasty New Fashioned. 3. Rock out on the pool table. 4. Get embarrassed at Buck Hunter (in a bar decorated like a hunting lodge).   Basically, Bloodhound is a good bar. I'd write more, but Bloodhound seems to always be our 3rd or 4th stop, and it gets a bit hazy.

sLIn9oBM0aw9q2R9G1oCew.review_text: 5.17.13 The décor was woodsy? I'm not sure how to describe it, there were birds on the ceiling, antler chandelier, shooting game at the end of the bar and drinks served out of a mason jar. This is a laid back type of a bar and most of all their drinks were super duper strong. I came here twice and tried at least four drinks and ack, it was hard to swallow. I guess for some people it's a good thing but for someone like me I prefer to enjoy my drink but wasn't able to. I have probably ordered the wrong drinks. Other people seem to like their drinks so I'll leave as that..  The next time I order I will say "On the weak side please" LOL.

U6At7X_-Gx0BjBCvDiypeg.review_text: Ahh the fantastic Bloodhound! Definitely one my favorite bars in the SOMA. Best Szerac I ever had was born here at this hip, laid-back, wooden cabin style bar. And their signature cocktails...  ::fingertips kiss:: Really, really good!  This bar can get pretty crowded, and you may find yourself planted in an open spot where there is a strong possibility that an unknowing pool stick will smack your face. But all can be forgivable as the many patrons I met here are very pleasant and friendly.  I still get a kick of the painted blackbirds hovering on the ceiling while enjoying my cocktail-in-a-jar. Western Spaghetti please!

G9Vb6yQ047TC3O_-GG4WZA.review_text: Bloodhound is one of my go to watering holes in SOMA. The cool, laid back hunting lodge themed bar has everything my heart desires: amazing cocktails and a Big Buck Hunter arcade game. Little known fact about me? I am a great shot. Well, only when I'm behind a fake rifle. I've never tried to shoot a real gun. But yeah, if you're ever up for challenging me to a game, meet me here. They've also got a pool table with an antler chandelier that I adore hanging above it. But I'm only okay at pool.  There's a lovely selection of specialty cocktails offered here, but the bartenders will whip you up whatever you'd like. Whether it's more spirit or fruit forward, sweet, tart, etc. Just let them know your liquor base of choice and leave the rest up to the pros. I am a big fan of the Recoil and New Fashioned, both bourbon drinks. They also have a great selection of beer on tap, which they serve in mason jars.   Not only are seats usually plentiful at the bar and by the windows, but the parking around here is super easy too. There's free street parking right out front, which is perfect, especially if you want to hit the place up early. If you head over around 6pm, you might find me there channeling Sarah Palin.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: Awesome spot for HAPPY HOUR! Packed when I went a few fridays ago. If you wanna grab a booth, make sure to arrive early....before 5 PM. great bar...lots of selection.   My recommendation: arrive early!

PESSmH_erpVVKmrtpEHKBA.review_text: We have a winner. First off, its half a block from my house. Now that may not seem all that to you, but if you are me, or you hang out at my house (you should be so lucky!) then its kind of a big deal. Another huge benefit is not having to walk down 6th street towards market like I would to go to Matador.  The drinks are strong. The MBGITW had a Bloodhound No. 1. A twist on a greyhound with the addition of Campari. Fun and drinkable. I tried the Ricky Ricardo, because I love Lucy, and I was in the mood for tequila. After that and a pint of Old Speckled Hen, I was certainly loopy. The intoxicating vapor of freshly butchered pig smoke didn't help either.  Great decor, quite an upgrade from Cassidy's. The interior looked very, um, Portland, but in a good way. Antler chandelier,  a flock of birds painted on the ceiling. But The place also has the solid touches of a good bar. A pool table in the back, a shooting game, a nice long bar that was accessible even during a crowded event, good lighting. I love hunting lodges and the whole gentleman's retreat look, so i found Bloodhound very comfortable. I'll be back here regularly.  The only problem I see is getting blackout drunk here while doing my laundry across the street at Brainwash and forgetting all of my clothes or stumbling back and heckling amateur comedy night (god please spare me my dignity).

WgUD-vUr1Hp0xI51vbwCbg.review_text: I used to come here when this place was Cassady's. The upgrade is nice without being stuffy, and I'm glad to see that the pool table is still there. The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are good, and it's laid-back enough that people feel comfortable bringing their laptops in to work early in the evening (if you're into that). The place also gets some nice natural sunlight around that time, so it doesn't feel like you're diving into a dark drinking hole.

J6xJvU62YyzL_R6_mh6ayA.review_text: Just met two new young architects. Hope to see them in the future!

oPW-LM0pXja0lDwZybXd9g.review_text: Bloodhound is a solid bar in SOMA for sitting down with friends for a well-poured pint or cocktail.  The bar is shockingly clean, but avoids feeling sterile because of the wooden, country-ish decor.  Drawbacks are that the drinks are pricey, and that it's out of the way for where I live in Russian Hill.  Being that this is more of a "have a drink with the lads" joint, I feel like this bar would be better located in a place like Polk Street or Hayes Valley, but I guess SOMA needs a normal bar too.  The big bartender guy is really knowledgeable, but if you catch him at the wrong moment can be a little impatient and snappy.  Nonetheless, you will get what you order, and it will be well-poured.  I highly recommend the buttered rum for colder evenings!  It is truly delicious, and you can say that you've actually tried that noble and classic drink, The Buttered Rum.  It's kind of like drinking warm and tasty egg nog.  The door is always open here, in a literal sense, so dress warm (or enjoy them buttered rums).  Pool and other game machines toward the back where they belong, and the men's room is really clean.

xqWuR-ngtiP7v4dn_XD6bw.review_text: Overall a pretty cool hangout. There were some vibes of "trying too hard" or having a manufactured bohemian vibe, but the drinks were stiff (not good tasting), and the prices were fair. I enjoyed the black bird stencils on the ceiling, and the bartender was friendly. Not in the most ideal location for return visits, but this area of Soma is almost pub crawl worthy with City Beer, Terroir, and Brainwash across the street. Granted, that would be a pretty random and expensive pub crawl, hehe.

WxwHJRntzBg3VumBYfVhZA.review_text: Super chill bar conveniently located near my place of work. Reasonable prices, good set of beers on tap, friendly bartenders. Good music, nice ambiance, plenty of seating.   Haven't tried any of the mixed drinks but from the looks of it I may have to give some of the whiskey libations a whirl.

yQYOlzzlEIc9VwVPHlPtAg.review_text: Bloodhound has become hands down my favorite bar in the city (and competition is stiff). A friend once asked why, and it's just because it flows at the right pace. Aside from the fact that they make great drinks, there's a certain je ne sais quoi about it. It's a chill bar without being divey. It's cool without being too trendy. There's a great mixed crowd so that you can't say it's a hipster bar, or a yuppie bar, or any other "insert stereotype here" bar. There's a pool table and a juke box, and dogs are allowed! Great food options nearby including the newly-discovered Chez Spencer food truck. (Yes, I only JUST discovered this almost a year later because I always make a direct beeline to Bloodhound.) And I always find parking nearby.   It's so awesome I have dragged many friends and introduced them to Bloodhound and they, too, love it here. I'm slightly shocked that the bartenders don't know me by name, or at the very least, don't immediately start mixing a Recoil when they see me walk in the door. All in due time...

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: the deer hunter's bar?...styling and decor that of a tahoe cabin....wilderness and wooden...birds above and antlers hung...quite the wretched stench of stale beers pungent...a full bar and mason jar contained beers served....fair pricing of $five beers and roughly $ten well...decent spacing for drinks and conversations....just turned off by stale stench lingering....

AFMCz8n65JMWQUClaYAMsA.review_text: Drinks are good, but bartenders can be rude.  Not too crowded on a weekday night, and a pool table and arcade game in the back.

jfyBHSgBWKDa51nO5js5pg.review_text: This place took over my favorite dive bar, Cassidy's, and for that I cannot give it a full 4 stars. That being said, it's a good spot to chill and chat with friends. It has an entertaining Big Buck Hunter arcade in the back. Normal beer selection with a few different varieties. The first bar I've had Moose Drool Brown Ale and it keeps me coming back for more.

MWb3pvssSuMgE2wsY6ZPDQ.review_text: My guy and I arrived here after going to some beer snobby hipster place across the street where you have to sit on cold beer kegs.. Anyhow, we finished the Centennial 12K of Bay to Breakers and it was turning into a lazy Sunday afternoon. We wandered in and pulled up to the bar. Keep in mind this is on a Sunday and we were leaving Monday afternoon to come back to San Diego.. So it was a nice comfy Sunday afternoon where most of the City's actual residents were passed out or playing basketball in costumes (like Catholic School girl costumes on a bunch of boise) in the park  I like this place for a host reasons, super friendly locals with dogs who would wander over to talk to us. Loads of TV's since I am a sports fan...I was practically orgasmic and great beers on tap. It's got a "hunting vibe and decor" to it which I am sure comes in quite handy after several grey hounds on a Saturday night.  Quite a few moody hipsters lounging and working on their laptops.  Our bartender was great and like I said, so were the locals. My husband and I had several pints purchased for us for finishing Bay to Breakers. Great place to spend a Sunday afternoon, sort of reminds me of the Whistle Stop in my 'hood.  If I were a local in SF, I can tell you that I would most definitely be found here with my dog on any given weekend daytime.

J52_6MJ_a9v0n2y3qv4zYA.review_text: There's a plastic gun pointed directly at my head, the bar girl has it pressed against her shoulder, digging into flesh. She's a lean woman, jet black hair and incandescent skin--a chest on show, shooting upwards. She wants me to know this won't hurt a bit, that I had it coming, brought it upon myself. Drawing her legs together, she straightens her stance, pulling inches for fear. An eye closes as she focuses in, the remaining lens wildly placed, honing in on my quaking boots.   "Run to your grave, kid," she insists.  And with the click of a trigger she has me beeped. An assumed death by way of flashing screens. Player two, deceased.

Ep3KDgEF3_WApurnGRi3mA.review_text: This review is based upon a 530pm midweek experience.  Met up with an old friend here who I had not seen in 4+ years, so we had lots of catching up to do.  Ergo, our venue criteria were: 1)  Avail seating:  Check! 2)  Noise-level to allow for normal conversation:  Check! 3)  Laid-back, non-sceney atmosphere:  Check! 4)  Friendly service:  Check! 5)  D-bag free patrons:  Check!  It was the perfect low-key, chill place with decent music and never a wait for the (nice & clean) restrooms, and since we were downing beers... well, you know...  Heads up that they don't serve real food (bartender offered up a choice of popcorn or beef jerky) & the wine selection is dismal, so if you want those features, go elsewhere.  The upside though is that the bar is apparently dog-friendly.  I spent a good 5 mins petting the adorable lab puppy whose parents were sitting next to us at the bar.

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: Great bar in SOMA. I love the decor and space here. It reminds me a little bit of Churchill in The Castro. The crowd is well mixed and the drinks are strong. They have cider here so I was happy about that. Cocktails were a bit on the pricey side.  And if you like lard, you can have some pork rinds with your adult beverage.  Gather some friends for a fun night and include this on your hop around the city.

OUd5cEYA6MXwBb8aNTEvMQ.review_text: Best place to warm up and hang out in that neighborhood! Cozy interior, fun bartender, mellow crowd, an entire wall of seemingly endless selection of specialty liquors!

SPc-Xgt4S9ZMm5Rnk-qEvg.review_text: You can't go wrong with a big bourbon selection and Big Buck Hunter.

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: I really love what they did with the space. Went on a Saturday night. It was packed with an attractive crowd. The bartenders were attentive and busy. The cocktail selection was good.  It was a great place to start the evening out.

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: A little bit of an older crowd than I'm used to, but I dig the vibe of this place. Strong, interesting drinks.   Personally, I would not go out in this area just for this bar, but it's a really great option if you're in the area already or live nearby... definitely breathes some life into this part of SOMA.

oTpmi6DjCotg0htLaETemg.review_text: A great bar in SOMA with a lot of space and great atmosphere. I come here every so often, and I have never had a bad experience.  Their handcrafted drinks are top top. Order the Recoil.  Apologies if you were there when this happened: On my birthday my friend bought me a bottle of cologne, I grabbed it from him and it slipped from my hands, shattering all over the floor. We left immediately.  My only gripe about this bar is the bathroom is crammed, with no lock on the door. So, If someone happens to be dropping the kids off, you'll walk right in on him. Would be much better if it was a single stall with a lock. -1  Sorry, I just prefer privacy in the bathroom.  No DJ or anything. There's music. Not really a bar for dancing. Great place to hang out!

VpREWOjt5Pna6OIgXI9Jcg.review_text: Best bar in SF for being so tastily flexible. And just plain tasty.  The Fella has guy-night here all the time. It's dark, lodge-like, and there's been a full-on pig-carving butcher session on more than one occasion for special events. The beers come in mason jars, there's a freakin' deer on the wall, and the wood paneling goes perfectly with the vibe.  That said, I've had after-work girls drinks here, too. It's quiet enough to gossip, and I've never had trouble finding a table for gabbing. The cocktails are pricey, but top-notch, with the Bloodhound and Ward 8 (bourbon, orange, lemon and grenadine) earning the top-tier spots for me. There's pretty artwork on the ceiling (painted black birds). Bacon-infused whiskey made an appearance once, and I keep waiting for it to come back.  A mild pain in the ass to get to, I must say. In what seems like the very middle of those enormous SoMa blocks, it's a ways off my closest bus route from work. But still well worth the effort.

FgGiQc9zpM_va5JZMvJtMQ.review_text: Lots of room to mill about, pretty decent beer selection, and always lots of interesting folks around. But all of that aside, the most delicious reason to come is the Recoil cocktail. It is my joy as well as my undoing. Cheers!

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: The bar is nice and roomy, but it never feels welcoming.  Maybe that's part of the Hipster motif it has, but I've never felt like it was a fun place.  That being said, the drinks are really good.  I've had the New Fashioned and the Bloodhound (with Tequila).  The first being their take on the old fashioned and it lives up to expectations.  The Bloodhound is a like Grey Hound with you choice of alcohol.  I like Grapefruit juice so i liked this drink a lot.    It as a pool table and hunting game in the back, both require money to play.  Service is okay, but not the most friendly.  Music in background is an eclectic mix of everything from Rap to Indie Rock.

NyvgGXILWDKCtCNCZlIa1Q.review_text: Oddball little bar that, at least on Saturday night, was packed full of hipsters.... loud as hell and twice as crowded! Seems to be going for some kind of "redneck" theme judging by the wooden decor and the "big game hunter" arcade game.  We also got jostled a fair amount due to the packed nature of the place.  That said, the beer was tasty and the bartenders were very helpful when I went back in to try to recover my sunglasses, even offering to call me if they found them. And it is at this point that I have to be thankful for the hipsters and their boney... selves, as a dude managed to sit in the chair where my sunglasses had fallen out without touching them at all! Good thing I didn't lose them in an Applebee's...

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: I was a little concerned when I noticed a Bauer bus parked in front of Bloodhound.  I wasn't in the mood for a party bus kind of crowd but luckily, they cleared out pretty soon after we got there.  The space was much bigger than I thought it would be with plenty of places to sit or stand around.  I liked the texture of the seating along the front area  and the walls, now that I think about it.  It was lodge-y and rustic without being too over the top.  I enjoyed my La Chouffes while listening to the random selection of music from the jukebox and chatting about nonsense.  I'm starting to feel at home around here.

pIo73J0a7bxCK7q9BHdkzg.review_text: Strong, delicious cocktails (we tried the Vesper and the Bloodhound), and my minature schnauzer is allowed to hang with me inside, on the couch, while I enjoy the wonderful surroundings.   Crowd was just the right size on the Thursday night around 11. Not too packed, lively, and everyone full of smiles and good company. :)

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: It's my local watering hole. But that's like saying it's my local bead store. How many times have I been here even though I live a couple of blocks away? Oh...twice. The number of bars I've Yelped is paltry because: (1) I'm not that much of a drinker, or (2) when I do drink, I make a serious commitment and then can't remember why my Hanes boxers are on top of my head.   As bars go, Bloodhound is relaxing if you can find an empty set of seats. That's a big "if" during the weekends because it attracts a lot of the young urban professionals who live in the surrounding lofts. I don't think much of the hipsters come here - which is a blessing - but I'm also not big on selfish, privileged, white-collar morons who hoard seats and then promptly ignore you as they tap pretentiously on their iPhones. Still, there is a hunting lodge vibe that's hard to resist.   Moose antler chandeliers. Georgia O'Keefe-type skeletal animal heads. Faded slat-board walls. Pool table, of course. And a nice long bar that manages to be packed no matter how eagle-eyed you get in trying to find a stool. I've had the Planter's Punch here, which is unsurprisingly a fruity drink, all dark rum and pineapple juice, but somehow it fits the laid-back setting on the stretch of Folsom that's slowly becoming a dipso-ghetto.   DRINKS - 4 stars...good for a parched throat  AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...hunting lodge-meets-yuppie haven...does anyone say 'yuppie' anymore?  SERVICE - 3.5 stars...pours 'em up just fine  TOTAL - 4 stars...get here before or after the evening rush to take maximum advantage

wQXRDOf7Wnu6K1cKO_bjzg.review_text: Come for an Old Fashioned, share a table with strangers, stare at the ceiling, and Stone IPA on draft.  Just fight the urge to play Big Buck, it WILL take your money and only 1 player works.

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: Cool vibe. Was a great place for after dinner drinks. Wasn't too crowded after 7 midweek. Pretty comfortable, awesome decor.  Loved our drinks.

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: The boys did it again...these guys opened another gorgeous bar with the right ambiance which welcomes all facets of SF inhabitants.   Video games in the corner and a pool table, too. In the front there are loungy cushy couches and coffee tables right next to stools and bar tables along the wall.  They don't typically go together but here it all meshes perfectly.  Add a well selected liquor collection and you have a chill and yummy bar.

cNnkxPaiXLzM_BqAloMecA.review_text: A-mazing drinks here. This place caused me for the first time in a long time to drink not beer for reasons other than lack of beer (they do have beer and the selection is decent for a non-beer bar).  I can't remember the names of the drinks we had, but everything was made incredibly well. Great ingredients, amazing selection of different bourbons and whiskies, and everything mixed just right. It's amazing when you find a place that really knows what they're doing and this place is one of those.  It feels a bit hipstery but that can be forgiven for the awesome drinks, tasty 4505 chicharrones, and fun bartenders.

uMl5XzLjg4oPuEl6oGbQcA.review_text: I left my tab open at the bar with my credit card last night. I came in today and picked it up. Soon after I get a call from fraud protection.  TURNS OUT SOMEONE THAT WORKS THERE TRIED TO CHARGE $200 AT A GROCERY STORE. I called to talk to someone about it but the phone just rings with no answer. I really hope the owner or a manager reads these reviews and handles this situation.

MU_bppwgP03jfpTo6vtZ5w.review_text: Oh come on.. you can fit another monkey in the barrel can't you?..   I knew that to write an actual Review (I use a capitol R to differentiate between a well thought out, researched, and based upon MY actual experiences review rather than either highly emotional babble or a summary of those who have written before me type review) I would have to experience Bloodhound on a busy weekend night. To be honest and true to my review I even went in... Alone!   I've always been impressed with Bloodhound. It was opened not too too long ago by a couple guys from Double Dutch and Ambassador. The name Bloodhound is originally an alias for the St Hubert (or Sleuthhound) dog. Though it is doubtful that that fact is why they allow K9 pets to roam as free about the floors of the bar as the beautifully painted black doves artistically appear to be doing across and around the ceiling. Bloodhound dogs were bred to to help hunters track deer and were rather homily pups quite honestly.  Bloodhound bar, unlike its namesake, is gorgeous. Repurposed wood panels the wall, paintings of bears and antler chandiliers are included in the decorations. The look is hunting lodge chic. There are high top wooden tables, bar stools, and comfy couches placed strategically near the front of the venue to take pressure off the bar itself.. But my favorite outside the dove colored ceiling is the lighting. The antler chandilier is very hip, but look again. The light bulb chandiliers (over the hightops) are too cool. I want them. And even the track lighting over the bar is both artistic and original.  The $9 coctail list is creative, not a renaming of the same cocktails every other bar serves but Bloohound originals with names like the Ricky Ricardo, the Recoil, Jack Rose, and of course, the Bloodhound- imagine that! Beers will run you @ $5-$7 but they are nice enough to list the alcohol percentage right next to the name.   After purchasing a Daq 1515, I picked a corner to observe from, wanting not only to check out the video game "Big Buck Hunter" (an awesome shooting game) but what kinda tunes were on the juke box (it was turned off for the night but it looks like a blend of bar favorites). I looked out over a sea of mason jars (in 2 sizes), martini glasses (specialty cocktails), and wine glasses (primarily containing extra strength beer) and realized how much more I loved Bloodhound after my mandatory Friday night visit. The crowd was more- well for lack of a bettert word- real than i'd seen on a Friday night in a SF watering hole in, well too long. There really was a bit of everyone. Every where you looked were flip flops and jeans. The ladies had on casual make up and down played hair. The men's pants were neither too big, nor too small. And it even looked like someone took a handful of UC Berkley boys and dropped them in for artistic flavor. My favorite foursome were the 21 years old girls -feigning nonchalance in a bar full of late 20's and 30 somethings. It was impossible to tell who was hip, who was professional, and who was on the prowl (except the 21 year olds of course). It was comfortable. And that C word I almost never use. I actually believe if Toby Keith's famous "I Love This Bar" had begun playing at 1:30 am Sat morning, that if by the 2nd verse, after the left right looks to see how all the other patrons were reacting were done, this crowd would've known the words and sung them proud.  Well I know one thing for sure... "I Love this Bar"!  Ps the male bartender was impressive- to say the least. And the female. I think Genuwine wrote a song about her that had a line "Is there any more room for me, in those jeans". She was HOT.. and yes I'm as straight as an arrow.. :-)

KURUGmYN2kwDpr6BcEcrRA.review_text: Came here for a Pork of July event - the event was awesome, but this review is for the bar.  This place makes strong ass drinks!!! That's all I gotta say. I had 3 drinks and was GONE. Woohoo!

K9E4zQSmE9KguCxCQZ42Kg.review_text: I was only here for about an hour but it was a cool vibe. Something about it reminded me a bit of Rickhouse but less pretentious. Laid-back, rustic setting and fun people.

li85I9BtJme3KAmN02CzEQ.review_text: let me break it down for ya:  1) roomy with lots of space to mingle and cool couches to chill out.  2) Well made cocktails, but they also have lovely Belgian beers on tap. the prices are ok, but the selection needs to improve.  3) No nibbles, but they allow delivery or pop next store to TripTych for their tartar and lam dishes. oh ya, they deliver in style!  4) Good location as you can start at Beer Store and then pop over to Bloodhound.   Ok, that about covers it, so head on over and enjoy

yCpE2Mf8RKdKjkhNxL7MVQ.review_text: $9 New Manhattan was tasty. Recoil was a bit too sour for my tastes. I liked drinks being served in mason jars and being reasonably strong. Comfy couches. Friendly people.

4JC8Q8aBIQVUBSniaSuLMg.review_text: I love this place!  Discovered Bloodhound a couple months back after a show at the Bill Graham and fell in love.  When I booked a room for New Years weekend at America's Best Value Inn and saw they were in the same building I was ecstatic and ended up coming to Bloodhound every night.  The bartenders know how to make a drink and the drinks list is fantastic.  They've got a nice pool table in the back as well as Buck Hunter.  And the decor is rad.  Blackbirds on the ceiling, neat old pictures on the wall.  They're also dog friendly and there were dogs roaming around on a couple of the occasions I was in there, which is perfectly fine by me.  I'm a huge fan of Bloodhound.

mkxCw6GsMZDu-44_aCQTHw.review_text: Bloodhound has really grown on me.  It's surprising to me when people call this a dive bar.  It's far from it.  1) Dive bars are dirty nasty places -- this place is nice, not fancy or anything, but has some cool decorations (take a look at the ceiling).  You probably don't need a tetanus shot before coming here or anything. 2) They serve more than just beer and booze straight up.  In fact, they have a great selection of alcohol. 3) They serve mixed drinks.  Their signature (and my favorite) is the Recoil. Their drinks are served in cool mason jars. 4) They have a drink menu... 5) They have a bouncer that checks ID.  They have "standards" here.  Oh, maybe that's a San Francisco thing. 6) Their drinks cost more than $2-5.   Anyways, it's quickly become a staple when I think of going to the city for a drink.  I could go for a recoil right now.  It can get pretty crowded, but still a great choice for a group.

QlqQ94_T1smEZbkl13X5gw.review_text: I used to come here ones a week. Today they didn't allowed me in their bar because I'm Russian and don't have American ID. What kind of ID  do they except from person from an other country? Still a mystery for me. Moreover, most of the time bartenders don't pay any attention to the customers, so u have to wait around 10-20 min for one drink. The only think I like about this bar is Ricoil, it's good, but it's pretty all.

hn1lMT-CmDoxYJL-DgfS7Q.review_text: Friend stumbled upon this spot and she highly suggested going back so we did one Friday night. I fell in love right away. Love the ambiance and the mason jar cocktails. Looking forward to going back again and again.

RQ2ZkfsL4C-5G449Qrv_Ww.review_text: I thought about jacking the antler chandelier but figured, one: it would require some technical thought much too serious in such a drunken state, and two: i would love to be allowed back again for endless free pretzels, beer in jars, and jolly bartenders with some of the best beards this city has seen. bloodhound has a great atmosphere, great beers, and a great big painting of an upright himalayan brown bear. excellent.

UzFpw5-JFekJ9nF8hI9ZSw.review_text: Gorgeous. I love the space, the tables, the lights over the bar, the birds on the ceiling. I also became a fan of the pisco punch. Damn. Two of those and I was ready to deal with the night. I hope to be back!

yR-6YxGdgNJTBfJtQ5CmRw.review_text: The atmosphere in here was great. Drinks are good and strong, bartender does a great pour. They have a pool table (a plus in my book!) You can tell it is a local bar, people who work in the area go here after their shifts but all are welcomed and pretty friendly. There is a guy outside who makes pizza we were told we had to try it, maybe next time it looked great.

u8XfoEhxnMHssS-huej0GA.review_text: This is a great local haunt. I rate the bar a 5 Sunday through Thursday but my rating drops on the weekend when the crowd roars in from everywhere. Dylan, Darren, Andy, Cortney and the rest of the team are an eclectic collection of bar-tending deliciousness. Prices are good especially in this city of up-charge, the atmosphere is fun and relaxed but don't be afraid to go in dressy (or in costume).  Best nights are week nights when the bar staff have time to chat or make you something creative. Weekends make for a good scene but it can get really packed even to the point where they stop letting people inside. Love that it is dog-friendly, love that Dylan likes to partner with local chefs to bring in food events, and if no pairings, feel free to order a pizza for delivery.

1D5EQITb4hOzPMZT8gDPQQ.review_text: This place generates a lot of hype. I'm not sure what all the critical talk is for, but if you're hating on the crowd who seems to make their way from all over the city to enjoy this spot, then stop being selfish and enjoy the fresh faces in SOMA. The hipsters can have all the other lousy bars around the area, or suck it up and share a little.   Now that I got that off my chest... Bloodhound is a good spot. I really like the atmosphere. There is something very comforting about a lodge type place with tables made of trees, mason jars for beer mugs, and antlers hanging from the wall. The place is unique for the city, which is why people make their way even from the marina to enjoy it.   I also thought the drinks were decently priced. I paid $13 for a mandarin soda and a bacardi and diet. Average in my book. Service was also quite good. I didn't have to wait long for a drink or to close out my tab, which is always a good thing (there are not many things I hate more than trying to get drunk at a bar and not being able to because you have to wait 20 minutes to order a drink!). So cheers bloodhound, I'll be back.

LS-bh3V6z3oSicEzNFaVYg.review_text: This place is good.  It's not a dive and I am not going to categorize the decor.  Drinks are good, don't care that they don't serve food, bring your own in.  Good selection of quality booze and Saison du Pont on tap. I felt comfy, it was early, I'm not one for late drinking.  The bartender was good too.

2UuNTFCDZPa3DImEA111fw.review_text: This place used to be a cool Irish dive bar, then it became Bloodhound and VERY hipstery.  Animal heads on the walls kind of trendy hipsterness.    It was difficult to get a drink at the bar, as throngs of hipsters wearing ironic plaid shirts were lined up to get their artisinal cocktails.  Some of the guys looked like they were trying to impersonate Paul Bunyan with their thick, ironic beards and plaid mountain man shirts.  But the skinny jeans and ten dollar cocktails gave them away. ;-)

zst5ol5eBsx-Uz6wfKDzAA.review_text: Very comfortable bar with good seating on most nights. But it does get busy so be prepared to stand. They have one drink with Bulleit bourbon and st germain that's amazing. I try to go as often as I can!

YNfIqZc1cnAuR7DbpH7yuA.review_text: good (not great) beer selection. above average liquor selection. retained one of the two pool tables (it used to be "Cassidy's") mason jars for serving is a nice touch. comfortable seating, 15 or so spots at the bar.  two doors to access smoking.

lBscNisM3cdiBYjDErkGdg.review_text: As Gretchen B. accurately noted, "hunt or be hunted." For those of you looking for a meet market, look no further. This place was crawling with lurkers, stalkers and creepers hoping to score. Granted, the crowd was overall good looking, but I felt confused about where I was in the city. Not quite as douchy as the Marina but definitely had a bit of that tone.   Positives are the bar is beautiful and clean, drinks are served strong and relatively cheap AND they have buckhunter, my new favorite game. I'd check out happy hour if I came back to see if it's a bit more mellow than a Saturday night.

1QzXWTu7PPtCYza4cYNTig.review_text: 5 stars for easy parking, potent drinks, fun-hipster watching, excellent outdoor grill pizza and a super cool bouncer!

GQDfSW8uCck0NIfw2AUc8A.review_text: Went last Friday and had a great time. Everyone from the door guy to the bartender and barback are all really friendly. The whole place is really comfy and fun. Loved the drinks and the arcade thing with the gun is great!

-lyK_baLjwT74_cOh2TxRg.review_text: I was pretty skeptical about this place when I first walked in. I was meeting some colleagues for an after work happy hour and this place does not exactly strike me as a place professionals go after a long day of work. It is pretty dim lighting and has relatively limited seating with no waiter service. My rating is biased because I was not anticipating this type of setting based on what I was originally told. I would probably go back for a Friday or Saturday night and have a good time but not an after work place for me.   One redeeming aspect of Bloodhound is the fact they offer Olympia beer. After spending four years in Seattle and enjoying Olympia thoroughly up there, it is refreshing to find some in SF.

CMBHaQsUyKpii4FAbSBi5w.review_text: Great place to come hangout with some friends on the weekend.

R_3FyHGwZ5bcPN8RAoeIKg.review_text: Bloodhound could easily be missed as you walk down Folsom. Although it has large windows and a substancial sign it doesn't immediately jump out as 'the place to go' - so it was most fortunate that I was invited to the Happy Hour there.  I was a little intimidated at first by the sudden darkness as I went in but as my eyes adjusted to the room I suddenly felt intrigued. This was not the Dive bar I had expected at all.   A beautiful solid bar ran down the right hand side of the room with stools at just the right hight for the various patrons to sit on and then rich dark brown wall seats on the left with what could only be described as rather 'fun' looking low recliners which were on wheels. The ceiling immediately caught my eyes with the shadows of birds circling overhead. Even the artwork had been carefully considered and raised an eyebrow with its diversity and tongue in cheek nature.  What really excited me though was the treasures that lay at the back of the bar. A fine pool table, begging to be played, a juke box with an incredibly diverse range of music and a 'Big Buck Hunter' game as well.  A bar is not made a decent bar by its decor though.  Luckily this one has just used the interiour to compliment 'its offer' - which is a wide range of spirits, some well thought out wines (not a huge selection - but well chosen) and a cocktail list which is best described as leathally excellent.  My favourite cocktail so far is the Ward 8 - which is made with excellent precision and flair by each of the bar tenders I have so far met. While if you are feeling like something without alcohol they can with equal dilligence whip up a fruity little number which will refresh and revitalise immediately.  The staff here are friendly and patient. Quick and skilled.  The space is large enough for a group of people to go drinking together although I would really not recommend having your gathering next to the pool table - unless you like being poked and hit with the pool que. :)  This is the place to go if you want a stress free drink with friends - the only bad thing to say about it? Those cocktails are far too easy to drink, the bar tenders far too good at making them quickly and the end result is you may go home significantly poorer.... ;)

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: Nice atmosphere, love the lighting, quirky bird silhouette pattern, and antler chandelier.   12.24.13

frFgM9DQbewbeMznT8FofA.review_text: I dig it.  Bloodhound has brought a bit of class to the neighborhood. It's got a funky feel to it, but nice and clean. The pool table is the most expensive I've seen @ $1.00 / game, but if they keep it maintained and nice cues as a result, then I'm ok with it...all part of the price of admission to maintain the higher-end atmosphere. I'm tight with the owner's of Julie's down the street, but they just wouldn't listen to me and put in a pool table or two...However, they need to PUT UP A CHALKBOARD so those of us who want to play can get down to it.   The jukebox is all over the map, but I'm happy to see The Pixies in there along with the classic rock and hip hop. I think they made it overly diverse on purpose until they feel out their demographic a bit better.  It will be interesting to see how the new place affects the feel of the area. I'm with Zak: hopefully it won't be a massive Marina magnet. In any case, definitely a great addition to Folsom!  Welcome to the neighborhood!

z0vR_1Qo3j8PCfH4Dj3Rzg.review_text: The bar was ok. Just ok. I was in a group of 6 and we came to the bar around 2100 and the place had no seats. When I went to order a beer I dont remember them having any on tab. The Drink menu they had  like 5 things on it...   But the price for drinks where ok... ooo yea they have one pool table in the back.

ZTAnKXdIYYu4MDh9chQjMA.review_text: I love me some Bloodhound.  Nice low-key spot. Rustic, hip space reminiscent of a hunting lodge; reclaimed wood tables, deer antlers and a pool table in the back. Look up and you'll see birds painted on the ceiling. Fantastic. Lots of seating available. Bartenders are friendly.  Great selection of beer on tap. Drafts served in mason jars. $5 Old Speckled Hen!  Wonderful whiskey selection. For cocktails, I recommend the Recoil or the New Fashioned, both bourbon drinks.  Dog friendly! Awesome.

KFLzx4nEktwovWfzHwAu0g.review_text: Solid local bar - good drinks, rustic ambiance and a pool table!

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: Awe-Some!  Definitely a cool little local watering hole that makes you feel like a regular the moment you enter it's cozily lighted den of delight. I loved the decor, especially the spray painted birds all over the ceiling (an idea I may very well steal for a room in my home someday). I thought the bartenders were super friendly and the Greyhound I ordered was one of the best I've ever had. The grapefruit juice was perfectly tart, but not too sour. After ordering it, I noticed the Bloodhound spin on the Greyhound and tried that, but have to say the Campari kinda ruined it for me, so I will stick with the original.  This is certainly a bar I will be coming back to. Mos' Def!

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: I agree with the other reviews. This place is pretty cool. I like the painted birds on the ceiling and the decor. Sort of rustic and vintage with an edge. We came on a Wednesday night and it was relatively busy, but there was plenty of standing room at the bar, no tables left. They have a pool table in the back. Everyone seems pretty chill and they have an interesting drink list, including bloodhounds!

SMgoll-WLgStC85ek_jBLg.review_text: GREAT neighborhood spot, clean, perfectly lit and absolutely unpretentious. Solid drinks, made with fresh squeezed juice should your drink require it, a pool table and SEATS!    What's not to like?

-LYGOcCot6cWeczltX0aPg.review_text: I don't know if it was a change in ownership orjust a remodel but the metamorphasis from cassidy's into the bloodhound is the best thing to happen to this neighborhood since the City Beer store.    HUGE improvement - kitchy, fun, different, and already too popular, but nevertheless.   I double dig dig it.

Jfukr448JYQuGIWqE6Th-Q.review_text: Bloodhound is lively for a Wednesday night. There's free wi-fi, a pool table and a tv (not currently on though.) the recoil makes you do just that. Love the decor, painted birds, filament bulbs hanging over the bar and tables and the drinks in mason jars are fun. Great place to hang with with friends.

DIb7yLPlpk8pV-kC2bHxxw.review_text: I was really excited to go to Bloodhound when it first opened because I had previously been to the stale piece of toast that was Cassidy's. I did like their 'Cheers" style four sided bar, but it was mostly filled with German exchange students from the hostel that was around the corner (is that even still there?)  Anyhoo, I came on the second day this place was open. It was crowded and full of people I had never seen in this neighborhood before; which usually means in a few weeks I will be able to walk in on a Thursday night and be able to pick any seat I want and have a very comfortable time without anyone bothering me.  Au contraire, mon frère! I went last night (Friday) and it was still full. Full of bike messengers and hipsters, the quiet and loud, dogs and one couple that was all over each other on the fun swively-wheely chairs.  Sorry - you loose a star for the expensive cocktails. Yes -they're good. But not that good. And I love the beer in a mason jar that gives it the moonshine-in-the-woods feel that punctuates the cabin-in-the-rough decor.  Both times I have had the same bartender. You're awesome.

D_XyDs6d4DXgIdObhHeZDQ.review_text: ***Good*** Ambiance, decor, cocktail menu. They also have a usually fun beer (draught and bottle) selection; not large, but solid quality.  ***Bad*** Can take a while to get a drink some times.   ***Recommendation*** Whiskey cocktail, or semi-rare beer on draught.

Lb37hatAjI3fgHEh2lMNEw.review_text: Crowded, and definitely "hipster chic" as far as decor and crowd go (antlers, seriously?), but they have great taps and they definitely know what to do with their bourbon. If it weren't always so stuffy in there, it'd be a perfect local bar. I came here just yesterday to see the Giants game (woohoo, 9-0!) and I was shocked that the bar wasn't overflowingly packed. There was even a sketchy (but delicious looking) pizza stand out front. They were baking pizza in a Weber barbecue! I've also seen the Chairman Bao bun truck parked out here, and of course there's Chez Spencer just next door. So if you like to get your drink on while you get your yuppie food carts on, this is your place.

WsVtyjU-5Xgzx9_NjLGK2Q.review_text: Damnit.  One month after opening, and the place is crawling with douche-bags.  Why the hell can't we get a decent bar in the SoMa that doesn't get overrun with striped-shirt-wearing assholes who work in the Financial Center?  Is it really too much to ask?

u-i5yTYzpPyKF3Ed8QvV3g.review_text: Ok, I'm totally expecting my rating to change but I really have to mark this low to start out.  It may not be fair to judge the Bloodhound on Folsom Street Fair Sunday.  I just spent 12 bucks on two drafts and you tell me that you've closed your bathrooms to your PAYING customers?  Christee on Crispix!!! You have an employee stationed by the bathrooms telling people to use the porta potties across the street.  Why not stamp the hands of paying customers and check as they ask to use the loo?   Hopefully I'll be back and be able to rate this as others have.

sP9W9AwHWPDVA1W11dcW_A.review_text: I love pretty close to hear, and this is definitely a great addition to the area. With some pretty solid spots around, such as city beer store, teroir, there needed to be a good bar with a solid punch. Bloodhound is exactly that. The bar before Bloodhound here was 'Cassidy's'... good bar, but a totally different atmosphere and ambiance... Cassidy was more of a mild hole in the wall. Bloodhound brings it up a couple of notches, and with it, attracts a crowd that's somewhat a splice marina and soma, but its not limited to that crowd only.. you get the locals in here as well... so its an interesting mix of people. Usually, a descent looking crowd in there... some nights get BUSY here. Esp the weekends, and I believe wed/thu can be busy here. Then again so can Tuesday, um, and Monday. Plush settings, comfy couch, dim lighting, pool table, shooting game and good music... a bar with a lounge atmosphere and feel. The perfect go to bar in the area. Also, a few days a week, there are food trucks, pizza ovens outside... I believe the Chariman Bao truck stops there on Wednesdays, and the pizza thing changed recently. Call them and ask. Great bar to grab food right outside, bring it in, chill on the sofa (if you find room) and have a drink with your food. My beer of choice here is Old Speckled Hen. Delicious! The drink to get here is 'The Recoil'... stellar drink: The Recoil 1.5 oz good quality bourbon (we use Bulleit or Buffalo Trace, but any good one will do; Makers, Knob Creek, Old Grand Dad, etc.) .5 oz St. Germain Elderflower liqueur .5 oz Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice Ginger Beer - Not ginger ale. Ginger beer is spicier and drier and makes a more balanced cocktail. Read about it here: sfist.com/2010/02/05/sfi…

tlY0QMQDyfjQAEwHnzvFnw.review_text: I knew that this place opened recently and I'm so glad I got the chance to finally go - it's great!
