I've been to a ton of bars around the city and this one is really unique...it really is for everyone:  It's not divey, it's not too loungey, not a pub, not a club...it really is its own thing.  Bloodhound has a hunting/outdoors theme, but it's done nicely with earthy tones and accents.  While you'd expect a place like that to be divey and dirty, it's not - it is rustic, but it's intentional and not overdone.  It's clean and comfortable; there's also a lot of space and the staff there is friendly and attentive.  Most bars in this part of Folsom are either leather, hipster, divey or a combination of any of those three things, but this place really does stand out on its own.  Bloodhound, thanks for being original!

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Ladies, Bloodhound is the place to be for Happy Hour if you're on the prowl for a sexy man.  I arrived around 530/6pm and the place was bustling with hot men coming from work for a good straight hour! After that though, it cleared out and became more of a night scene.    The drinks are sweet and the bartenders are sexy, in a cute hipster style way.  I had two bloodhounds, which are made with Hangar 1 vodka, campari, and grapefruit juice and one peach cobber (?? - I think that's what it's called), that was OK, but way too sweet for my liking.  There's not a hint of an attitude in the place - everyone is very friendly and I love all the wood detail and sofas at the front of venue.  I especially loved all the doves painted onto the eye-catching ceiling! So cute.  Definitely a great spot for a birthday party, date, happy hour, etc!

9fg9i7ke1NAGhf8W3e97VA.review_text: Cold beer in a mason jar, blackbirds airbrushed on the ceilings, antique-style light fixtures, cool crowd, good music and chill bartenders....ahhh....

YQP5MYkb6CQoyEf1jxVGuw.review_text: What a great little bar...cozy and comfortable with lots of seating and a pool table in the back. Amanda is a fantastic and super friendly bartender and will make you a killer cocktail. We had our company Christmas party here (yes I know it's March) and the whole staff was super attentive to detail and made everyone feel at home.

v0k97XEwlDWwUTt8M8CJ4A.review_text: Awesome place. Strong cocktails, drinks served in mason jars, dogs welcome, a pool table, dark hardwood, and big buck hunter. What is not to like?  Pretty chill during the week and starts to get busy friday and saturday around 11pm.  Great place to start the night!

dIgO4Or9l9J-yTDO-Em8BQ.review_text: Hunt or be hunted.  Bloodhound is a pretty awesome bar.  A manly-sexy-hunting vibe as other have mentioned.  This is what a lot of dive bars would be like if the others... you know... swept the floor, or cleaned the bathroom.  This feels like a place you can have an unpretentious beer in a jar without having to dress down for the occasion (perhaps pre- or post- dinner at Heaven's Dog around the corner).  The cocktails here were good - exactly how they were described on the menu (the bloodhound was a little sweet for me - I liked the recoil).  The star of the show though, might be the beer.  Everything we tried was super fresh on tap and the bartenders were excellent with recommendations.

WHP0UwXGrfPoU13PfRGPZw.review_text: Douche bar with one bar tender and 200 customers. Ready for a bro fest? Go here. Just dont plan to actually drink anything unless you are friends with the bar tender.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: Cool and somewhat unusual (for SF) hunting-lodge-ish sort of vibe, with a big antler chandelier, wood paneling, and a bunch of big comfy dark leather chairs & couches.  They've also got Big Buck Hunter and a pool table.  The booze selection is quite good - a reasonable selection of scotch, and a good selection of bourbon, rum, tequila, etc.  Cocktails are well-made, and the bar tenders are friendly and have a lot of character.  They fit the place well.  Reasonable beer selection on tap & bottle as well, and they serve them in mason jars.  Fun.  The place is pretty goodly sized, giving you lots of space to get your drink on.

pUkpP0JCdRzVXe9Fe2A48A.review_text: I was one of the friends that came with Jennifer L. below. Luckily for me, I was the only one not overdressed so I felt pretty normal. But our group definitely stood out. I liked the bar. I'd go back if I was a bro or in my mid to late 20s or early 30s with a big group of friends to chillax. Currently, I am not interested in getting hit on by creepy older men with receding hairlines. Maybe next time Bloodhound.

tl7BzUtnzAj_r1WYFXLiug.review_text: Evil is what you make it. I'm certain Bloodhound is the devil in disguise.   Both times I've stopped in for a drink, I leave totally wasted and satisfied. The bartenders are really friendly and answer all my annoying questions. Drinks are very strong and tasty.   I would recommend the Recoil, New Fashioned and the Gimlet.  Tuesday's are great  because it's slow but Thursday's are great too, even though it's packed.

0Chi_CzoTmkw1NvZg0sksg.review_text: If bloodhound was a pheasant field, and each of the happy-hour drinkers - of reasonable to strapping good looks, all from different identifiable neighborhoods - was such a fat regal bird, then a hunter's best friend would make easy work here.  And so the name Bloodhound is appropriate.  It's teeming indeed, but unfortunately, the clientele don't scatter like birds when you intimate you'd like to get a drink at the crowded bar.  Rustic, hip, densely-populated, and they serve up works of bourbon and rye art.  I recommend the "recoil."

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: Super cool interior. Excellent lighting... packed at 7pm on a friday =( but the bartenders quickly served everyone. Looking forward to going back and playing deer hunt.

73TXE_fzveZdb7zgL9TSjQ.review_text: If you ever fancied yourself making an excellent Portlandia character, then this is the bar for you!  Bloodhound oozes rustic chic with "put a bird on it" ceilings and drinks served in mason jars.  I don't think I'd really make it in Portlandia, though Bloodhound's good beer selection made up for it.

m7ulbgBB7Z-0STPpBMiOuw.review_text: I'm not really a dive bar kind of gal (in part because they all seem to have a faint or strong urine odor), but this one is not too bad.  We went here mainly to have Pizza Hacker pizza and find a place to sit and have some drinks.  If you can get a comfy seat near the front, it's not too bad.

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: This is my new neighborhood bar; its been almost a year, and in that time I've visited several times. i have to say, the doorman, the owner, and the bartenders are all super cool and extremely accommodating. Their is never a time when i feel unwelcome, or slighted because i am ignored (as can happen in any busy establishment). i was hoping this would be the way it turned out after some time, and happily surprised.   Cheers to the management.

XoZAVBsibEMkLRYgdOXl_g.review_text: This place is the best! Love coming here after school or work and unwinding. Couches and great seating, pool table, machine gun game. Yup it's good stuff

xts1GJq4PQ2Dj_-CrsvHWw.review_text: I dont know what to think of this place. Super weird crowd. I've never seen so many sexually ambiguous people in my life. This could be a plus since it was definitely good people watching. Lots of hipsters. Lots of thin suspenders.  The bar itself has a nice pool table and buck hunter, which is great. The interior did feel a bit forced and seemed baron and forced. Drinks were ok. Ginger ale drink looked really good.

N2J2xRi4pQWiz6Hege3B8g.review_text: The atmosphere is... upscale dive? That's a compliment. Good drinks and I've had great experience actually having a bartender acknowledge me or my group and work hard behind the bar. This is rare in SF where most "mixologists" exude the type of smug energy that'd send your business elsewhere. A little too hipster crowd for my style but a good place nonetheless.

DsyO2xOv3VjVO0OQQBb2IA.review_text: I am very happy that Bloodhound is my neighborhood bar. Even if I had other choices that were walking distance from my loft, I would still choose Bloodhound. Why? Because they have the best bourbon, rye, whisky selection. The owner is often there and is quite the polite and knowledgeable owner. And he's friends with Fatted Calf & 4505 Meats which means I automatically respect the establishment! And their cocktails are great. And I can get my doggie fix because they allow guests to bring in their dogs when it's not too busy. :-)  As a dog-lover I approve.

QkR9kMEjOdBNFuQ8I5mB4g.review_text: Bloodhound was an unexpected surprise. At a quick glance from the outside, I had just thought it was a local dive bar. Boy was I wrong.  The inside is western-themed, their music is rad, and the drinks taste great. I can't wait to go back again.

goZ-kSTFH5Ujpf54GwbaRw.review_text: i love that this bar is a few blocks away from home and right next to the french bistro truck.  A lot better than what used to be in this space (Cassidy's). Great drinks, hardworking bartenders (our bartender friday night did the bar round and didn't look up and added an extra drink w/o us having to repeat it), and I love the jars they put the beers in.   It's where yuppies and hipsters converge.

nGozHYFspeWe2DliD9GqcA.review_text: - Great ambiance: beers served in Mason jars, deer head fixtures on the wall, salvaged wood craft counters. Also video games in the back.  - Walking distance to BART and close to freeway entrances - Friendly bar staff - Large, clean bathrooms - Ample seating on overstuffed chairs and couches; you're basically going to a caribou lodge to kick back a beer - I just adore this place. A win for SOMA!

qXVoDDaR-PD-TwyOU42eIQ.review_text: I came here last week for a friend's birthday party and literally 3 out of 4 patrons were there for her... so I perhaps wasn't able to get the best scope of the scene. BUT, the decor is cool and the drinks are cheap. Despite being a bit crowded, the place is actually pretty big and you can choose to lounge on couches, hang at the bar, or play pool in the back. The only big downside is that there's no practical system for smoking. I personally don't smoke but all my friends were so I got caught in the hubbub. You have to leave through the front door and hope that the doorman remembers you or else he'll make you get back in line! Also, it was raining and there were no overhangs or designated smoking area... Oh also the jam jars they serve beer in are really cool.  One of many hip bars in up-and-coming SOMA.

hvjhcPOG8zuqqLOohDKBmA.review_text: You know, its really the experience that determines how well you like the place from the first impression. It was my first time we decided to go to a bar out in SOMA. When I heard bloodhound, I imagined a grungy dark and divey bar. I was oh so wrong.   The place is barely lit, the atmosphere was buzzing with people who looked like hipsters. Awesome! I looked up at the bird painted ceiling. Pretty cool!   Drinks were okay, I would come more so for the atmosphere.

muPKUHFQnK5_G55k48Avkw.review_text: Soft opening last night. Definitely loved the vibe of the bar with the reclaimed barn wood and rustic lighting. The smell of saddle leather seems to permeate (in a good way) and contrary to the awkward layout that was Cassidy's, the bar is really cozy and inviting.   They've got a great selection of whiskeys and beers which totally suits the lodge atmosphere. As a beer guy, it's great to see more and more bars taking care to feature interesting beers on their list and these guys had some phenomenal stuff like La Chouffe, Red Rocket and Duchesse De Bourgogne. They just happen to have Firestone DBA on tap as well, which is certainly a big plus!   The owners are really nice guys and certainly have a knack for creating unique atmosphere in their places. This stretch of the city has certaubky been lacking for good bars. Not clubs, not dives, not gay leather spots - just good, neighborhood bars. The only thing really missing is a fireplace...

ekRDjPK-WwN6mf42ajgbyA.review_text: So I was wrestling about the rating on this one. I really wanted to give it 5 stars but didn't want to become one of those false praisers that give McDonald's a 5 star rating. I want to be discerning. But after careful bullet-point consideration I can't think of a single thing I don't like about this bar.  Let's start with the most important thing about a bar, the drinks: They are good! They have a specialty drink list that is tasty and seems to be ever changing. I'm a whiskey guy and while their selection isn't the most extensive it has some quality hooch on board.  Prices: It is quite reasonable. I was there with a group of friends and it was something like $30 for 5 drinks. And that included one or two higher priced premium drinks.  Service: The really cool thing about this place is that the bartenders (some are the owners) are REALLY nice! I can't stand when I go to a bar, Ahem Pink Elephant San Diego, and the people who work there are just assholes! These guys and gals are awesome!  Ambiance: The crowd is definitely not the green as the valley 21 year olds that trash a place and puke outside. Classy people in their mid-late 20's all the way to late 30's but honestly diverse, mellow and polite. The taxidermy aesthetic is warm but original and lends itself to the hunters' lodges and workmen's bars of the Ozarks but with a pristine and fresh twist.  Food: They don't serve any but there is usually a food truck out front, pizza is close by and there is a newly anointed bacon-wrapped hotdog stand out front. PLUS!  love this place, it's our neighborhood bar. Love!

1qcq_VTO9fYIslCUwudlOA.review_text: So lets bring the backyard inside, shall we?  My friend and I stopped by this joint last night for a beer.  I swear it was like being in a backyard except we were inside.  The ceilings were painted of with black birds flying.  Cool joint, to hang out.  It was crowded, then again it was still happy hour.  Check it out if you are in the neiborhood.

XbgV6Gp1c0LEp312lUsEsw.review_text: Chill ass chick bartender! We got our drinks for hella cheap and big portions! I mean she filled it to the top! But some guy took off with our beer! But the bartender gave the guy a hard time about it! LOL!

_l-iAhD0N_GVIvFJqq0brA.review_text: super delicious hot buttered rum that tastes like candy ! i love the decent wide spaces on a weeknight. their recoil cocktail (bourbon, st. germain, ginger beer and lime) was a refreshing limeade with a gingery bite,  though i was eyeing the jar of those deeeeeelicious 4505 chicharrones, i resisted the urge because i knew i'd be able to eat the whole jar.  turns out someone else thought they could do the same and bought the entire jar's contents before leaving!  damn

9xi0QUx4e-HCMO1FifqDgg.review_text: This is my place in the 'hood! It has a comfy living room feel, unusual cocktails and is dog friendly.  Yep - you read that right - dog friendly.

urhy2vLd0VWRPz9D3JAYMA.review_text: Oh Bloodhound...it's going to be a love-hate relationship between you and I...  and not because I don't enjoy my time there, I do...don't get me wrong...but someone always seems to get into trouble whenever my friends and I are there...  OK...so maybe it's just me who get's into trouble most of the time but I digress...  The wilderness cabin theme, along with the laid back atmosphere, coupled with the well-priced booze is a recipe for trouble...in a good way!  You always feel at home here. One of the best places to go to, to just hang out, chill and have a good time with friends.

8UWvJ7_lcu8T0kAItiTbBg.review_text: I sat in the front corner last night on the big wraparound couch and was totally into the atmosphere here. Good lighting/color/texture. Understated and comfortable.   The antler chandelier over the pool table is definitely the crowning aesthetic jewel of this bar and I hope that the owners continue to add more elements like that to the space.  Eaaaaassssy parking and right up the street from Basil, if you are on the hunt for some good food, too.

Nc8kVGwETsaWhYn1lgMbKw.review_text: Awesome vibe in this place... nothing fancy, but very "under the radar" and hip. There was a huge dog as I walked in too... and I love when bar's have something random to remember them by. I'll definitely be back... I work only 2 blocks down so this could get dangerously fun...

2XbQIi87ySz7KSOI4RgCuA.review_text: As a lifelong "I Love Lucy" fan, I *heart* that they have a drink named  after Ricky Ricardo.  It's good, too!  (I guess it would have to be if it was named after Ricky, right?)  Herradura silver tequila, lime, and....well, some other stuff that I can't remember.  Their specialty drinks are mighty tasty, but they also have a good inventory of beers on tap.   I haven't been here on a weekend, but it's definitely a cool place to hang during the week.  It's spacious with lots of seating, so it works well if you have a large group.  Best of all, they serve no pesky food to get in the way of your buzz.  You can soak up the alcohol later at Extreme Pizza, which is only a block away.  Alternatively, The Cat Club is in the same block, so you can go dance it off if your timing is right!  I guess the only drawback for me is that their Happy Hour could be a little bit happier ($1 off a $9 cocktail isn't really much of a discount).  P.S.  Check out the cool black birds stenciled on the ceiling!

vapycpXukGZti5mHvPY7RA.review_text: Love Bloodhound!  It's my local neighborhood bar and I always enjoy stopping in for a beer.  They have fancier drinks and wide variety of beers to suit everyone's tastes.  Atmosphere is laid back and relaxed and there is always a diverse mix of people.  Only negative is that it can get crowdy and pretty noisy but hey, that's the sign of a good bar i guess!

AfJs0FA6CV_PKNkpol8rrw.review_text: I've only been here on weekdays, but I enjoyed it quite a bit. Think whiskey cocktails and beer, not chardonnay and vodka sodas, although I'm sure plenty of people order those things too. The bartenders are attentive and polite. Seems like the kind of place you could become a regular if you were so inclined.   The crowd was very mixed while I was there. A few second date types, gussied up before dinner. Some past happy hour businessmen. A couple of queers and hipsters. And even some bar-crawling monied Persians blinged out and celebrating a birthday. Everything and everyone goes.  If this place serves food, I wasn't aware of it. I sat at both the bar and in one of the lounge-y corners. I preferred the bar, where you can chat with the bartenders, meet more savvy drinkers, and avoid larger groups of people in which it seems like a dry hump session might occur at any moment.   Would do again.

qnF-Fo5VDP5Tp2PxFsBNkQ.review_text: Great bar, very open and chill.  The decor is cool and its very spacious inside.  bartenders are awesome and make great drinks.  Definitely the place to go if you want a laid back place to chill with friends!

ET8n-r7glWYqZhuR6GcdNw.review_text: A huge group of us ended up at Bloodhound on a Tuesday evening and the bar did not disappoint. After getting an intoxicating whiff of a whiskey-based drink, I had to order one for myself. The New Fashioned may well become my next signature cocktail. Made with honey instead of sugar, it was a cool spin off from an original Old Fashioned (no muddling), with a soothing taste.   The long bar offered ample room for ordering, and lounge-style and table seating made for a chill atmosphere. The lights were appropriately dim, providing gentlemen with the added courage to strike up flirtatious banter.   The juke box was appropriately filled with classics, although the volume was low until the wee hours of the night. I look forward to returning on my next trip to San Francisco!  Bonus tip: Check out the kitschy website complete with a fun soundtrack!

V55nvMINvyzuATsuQbCWhw.review_text: Bloodhound is a great landing spot for a chill night with friends.  Not the typical SOMA pretentious crowd and it's easy to get a beer at the bar.  They have Big Buck Hunter and my roommate shot a perfect round and went 30/30 in the bonus - bring it.  Pro-tip:  Just one pool table so get in line.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: Adorable concept. I felt like I'd been transported to a cabin in the woods (which of course couldn't be further from Soma, SF).   It's a hunter's haven, with an antler chandelier, animal skulls adorning the walls, blackbird decals on the ceiling, rustic wood tables and stools, and an ARCADE HUNTING GAME in the corner. (Some guy paid extra money and let my friends and I take it over. Thank you, sir! So fun to play when you're tipsy. Also, impossible to beat.)  A bartender who looked about 18 years old mixed me up a phenomenal gin martini. Impressive.  Expertly mixed drinks, fun decor and a packed bar at 7pm on a Friday evening = my new favorite spot in Soma!

Gph241TCaqg9pabCZiO1LA.review_text: I went to this place for the first time a few days ago.  I had no idea what to expect and then was pleasantly surprised because it was awesome.  I'm a total girlie girl, but I loved the rough, hipster, hunting lodge feel.  The crowd was casual, but no one batted an eye at the fact that I was pretty dressed up.  The bartenders took really good care of us and I would totally go back.

S2aLqy_qUspI2vN5HPXEZg.review_text: Great place to come play pool and kick back with some friends.   Can get pretty busy at night on the weekends or game days but the bar service stays moving and the crowd stays cool.   Happy Hour is great but the fancy drinks stay expensive.

-M4ZqHZDsA9vOt7UscVRpQ.review_text: Came here for some drinks-- loved the atmosphere and the decor, however I think came to early in the eve and the crowd was random.  I think it could be a lot more fun had we come later in the evening, but we were just after the happy hour crowd and just before the bar crowd so I don't think we got the full vibe of this place.  I did enjoy it though--It was nice to be able to find a table to sit and not be ass to elbow with five million of your soon to be closest friends.  I think I need to come back and give it another go.

4d-rRJvsTc2ukAU3n3ZpKw.review_text: I am not a local.  Came to SF for Dreamforce conference.  My friends and I really enjoyed the great beer selection at this bar, and I felt comfortable there.  I came back to have a drink by myself, relax and WORK. I went outside to have a smoke, I asked the "doorman" how far away I needed to stand to smoke.  He told me to stand past the ashtray on the sidewalk, which I did.  A few minutes later a drunk girl knocked the ashtray over and stood it up 3 feet away from where it was originally standing. The "doorman" called me names and told me I was an idiot and other patrons collaborated with him on something none of them had witnessed.  Even though the drunk girl made every attempt to tell him what really happened.  I was humiliated and made to feel very uncomfortable.  I will NEVER spend another dollar here nor will I recommend this establishment to my friends and/or collegues.  He called me "lady" (not in a nice way,) the little guy outside told me "not to fuck with his dude" and the drunk girl played dumb.  Lame bar.  Don't spend your money here.

Rdt-JiAN7Qlw3dJ7UVdNtw.review_text: SHOUTOUT TO RUDY!! Awesome bartender, super nice and freakin' COOL. (Don't wave your hand around like an IDIOT either trying to get ANY bartenders attention! *RUDE*)  Time for some drinks for the birthday boy! He decided on this bar because I guess it is sister bars with another bar him and his friends frequent.  It's hot up in hurr! And it's busy! I asked my friend if they have AC?? She said Nooo place really does, look, the WINDOWS are OPEN. ALRIGHTY THEN. SO I sweat it out.  They have a LARGE liquor selection.. Just not the type of liquor I drink. I'm a Vodka girl and the only flavors they have are like Tito's Citrus and Orange-type. First I tried the Citrus-y one. NOT A FAN!! I moved on to the Orange-y one. MUCH better.  I get wasted. And I have fun.  The end.

LE74E0-vCSu7-zpjwzVQIg.review_text: Way back in the day when I lived in SoMa, getting filthy on Natoma, Bloodhound was called Cassidy's, and I was a lot thinner and more innocent and pure because I'd never been near Double Dutch on a Friday night. So you can imagine that when the aforementioned was highly touted as a selling point, as a reason to come and not listed first as a reason to avoid this place, I was a deeply, deeply troubled.  It was a birthday what brought me here. A good friend, only months from marriage in fact and celebrating some god-awfully high numbered trip around the sun. And since birthdays are mandatory I went. And it was okay. Really.  It was absolutely not a shit show that collapsed upon its own gaudiness and drove you away in despair.  Aside from an unfortunate encounter at the jukebox where my music-snobbishness was unappreciated, (which is really my fault, I mean, I have to learn to let people be, who cares if they like radio R&B and Top 40 rap, I mean really?) everything was extremely not awful. My flight reflex was never triggered. Not once the whole night.  The room is really nice and  the layout is much better than before. I was there on a Friday night and so yes it was full of people dressed for a club and guys were 'sharking' - but that's to be expected.   Because remember people, the alternative to Bloodhound, is not some Platonic ideal of the perfect bar where the bartenders are cool, and no one is on the verge of puking after too many Jaeger bombs. No, no, no. The alternative to Bloodhound is the Holy Cow.   Yeah. So just shut it, and be thankful for what you've got.

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: Long bars make me happy.  A long line of stools begging to be sat upon, with bartenders at the ready - it's just a lovely sight.  And the decor - post-modern hunting lodge? - works.  If they just had a fireplace, I would probably never leave.  I came here for a Yelp event, and returned a few weeks later to check it out again.  As with most bars, early is best, and after-work hours give you the place to yourself before the crowds come.  I love a bartender who can make a great bourbon or Scotch cocktail, and they make them well here.  The bacon-infused bourbon is a fun conversation piece, but go with one of the other ones for real flavor.  In lieu of a chest-burning whiskey, a Mason Jar of Old Speckled Hen is a great option.  Definitely worth stopping in to wet your whistle - early or late is probably best, to avoid the amateur/chode-potential factor.

pH6xgMRXM4SpITexjATD5Q.review_text: Loved the space and i finally found a bar chill enough to have a pool table! Busy weekends and quite the crowd and waiting for drinks always dampers the evening.

rC6wWWFJyuvChCutO5LZgw.review_text: I got to check out this new bar last night because my friend knows the owners and I really like it!  It is decorated kind of like a log cabin/ski lodge, but in a way that manages not to be cheesy or dive-y.  To the contrary, the ambiance in this place is great...relaxed enough but still nice.  I can't say what the crowd will be like because it hasn't technically opened yet to the public, but the owners seem really nice and the atmosphere is on point.  So check it out!!!

PVFekEJidqcH3V55HqhIBg.review_text: came here on a sunday night of a long weekend so it wasn't busy at all. the ambiance is really nice with a very rustic vibe complete with a deer hunting arcade game towards the back. there's a pool table, a good amount of seating on stools around high tables, and a nice, clean bathroom. i loved the bartenders here - so sweet, genuine and down to earth. shoutout to rudy the bartender for looking out and keeping our water glasses filled without us having to ask as we were sobering up at the end of the night. drinks, except one, are all whiskey and bourbon based and VERY strong!

Afq57_KYVBBJlSj1X5-4xQ.review_text: What a ceiling.. what a cool ceiling..  Popped in for a sunny day sunset toast. Service was swell, cocktail options abundant (applause to the stocking of fresh mint, you're a class above), but the main thing is, nice ceiling! On a canvas of off-white paint, there are aggregates of stenciled birds. To me, it really makes the space, which otherwise is (to my untrained eye) just the avg bar set-up. Ah SF design nerds: Props to the bar that makes one intermittently look upward n' dream of seascape flutter.

Vgh-CjwAl4tFleP39OdzaA.review_text: I liked this bar. It was spacious and had a good atmosphere. The crowd was cool & the bartenders were awesome. Has a pool table for entertainment as well.  One of the few bars in SOMA that I could see myself frequenting.

_fb2pni0aZLpcFVmR-_7zA.review_text: yelp / your location is in the wrong spot!!!!   this cool bar is next to raven.  yelp dropped the market next to the auto place oil can henry.  love the drinks- many good options and a good strong selection of whiskey/bourbon cocktails on the menu.    the place is a bit set for mission type folks, and the occasional infiltration of techies.  I guess my group fell into the latter.

Dussqojz-FcaO6QkkQ2g6Q.review_text: I've been here a few times now and I have to say - each time has been met with a good evening.  The last time I stopped in was during happy hour on a Thursday, and enjoyed the cuffs and buttons cocktail.  We found an open stool at the bar, placed our orders, had a few sips, turned around and found an open table.  Moments later a tiny dog was in the bar, and then a huge great Dane.  If only one had been a bloodhound.  It's dark, laid back and riddled with savory specialty drinks.

sbgQVK0ObJtxJ5BZOceHfg.review_text: Fantastic bar located on Folsom right near Basil Thai restaurant (a great place to go to dinner beforehand!) Bloodhound has no cover, is spacious, and has this cool dim decor. There are high tables in the back where you can chill at, and getting drinks isn't that challenging at all. They have a bunch of interesting drinks/shots that are the bar's signature drinks, be sure to check those out. It does get packed on Friday/Sat nights, so be cautious of this. Just make sure you come early enough, like 10/10:30pm and you'll be fine. You can easily stay here the whole night and you won't get bored. There are mason jars, birds on the ceiling, interesting chandeliers (I think horns/antlers), and dim lighting, like I said. It feels very antique, but not in a run-down way. It's kept really nice and modern and new- definitely go!

_389Xo9hS6IOoWM7gW2TjQ.review_text: This place is my local stomping ground. My favorite bar in the area. Before they gutted the interior and re did the whole place, it pretty much sucked. Now however, it's awesome. Great alcohol selection, reasonable prices. Staff is hella friendly. They've got a pool table and some legit arcade games. Also has a juke box which is always a plus. The crowd is highly diverse. You've got your blazin hot marina type girls that get all decked out. And you've also got your tattooed and pierced hipster chicks rocking a bad haircut and hoodies. Either way, everyone gets along, and creates a super chill vibe that pretty much everyone can dig. Highly recommended.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I only thought this place was ok, but I know a lot of other people who would really really enjoy it!  CROWD: My friends and I were a bit over dressed because we wanted to go to a club.  Our only friend who actually lived in SF told us that she came here a lot to "pregame" for clubs, which is why we came here looking ridiculous.  I didn't care that much.  I like dressing up!  It was kind of annoying to have people give dirty looks though.  Sorry I left my plaid shirt at home?  The people here definitely were not yuppies, but they had to know that they were kind of paying a lot for what they were getting?  Just seemed like a bunch of hipsters who thought they were cool for being at an alternative bar that's not a full on sports bar or whatever.  I'll explain more later.  AMBIANCE: Anyway, that was not a big deal.  This place had a cool ambiance.  Although it looks like it would be a manly masculine amurrican place to be with the log cabinesque decorations / antlers / stone ipa on tap, it really was... not anything like that at all.  In fact, this place reminded me of Urban Outfitters.  There were black birds painted on the ceiling, antlers for chandelier lights... all very "urban".  Very hip.  Still, if you didn't know any better about retail / interior design, you'd probably be easily fooled into thinking that this place was a real manly place.  My boyfriend and his friends would have probably thought this place was sooo cooool.  SERVICE: Awesome!  Very fast... the bartender was actually nice to us, unlike most of the other people at the bar.  A lot of old guys came and teased us because we seemed out of place.  Whatever.  Anyway, even though the place was PACKED, the bartender could pretty easily pick out who hadn't ordered yet.  They seemed to have a pretty efficient system going on there!  Would I come back here again?  Probably!  Probably with some friends.  To people watch.  To people watch the "hipsters" who think they're so "alternative" by going to a bar like this, but are actually paying just as much as they would at another loungey-er bar.    My reviews have gone to shit lately... my bad.  Verdict?  I liked the bar, but not all the people in there besides those who worked there.

S5WQcThM04eH7Eu0YJ1a1Q.review_text: I got to check out The Bloodhound bar last night (it opens next week), and this is going to be a good one, guys. The place is built to look like a modern hunting lodge with walls of beautiful raw wood slats fitted together in interesting ways, chandeliers of woven antlers, redwood slab tables and a ceiling alive with stencils of small birds flitting about.  There's a long bar on the side for sittin' and drinkin', a small lounge in the front and most importantly, a pool table in the back for shootin' some stick. Dylan and Mike are true visionaries, and there's no doubt this will become a good neighborhood bar for friendly Soma folk. No DJ to ruin the mellow vibe and no dance floor -- just a simple artisan cocktail menu, as well as some obscure exotic and local brews.   Find me here bolted to the bar stool, whisky in one hand, pool stick in the other, singing along to the jukebox tunes.

fHS0bQ-l5rHME_xXKQSYXQ.review_text: I think it's safe to say that I was a little light on the nuances of Big Buck Hunter before I stepped into Bloodhound last night: consider that a situation resolved thanks to compadres from Portland and Brooklyn who proceeded to blast away at everything on that screen like so many drive-bys. There's quite a bit of shooting going on in what appears to be Montana. Just sayin'.   Bloodhound is by all accounts a cozy by way of hip spot to nab a cocktail or brew, and as a professed beer nut I was only too happy to explore what they're pouring these days. In the end I settled for a North Coast Pranqster and a Sierra Nevada Holiday IPA. Tasty. Waitstaff was quick with a pour -- and if I were around more often, great place to catch a game and a cold one, natch.

KheemzNvPqrxDtOqdrOQ5g.review_text: Very neat bar on the edge of Soma.   The decor alone sold this place to me immediately, and the fact that I found this little place in an area I usually tend to avoid made me happy. Pool table, buck hunter, earthy and rustic decor with that Brooklyn hipster vibe, bloodhound emits the whole "I don't really give a damn" vibe.   Bartenders were super cool, I think cute? I don't remember, they got us pretty hammered. Great custom drinks if you want, and FRANZISKANER (yay!), and immediate win in my drunk bitch book.

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: This is a huntin, and yes I said huntin lodge. I am from Texas, what do you want?   Ok, so this place is like every hunt lodge in the south, minus the games and tables in the back. Greet woven faux leather couches that you can sprawl out on. I was there under odd circumstances, however they pour a mighty stiff drink. I would go back, yet I am not sure how well the dead carcass motif will go over w/ the hipsters and SOMA people. It is an odd mix of people to be honest, yet this is the city, so anything goes.

3CHphjJcE6MSs9aLW-X8AQ.review_text: Extensive list of whiskey cocktails and laid back atmosphere.  Not the best whiskey sour I've ever had, but am game to try one of their signature cocktails in the future!

qthtyjV-1dHIApNHtWB40A.review_text: Huge fan of Bloodhound, first went for a friend's birthday, then decided to have my birthday there. I emailed them a month in advanced and asked if they could reserve two table for my party (they said no problem & there was no charge!).  Has the feel of a very upscale dive bar, but isn't divey at all...hard to explain. There is an antler chandelier on the ceiling and some birds too. They also play some pretty good music, even though I do not remember what they played.  They have a little lounge area in the front. It doesn't get overly packed and the crowd is pretty mixed. We had the first table reserved, so my party took over that whole area, everyone had a great time. I brought light-up ice cubes, and they were a big hit!  Love Bloodhound, just wish I lived a little closer, will definitely be back soon!

dmwKonxsy20ZfHWx5mokyw.review_text: Tasteful beer selections. Fair, legit, no nonsense bar tending and respectable mixology. Mind your business type of joint.

zYeaiRR83FqKKyrE5KERmA.review_text: Five stars because the place does better-than-fine with a basic theme, and the bartenders are good people.  They're not trying to be Bourbon & Branch, Alembic, Nihon, etc.--just a casual place with a sense of personal style.    And that works, because what you *don't* have here is what you have in all those other places:  childish hipsters, attitudes, aggressive professionals, and people trying to up their social IQ by sipping at a "whiskey bar," etc..    I've got nothing against those other places, but some nights the crowds at those bars are more than anyone wants to handle.  And, most often, you have to go to those bars with a group, or at a least a friend, so you can muscle some space at the bar, get a table, and so on.  Bloodhound--don't have to worry about all that.  Some nights it gets packed with industry happy hours (tech, arts, film, more), but on most nights you can find a place, even if alone, and talk to the owners and bartenders--all of whom know something about what they're serving you.    It works as a space, place and bar.  And, these guys just bought the old Transfer @ 14th and Church, and are opening up another bar (with different name, of course).

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: I like coming here from across the street after City Beer Store closes. It's pretty relaxed and not too snobbish, with a good selection of beers.

xVlX2zA7kWYBDjhYyNQXHw.review_text: I love this bar.  Usually don't travel to the SOMA unless we visit a homie that lives a few blocks away, but this bar is awesome. Decor is will remind you of a American country cabin with its wooden interior, brews served up in mason jars, and copious styles of whiskey.  Sorta divey, but nicer. Bartenders are usually pretty friendy, great artisan cocktails, and if you thought hipsters only congregated in the mission, then you ain't seen nuthin' yet!  What's awesome is that they have Buck Hunter. nuff said....

qqKddLtLxbPnTf6c7yqS3g.review_text: good dive bar  Buck Hunter with a Recoil (Bulleit, St Germaine, and ginger beer)

UzO_9SHVaCPsT3KZbbQ0gg.review_text: This bar is great, probably one of my new favorites, i will definitely be back, it would get 6 stars if only it was in the mission, amazing selection of beers, from all over including some English and Belgian beers on tap! on tap! super nice bartenders, and a really thoughtful design for the decor.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: Correction: it's the Carter BEATS the Devil. My bad.   The drink is served a little different since the last time I was there. It used to be over the rocks in a highball with a salt rim. Now they went all frou frou and serve it in a martini glass. Strange. The actual drink tastes the same, in case you were curious.

LRjAzKAISn8pVjJL09JJKA.review_text: WORST bar service ever! And on a Wednesday night! I was ignored by both bartenders for over 10 minutes. I can get a drink faster at Zeitgeist--even on Saturday night. Bloodhound is too loud to have any kind of conversation. Pretentious, overpriced, and loaded with yuppies--too much like the Marina. Skip it!

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: Good. Went on Friday after work and it was fairly crowded at the bar (we waited about 5 min for seats). They also seemed to have a shortage of menus because I had to ask someone for theirs and returned the favor a few minutes later for another person.  Cocktails were tasty though not as imaginative as a place like Tradition or Swig. Bartenders were just okay, not overly friendly and took a while to get their attention for our second round.  Decor is really great. They take cards. Pretty loud so I wouldn't recommend for a first date/catching up with a friend. It's not close to my apartment and it's a solid 15 min walk from my office so I likely won't return unless I find myself in this area again.

MAatw6IQHYCqeATbHHMz1w.review_text: Unpretentious, below where I stayed and has a pool table.  If  I stay close again in the future, nice place to just hang out and chill with friends.  decor is interesting with window views of sidewalk people.  Since this is in Folsom this can be interesting in some nights.

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: Fell in love instantly with the decor. Made me regret texting all my friends about this awesome new bar I found by serving me the worst mojito of my life. Regained my trust when another bartender made me a drink and told me he would make me a new one if I didn't like the first one. QUIT PLAYING GAMES WITH MY HEART.   Also is this a gay bar because if it isn't then it should be.

6xl9EVLg1MTwq4gw21e4Nw.review_text: In a world where you wish to kick back and sip some good Speckled Hen out of a mason jar, Bloodhound is the place to be. Like many have said, just plan to be chill. This place will entertain you in more ways than one. Let me count them for you:  1) This place draws an interesting crowd filled with late twenty-somethings. The dudes in their J. Crew collared shirts and Lucky jeans. Girls I couldn't quite put a finger on them...most looked frumpy. But interestingly enough we found two dudes matching in lumberjack flannel shirts playing Big Buck Hunter and a group that we had a hard time deciding whether they came from an 80's party or wore white blazers over neon blue v-necks on their spare time.  2) Big Buck Hunter arcade game + pool table. Enough said.  3) Look up. Really. The birds painted on the ceiling will freak you out because they look so real.   The only real peeve was the music was forgettable. Other than that, a well established joint.

4tXlSin5V3iTEC_N3s7KgA.review_text: Had a fantastic time last night! The Recoils were delicious! You can't just have one... The rest of the drinks looked amazing. I want to go back and try them all. The atmosphere was very chill. A perfect place to grab a drink to unwind and just have great time. The Bartenders are friendly, efficient, and really make the effort to take care of everyone while still making delicious drinks that keep everybody coming for more.

BzP-xGII8xxKfg_CPCO_ig.review_text: So we decided to come here because we were tired of dancing and wanted to sit, relax, have a drink, and just chat.    The decor is nice.  I think that that was the best part of this place.  The bartenders were so sarcastic to the point of being absolutely rude.  We had a really large group so we were deciding on what to drink, and they started pouring when we were still unsure of the number and charged us even though they poured us more than what we had wanted.  And they originally said they couldn't make the drink for us, but did anyways.    This place is lucky I even gave it 1 star, and that's for the decor.  Beware of bad bartenders, IF you decide to go here.

LoPLA6Qp-zyX_aNIboOQPw.review_text: 5 stars. I'll tell you why:  * Old Speckled Hen. Best beer I've had in a long time. I hesitate to say ever, but damn it's sweet.  * Big Buck Hunter. Awesome video game when you're drinking. Fits the decor really well.  * Decor. Speaking of which, it looks like if Tahoe and Aspen could somehow grow genitalia, boink, and sprout a child, you'd have Bloodhound.  * The Bar. Drinks are well poured. Beer is well chosen. A lot of good ones besides the Hen.  * Pool Table. Every bar should have at least one table. Seriously. No, seriously. I'm looking at you Chieftan.

mdx82mvtPCAUnjoDzE-GEw.review_text: Affectionately renamed "Blackout Bloodhound"  I don't know what is in the bourbon here but whether I have 1 drink or 3 at bloodhound, I never seem to remember parts of the evening....  The bourbon galore and friendly attitude of the barstaff/owners drive this place to 4 stars and make it worth the trek. No matter how deep at the bar  I can always find a bartender looking out for me, they are always happy to refill my water and always friendly enough to suggest a budget bourbon if the night calls for it and they always pour stiff drinks. The Chairman truck on Wed with the pork belly buns are a must.   I've been there on a Wed & a Sat, always starts out lightly populated and ends up jam packed. Crowd is super friendly, chatty and down to earth. No douche-bags in site - let's keep it that way.  One less star for horrendous acoustics, you have to yell in a whisper position to communicate after 10pm but by that point you won't know what is going on anyways...

DNximAZhOjZlYmj1BBCm7g.review_text: This place was alright.  It was pretty late when we got there so there weren't that many people around, which was fine by me.  There was some random guy that wouldn't stop talking to me though, and that was annoying.  What was worse, he was talking about high school football -- I think it was talking about how HE played, which made the whole conversation that much worse.  My friend managed to hop in and give me a conversation out before I punched the guy in desperation though, so that was good.  (he wasn't hitting on me or anything, just being punch-me-in-the-face annoying is all).

5gPHzeTDLFfEkepnybRxRg.review_text: In SF visiting for the weekend and fell I love with this bar. I want to move it to my hometown. Every bartender was great. The service was perfect and the drinks didn't skimp. I also loved how dog friendly they were. Wish I could have met Floyd the Great Dane. I heard so much about him.

skjkxo7Ewz3cbxW4TQNK5g.review_text: Perfectly chill/non-pretentious/laid back place to grab some happy hour lovin' ... And by lovin' I mean quality cocktails, good friends, cool vibe and an overall good time. Well, not "good time" ... but good time. Oh sheesh.  Whatever.  Order the Recoil (some potent killer mix of Bourbon, Elderflower, lime and some other goodness served up in a mason jar), shoot some pool and have a happy hour.

oQwgxgV7FzuMPv6T5dVWsA.review_text: Good alcohol selection, great crowd, pool table, and jukebox! I like this place a lot and it's always an option for a chill night out with friends.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Being a lover of anything involving Campari, it's all about Bloodhound's rum Negroni. Like Penny Lane once said, "Give it a try, it'll change your life."

ipoJv9uuT3WgjeVozKUx8A.review_text: Went here again last night for a farewell happy hour with co-workers and still loved it!  It got a little packed this time, especially with a reelection party happening simultaneously as we surfaced up the latest office gossip.  The Pimms Cup was still so very delicious and everyone else seemed to love their bloody mary's enough that they indulged in two or three.  Three cocktails and it only came up to 15 dollars.  Not too shabby.  It's still has it's charm, and I did notice the fun hunting shooting game in the back.  But I would've much rather shot the bartender and took him home with me.  MmMm.  Next time I'll wear my camo gear.  Happy Hunting!

J7Gz9tg_npfuCQbYopv_ww.review_text: nice bar, with a pretty cool vibe. well worth checking out

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: It's hard for people to take a good hard look at themselves and own their shit, good or bad.  The vodka sodas I had here pushed me over the edge of the cliff and straight down into PENISFAIL VALLEY, and as much as I want to blame Bloodhound for not being like a vast majority of other bars in San Francisco that make ridiculously weak mixed drinks...I can't.  I have no one to blame but myself.  No excuses and no calling "do over!"  I'm the lush that chugged those drinks down to end a night of already ridiculous drinking and loved every last drop.

AZU2-7FC4DwfaOwOd_Y2RA.review_text: My first experience at Bloodhound a year ago was a positive one. My most recent one was so bad, I left in tears.  My friends and I were at Raven next door. One incredibly intoxicated friend disappeared from the bar and wasn't answering his phone. He is from out of town and doesn't know his way around the city. It was pouring rain. Figuring that he may have ducked into Bloodhound, I headed over there.  Now, I'm a pretty polite person. So I asked the bouncer, "Excuse me. I'm looking for a friend who is lost. Do you mind if I check if he's here?"  Bouncer: "No, we're closing."   He then proceeded to violently push an intoxicated man out the door (no clue about the man's previous behavior or if the push was justified, but at the time the man hadn't done or said anything)---directly into a girl. Yes, he violently pushed someone into an innocent bystander. The girl was struck in the face and was very upset. The bouncer apologized to the girl, said "stay out!" to the guy, then turned to me and physically removed me from the door frame (didn't ask me to leave, just strong armed me out the door.)  Me: "Sorry, do you mind if I just scan the room? He is very drunk, from out of town. I'm just trying to find him."  Bouncer: "It's not my f****** fault you lost your f******  friend. That's your f****** fault. Now get out."  ...............  Completely uncalled for. I was sober. I was polite. I wasn't disorderly. It wasn't after closing, but a few minutes before and my request to scan the room would have taken all of about 30 seconds. People were still seated, enjoying drinks. There was no reason for his atrocious behavior. I've since tried calling the bar to speak with a manager four times. Each time the phone rings and rings and never reaches a voicemail or a person on the other line.  Horribly unprofessional and I won't be back.

LYKp6znYQovkQrFpi6ZCXg.review_text: A hunting lodge for the SOMA crowd  Take a comfortable dive bar and mash it together with a hunting lodge and you have Bloodhound. Pretty straightforward bar with high quality bourbon and spirits, a few meaty salty snacks consisting of Whisky Sticks from The Fatted Calf and Chicharrones from Ryan Farr's 4505 meats and a nice open feel to it, unless it's packed like it typically is wed.-sat. This bar has tons of open space, some cozy high-back chairs and 2 couches you could get lost in on a cold sunday afternoon while the rain beats down outside.   If you're looking for sporting, as any good hunting club should offer, there are 2-3 flat panel TVs that are tuned to sports, a nice pool table in back with plenty of shooting space and, of course, what's quickly becoming the new 'Golden Tee' for modern bars, the video game 'Big Game Hunter' where you can show off your marksmanship skills and take down an electronic deer or two.  Bloodhound features some 'whole pig' and other special cooking events from local butchers and chefs and I'm told that San Francisco's Bull Moose Hunting Club meets here the first tuesday of each month for socializing and planning hunting outings.

vjwLL41-EOQQkLSonUMdGw.review_text: Another one of my favorite bars in the city, Bloodhound is another quality establishment for Prohibition-style drinks, styled much in the way of a traditional hunters' lodge. Big Game Hunter in one corner, mounted deer/moose head in the back, pool table, and crowds of hipsters all amplify this effect greatly, for better or for worse. The only thing that ends up feeling a little out of place are the nice sectional couches that line the windows towards the front, but they're comfortable enough that I can't really complain, especially given the lack of low, accessible seating otherwise.  The majority of their drinks are served up in mason jars of varying sizes, which is kind of kitschy, but neat nonetheless. And with most priced at under $10, they're right around the same price point as equally enjoyable Rickhouse. Having tried the Recoil (Bulleit bourbon, St Germaine, lime, and ginger beer) and New Fashioned, I can highly recommend both - and the rest of their drinks are probably pretty good bets too.  ***Accessibility Info***  Venue - With a very spacious interior, people shouldn't encounter any problems getting in or around the lounge. The bar is, of course, standard bar height, but the end furthest from the entrance is actually standard table height, should you need to garner a bartender's attention.  Bathroom - Semi-private men's bathroom. I say semi-private because it's a single room with two urinals and a toilet, but there's no lock on the door, so... use at your discretion, or have a friend stand watch outside. Otherwise accessible, though those with wider wheelchairs may have trouble getting inside due to the side privacy panel of the urinal closest to the door.

aZ7mxYh8niIIsX6_HPb2mQ.review_text: Went here with friends for the first time last night.   No cover on a Friday night which is nice. It was dark and loud, the music was all over the place. I couldn't quite put my finger on a theme for the bar.   Hipsters galore, a specialty drink menu, an almost-old-west theme, but with a mix of salsa, hip hop and disco music playing...   I would def go back again, I had a great time.

lX89A57ZsdTGx2BXaVLlYQ.review_text: "What whiskey will not cure, there is no cure for" -Irish Proverb  That makes Bloodhound like your friendly neighborhood doctor's office.  The owner, the bartender with the awesome stache, is the gatekeeper to all that ails you.  Drop-in hours are ALL THE TIME. How convenient is that? With no appointment needed, there's no excuse not to get a regular check-up.  Medications include Bulleit Bourbon for malaise, Laphoraig for fatigue, and Maker's for inhibition.  Co-pays at Bloodhound are low, and other patients at the bar often pick up the bill on your behalf!  And you know your doctor is quality when there's a pool table (exam table?), cabin-like waiting area, and taxidermy (to make you feel lucky to be alive.)  Guess my biannual medical check-ups will soon become biweekly (or more!) Which means that I may be showing up more frequently at my actual internist's to have my albumin levels monitored.

NJezMVviExVTeNux2h0bow.review_text: I've only seen this place get super crazy right after The Strokes played at Outside Lands.  The band came to hang out at this bar apparently--something we weren't anticipating as it's no where near GG Park.  They brought an insane group of people with them and dominated the bar.  They also opened up their tab for a couple of hours, so no complaints there.   They make a great mint julep (random to drink regularly, I know).  And the decor and pool table in the back makes this a really chill place to hang out.

e7B7IsZlRT8LbFj8FcY78w.review_text: I love this bar. I've hosted a few work happy hours here, and they have always been a big success. The executives like it because it's clean, there's room to sit, and lots of big windows. The workers like it because it isn't pretentious, and they've got a pool table and Buck Hunter. Overall, I think this is a great bar, with friendly bartenders, and I like to go here as much as possible.

FdHXGtwkYHwnisOjaXSyGQ.review_text: Great bar. Not as charming on weekends where seems a little fratty. Its hard to appreciate the decor when the house is packed. Early to midweek when its patronized with more of the folk that have the pleasure to say that Bloodhound is their corner bar is the way to experience this gem. The test of a good bartender (in my opinion) is one, their margarita and two, knowledge of a proper Sazerac. The sazerac was proper.  Generally im a beer and a shot kinda guy and for awhile Bloodhound's sazerac was the only cocktail that I would indulge in the city. Don't get me wrong, there are amazing cocktails all through out the city but Bloodhound has my loyalty when it comes to stepping out of my norm.

_RJmgk7psQZdnXv1h5eGnQ.review_text: When I say "as good as it gets," you need to understand that this is a neighborhood bar that really channels that vibe.... totally a SOMA meets hunting lodge meets Cheers style place.  Staff is cool as long as you are.  Be social.  You'll have a good time.  Speciality drinks are not always my favorite... but they are awesome and getting creative just for you.

ym91NK9QMPDU2g00zEuLIg.review_text: Though poorly marked from the street, I will forgive that since the interior was so lovely! Very spacious and light. I really loved the look of the tall wood tables.  If you are a whisky person, this will be your heaven. Also seemed to have a good beer selection.  I wish more bars in SF were like Bloodhound because it didn't feel like there was a particular scene there and there was enough space to just hang out with my friends (as opposed to feeling packed into a sardine can like at some places in the Mission).  I would definitely come back here! Also, parking was SUPER easy.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Bloodhound is a bar. Not a dive, not a cocktail lounge, not a club - it's a bar, awash in wood and leather and people drinking drinks. It's a bar that makes fine cocktails, has good beer on tap (served in Mason jars!) and an attractive crowd. Like most bars in the city, it can be a shit show on the weekends but I like to do my drinking early in the evening (or right before last call) on a weeknight anyway so that doesn't really bother me. Quick recap, as I tend to drift as I write these things: - Cool space: hey, is that a pool table? - Great drinks: try the Ward 8 or Old Speckled Hen if you prefer beer - Functional, informative website: need to know how to make a Ricky Riccardo or want to hear some Band of Horses? Check out bloodhoundsf.com Bloodhound may mean a trek across town for me but I know it also guarantees a good time.

e331pQV1I-SSnWw_w0PfMA.review_text: Sometimes I don't understand how places can get SO LOUD. Every time I come here, I feel like I have to scream in people's faces. But thank goodness Bloodhound makes this easy to achieve by offering fancy stiff cocktails balanced with not-as-stiff ingredients. Being loud is just a natural progression of inebriation.   I always go back for the Recoil. And I gotta try the Bloodhound (vodka, campari, grapefruit) next time.   And finally! A cocktail place that opens at 4pm! Good to know.  3.5 - but the drinks are good so I'll round up.

dIiTs5qYYQNuJd7L-K9ldw.review_text: I always find myself coming here for any reason. I've gone once a week for the past 3 weeks now. I always get a new fashion and I am never disappointed.  It not too loud in there so it's an awesome place to go on a date there. Light music in the back ground. TVs and a pool table if you aren't interested in talking.  DOG FRIENDLY!  Most likely I'll be there next weekend. Oh wait i'll be out of town  :(

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: What a great neighborhood bar. And here I'd all but given up on all these transplants creating any semblance of a "community" in SoMa.  Great beer selection (love the Nitro stout... please never leave me), clean and level pool table (for a buck AND you don't need to bug the bar for quarters), Big Buck Hunter, and dozed of dimly-lit and very comfortable places to sit and talk with your friends (who happen to be your neighbors).

06bCB7nvtUnaM5eyEisa1w.review_text: The vibe is ok, but whatever you do, don't waste your money on the specialty cocktails,I tasted two and both of them tasted like cough syrup! If you want to try a unique mixed drink, go next door to Raven.

n35upJe2SjxVAb616PNhuw.review_text: Finally writing a review for Bloodhound after coming here for the past 2+ years.  By far my favorite bar in SF.    I keep coming back because the management / staff at this bar treats their customers like family.  Very friendly and they care about your bar experience.  It never takes more than 5 minutes to order and get a drink and their drinks are always made right.  Oh, they also serve their drinks in mason jars, how can you not love a bar that does that?  The space is uniquely decorated, people here are diverse, and being a big fan of whiskey and Scotch, offers a huge variety.  Also ask for Christina to help you with drinks.  She is an amazing bartender that not only makes a great cocktail, but has dropped some serious knowledge on bourbons.  If you are unsure what you want, she helps you decide based on your preferences and is never impatient about it.  Lastly, she introduced to me/makes a great mezcal shooter that is amazing!   Definitely worth a try if you are already a fan of peaty scotch!

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: I always saw this place, but never went inside. I like the vibe inside. Very speakeasy-esque. Specialty cocktails are good, and it wasn't too crowded when I went.

zZeVb-QLSgYbQea00-2liQ.review_text: There is a $20 minimum on credit/debit cards. I told the bartender that VISA doesn't allow that, it's clearly stated in their terms and conditions. His answer was "I don't give a shit". Not coming back after being treated like that.

_iSS1m_QBY9E1f1xOZovlg.review_text: I have to admit, this is a really neat bar. It has the hunter vibe and birds painted on the ceiling...and they served my drink, The Recoil, in a mason jar! There's a hunting video game inside and a pool table as well. I came on a Friday night with a friend from out of town...oh man, it was packed, as we had expected. We had to squeeze our way through the crowd to get inside and to the bar. The drink was really strong (to me...I'm a lightweight though). I guess it was worth the price...I had to have my friend help me finish it so I could be sober enough to help my other drunk friend later that night.   Definitely a great scene to have some fun and meet people on a night out with friends. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves! No one was rude to me as I was trying to squeeze my way through the crowd. People also hung up their coats along the wall...I guess people are pretty trusting here with their belongings.  If you find the scene too crazy for you, you can also hop next door to Raven Bar. The scene there is more calm...Edgar Allen Poe theme.

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: Loved this place. Nice vibe. Well-laid out. The bartenders were great and had good advice when we asked for it. They had a great selection of whiskeys but did not have cream to make a White Russian. Small thing I guess.   Love this place!

X2uF3C3YBD24xcgKA104Sw.review_text: Is it right to love a bar for it's ceiling? I don't care for much else, but I damn well love that ceiling with all of its fluttering birds. In fact, I want that on my own ceiling. I want the interior decorator to just turn my white-walled apartment into some wood & warmth styled inn. You can ditch the hipsters tho.   Beer is served in jam jars (can you really drink out of a jam jar in a ladylike fashion? I don't think I am capable, personally) and at $5 a pop, it's neither overly expensive but certainly not dive bar prices either. But, I get to sit on a couch and stare at that ceiling, so I don't really care. You can have my extra dollar. I love you, ceiling.

PtOrjjBIxDoiJf97IDyOdQ.review_text: I love this place I went there last night and had a few of the buttered rum drinks. I love the vibe of the place and the bartender was amazing he worked his ass off and got us drinks really fast.

gIDXC3PnnilTwpyXujQ5aw.review_text: Sometimes when embarrassing things happen to me in a bar, I never return, and trust me, I've done some embarrassing things. But Bloodhound is helping me transcend the shame.  Sure, I spent an hour hitting on the only cute guy in the whole bar, while unbeknownst to me, his girlfriend was RIGHT THERE next to him the whole time, but I'm cool with that.  And sure, I spilled my beer right after last call in front of said guy, and begged for a new one, but that's cool too.  I'm over it.  Because this place had seating, good music, good drinks, and an awesome female bartender who took mercy on me and gave me a half pint of beer to make up for the spilled stuff.  I'll go back with my head held high.

S7lxiY8zc5gBV7PwVzKThg.review_text: Bloodhound really strikes a great balance between a place with a complex cocktail menu and the type of place that you can go to just order a beer or a rum & coke.  All are welcome here and they staff the bar well and dish out the drinks quickly, even when it's busy.    Drinks are a good price and the crowd is fairly friendly.  A perfect spot to grab a drink after work or before hitting up one of the local restaurants.

HWTOELslgXUrsgMOj9T9oA.review_text: Wow. They really spruced this joint up.   I came to this location this past summer during a rowdy day party. The bar was a dive, kinda shady, kinda fun. yeah, one of those.   Bloodhound is completely transformed from the previous bar. The bar is really pretty and there is a good mix of people. It was someones birthday and they even offered cake! What bliss! The drinks were strong, but kind of pricey-weak sauce. All in all, i really like this bar.

uSLYegkfWVQqufUJTQccFQ.review_text: Very meh. Crowded and super super loud. Dog friendly which is cool though.

j763s4nxDBg_uNLk3N2WtA.review_text: Came here as my first stop during SF Beer week.  The beer selection was terrific, and to top it off there was a lady was there selling some of the best meat balls I've ever had.  Bar tender was friendly, and this is good place to go grab a good beer.

Yj1a3IApDb8hhl_5TSmUdg.review_text: This is my neighborhood bar (but it's not in my neighborhood- insert annoyed groan from SOMA residents).  Bloodhound is seriously worth a commute across town.  The best drinks, really nice service and a great crowd.  I always seem to meet  some cool new people here.  Whether you just want a beer or to find your favorite new crafted cocktail Bloodhound won't disappoint.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: lots of wood. lots of antlers. lots of booze.  i like this place a lot, they got a pool table, plenty of space, and seating. i even left my jacket there, and the next day when i returned for it the bartender fished it out of the lost and found for me.

hSE3_ZdkaILWxxVrw_mt9g.review_text: It looks like a Saloon on the outside.  When I walked in, I kept staring at their ceiling.  Decor is..different; it's a man's bar minus the flock of birds!  Just a kicked back bar that offers interesting cocktails.  It wasn't a meat market; it wasn't even that packed the night we checked it out.    Please note - they don't serve any food.  Good thing Radius is around the corner.  You can order some fried chicken after wards!

wgTStPFk1D8arhQMeuG4ug.review_text: Right next to my work, good to place to grab a drink.

8hh50iYCCPaMYZcRREG46A.review_text: Don't know why I never knew about this place. A pretty chill late night spot, spacious enough to waltz around the room but enough of a crowd to create a sort of buzz. The drinks were pretty well crafted if I remember correctly. Not too sweet, not too plain. Pool table, clean bathrooms, across the street from Cat Club.

vlehgFdySB62xExGaaqEow.review_text: Selection is medium-to-extensive, and powerful Vibe is tight Music is great  I made my way here on a Tuesday night not long ago and made a pretty full night of it - an outstanding choice, if I do say so myself.  As I first walked in, Amanda offered assistance and we immediately got into a fine chat about the region's beers, the immediate local neighborhood, and some East Coast musings, as well.  She was generous with the samples and spot-on with her recommendations - a pleasure to speak with.  Later on, her compadre Rudy (who invents cocktails) came in and mixed up a Smoky Old-Fashioned for me, which was most excellent.    Everyone else is right about the dark atmosphere and hunting lodge-chic.  Expect it, revel in it, and that's that - it's cool and not overdone.  On this specific night, the darkness was actually broken up by a Presidential motorcade hustling through town that bathed Folsom in red and blue flashes for about ten minutes as the advance team blocked entry and exit, and our Homebrewer-In-Chief sped past.  We, the fair patron citizenry spilled out onto the sidewalk for a look-see (and some for a smoke).  Then, as that broke up, we all returned inside the bar to polish off our beverages.    This place is great.  I try to do new things every time I visit San Francisco, but I have a feeling I'll have a hankering to make this a repeat stop in future.  Love it.

7Rrc3EgaiBZq3_1H5tF62g.review_text: I love this bar!!! Best Manhattans in town, bartenders always super friendly. My favor day is Sunday afternoon when you have all the locals in and a friendly bartender Amanda. Cant wait to go back!!

BguSPnZ_hqC7jx7u-gGd-w.review_text: I like the decor on the walls.  I like that there are couches and plenty of bar stools, but that it's mostly standing room.  I've never had an issue with a bartender.   Other than that, I'm not sure why people keep going to this place.  Ambiance is not that great, crowd is boring and not diverse in the least, there's not enough bartenders on staff, and drinks are overpriced.  You can't hear any music, but at the same time, it's usually too loud to hear the person next to you talk.    So-so and uninteresting.

zy2cNfG4lLE3SlY9p2OL-A.review_text: A stone's throw away from my home office.   I heard a lot about Bloodhound from OG Yelpers and other folks.  So I tried it a couple of time.  Interesting concept and venue as described by the prior Yelpers - the hunting theme with a cozy Northern European cabin look and feel plus black birds on the ceilings.    The crowd is very SOMA, hipster and SF-youngsters.  The second time around I entertained a "brother" or so-called kindred soul from a high-tech standpoint, who was from the outskirts of Boston.  I guess he liked it, perhaps he would have appreciated Zeitgeist more.  But we were too distracted to discuss the state of the virtualization "nation" - startups, big companies and high-tech in general.  I guess we were apropos from a clientele standpoint as most guys were shooting crap about work, while lurking cutie young girls were on the hunt for their potential geek target.   A nice hipster venue.

Vp14grGEIvYzmrsOdix4UQ.review_text: Sweet watering hole. Good selection of drinks... dark and rustic vibe (antlers included)... stuff you'll find elsewhere around the city, though not frequently enough and rarely as seamlessly put together.   Most importantly, they have an unusually wide selection of Campari-based specialty drinks. Being a Campari maniac myself, I have to give "mad props" where "mad props" are due. I stuck to my usual on-the-rocks-with-a-twist version, which was addictive and delicious as usual, but I'm hoping to go back to give some of their fancy, more complex concoctions a try.   ... I would venture to say that Bloodhound represents the best of SOMA bar-life (!).

PtTZf3VF_JwSKf-rkhuvRA.review_text: Comfortable, chill bar, pool table, decent parking and moderate bar prices. Oh, and clean bathrooms - always a plus!

tRRcuNcY6jaYEo82l1Ojdg.review_text: If you could only see what this place looked like before the face-lift, which is why I love and appreciate my neighborhood Bloodhound that much more. This is one SOMA rathole turned uptown saloon. where Dorothy would kick up her ruby red heels while sipping on a Dark-&-Stormy. Besides the handsome atmosphere, the selection behind the bar is also worth taking advantage of. Unless you really must order your default drink of choice, then I recommend going the adventurous route. at least for your first one. Most of these bartenders know what they're doing and will happily make you an exquisite libation upon request, or recommend a unique beer on tap. given an undemanding crowd- duh.  And their ipod and/or jukebox selection rocks. Whichever one they've got playing, I'm always loving what I'm hearing when I'm here. ..aand on some [Thurs-Sat] nights, there might even be a cartfull of bacon-wrapped hotdogs right outside. You can't ask for much more sensory goodness from a down-to-earth SOMA bar..

gf_lG1HuH7YjivT4tJPAlQ.review_text: Awesome aesthetic--antlers on the wall and bourbon in mason jars and big buck hunter.  Close to Civic Center Bart.  Seemed like good people, although there was a little bit of a businessperson afterhappyhour vibe to it--more vertical striped button-downs than I expected.  But it takes all sorts, right?  And how often do you get to kick it under some deer trophies?

U8BeSM0NhMLcGGNPWCu6CA.review_text: Went to this bar with some friends and was overall pretty happy with the atmosphere, the bartenders, and the crowd.  It was full, but not overly daunting to get around. I think it was a good size crowd.  The atmosphere is a mix of different things, but mostly what I would call rustic. There is an animal skull on the wall and barrels around the area to use as tables. They have a single pool table within the back of the bar, which gains a lot of popularity and use all throughout the night.  All of their bartenders were very nice and friendly except for one. I had been drinking for a few hours at this point and went up to the bar to get a water. When I got back to my friends we all ended up sharing it. I went back up about 5 minutes later, same bartender, and asked for another water. His response was, "I thought I already gave you one." I explained that I gave it to my friends and he followed up with a very rude, "Next time how about you ask for two, so we don't have to go through this."  Overall, the Bloodhound was a very positive experience and I enjoyed my evening there. I would recommend it to friends.

o0vxBOEas5b0VEf3K_uPyg.review_text: I don't know that I'm Bloodhound's target demographic, since I seldom drink cocktails, but my friends definitely are, since they relish cocktails, the more old-school or complicated to make, the better.  My first visit to Bloodhound was for a meat-centric event that featured butchers breaking down pig, lamb and goat right before your eyes. That was magical indeed.  My 2nd visit was at the end of a Friday night spent with a half-dozen good friends, bouncing around to good drinking spots on Folsom St.  Friends had their fancy cocktails, I had a Sierra Nevada Southern Hemisphere Harvest, served in a pint Mason jar.  Cute enough, and the presence of chill dogs hanging out was a bonus.  I know this place is uber-hipstery, but I've never had anything but good times and great service here, so Bloodhound is just all right with me.

IFqmxztS2vZjtCeURfzZ-g.review_text: Decent enough boozer. Normally plenty of space and cool bar staff. Pool table and that deer hunting game. Ceiling is decorated with lots of painted birds, so not good if you're ornithophobic. Never really like the beer in the jar thing, prefer glasses but alcoholics will drink from anything.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: Came by yesterday to watch the Giants game before having dinner nearby. I like the vibe of the place. Very low key. Not a lot of people while we were here. A few at the bar, tables, etc, which probably added to the reason I had a great time. I hate being at crowded bars. There are only a few TVs, so I wouldn't call this a sports bar by any means. But it was nice to watch the game while throwing back a couple drinks.  Side note: There are birds painted on the ceiling. Maybe they were stenciled, but they were birds! I'm scared of birds so this was not a welcome decoration. So if you're scared of birds like me, don't look up!

R359nKd5QtwiNuZwMlPlQQ.review_text: I usually don't review bars but I thought the drinks here were pretty good. The bartenders were sort of busy but were also very friendly. I usually get a cold stare and then silence when I order at the bar but I thought the bartenders here were pretty friendly if you stop to talk for a minute. The drinks were very good. I think my friends and I would recommend their cocktail named "recoil".

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: Love this new SOMA bar and it's roomy feel. It was pretty crowded on a Saturday night, but with the long tables against the wall there is lots of room. We were able to score two tables for our crew to mingle.  The bartenders were helpful and friendly and it wasn't hard to get a drink. The boys loved the shooting game and pool table. I enjoyed the wood-slatted walls, redwood tables, the antlers, and the classy yet hunting lodge kind of feel. The crowd felt a little marina-style, but since this was a meeting place for our group, we made it our own. I like bars that have a vibe laid back enough for you to meet up with friends, chill with drinks, and not feel like your part of a concept.  Will come back.  Good stiff drinks and a nice selection of Belgian beers.

ZR3_9sK04tiUC9_uHH3s6A.review_text: This place is awesome. It's a good sized space with a great casual-yet-well-thought-out style. The bartender (and co-owner) is helpful, friendly, and know his sh*t. Good beers on tap and a wide selection of bourbons makes for a great menu. Overall cool place yet still comfortable.  Also, be sure to try the "whisky sticks" which are super-tasty meat snacks from Fatted Calf. A brilliant addition to the bar! I was there last night (Wednesday) and it had a solid crowd but was not crowded--I could still get a seat. It gets busy on the weekends for sure.

08jfo0j-qbcs5yKefByVKQ.review_text: Wow, this place oozes cool; it seeps out of the wooden floorboards, the bright green pool tables, the antler chandelier... and behind the massive biker bartender and his glinting array of liquors and liquors and liquors... Despite the masculine mystique of Bloodhound, I find it quite female friendly. Our beast of a bartender was so sweet, we wanted to try the citron flavored Patron but not as a pure shot and asked if he knew any cocktails that utilized it; he did not but quickly whipped us up some Tequila Sunrise-esque drinks. Delighted we demanded he name the drink and instead of feeling harassed played along with our demands and gave us: "Sparkling Sunrise". Biker man. "Sparkling Sunrise". LOVED it. I had a good, chill time at Bloodhound. If you're searching for a resting point in the SOMA, this is it!

P8tfXzao6pCzMQOP0TS6pA.review_text: Holy s**t (am I aloud to say s**t?)  Finally a nice local bar in SOMA.  It kind of reminds me of a Russian Hill bar transplanted to the south of Market.    Caveat: This bar could turn into 1 of 2 places. 1) Marina by proxy - a crowd that I'm not looking for.  I could definitely see this place being packed all the time.  Good for Bloodhound, sad for Zak D. 2) SOMA proper - a nice locals bar. No Prada glasses.  Fewer than two Jager Bombs per evening.
