I'm actually conflicted writing this post because I'd prefer a more low-key locale, but I'd really like to see Bloodhound succeed.    See you there tomorrow...and the night after...

xdT-CrIx2a8qvR1SSOrOcg.review_text: It's a hunting lodge in here. There's birds on the ceiling, there's antlers everywhere. The walls are wood paneled. I forgot to wear plaid, I hope they forgive me.   The Ward 8 cocktail was delightful: bulleit rye, orange and lemon, and housemade grenadine. It was also ridiculously strong, not something I should have ended my night with. But I did anyway and I didn't feel bad about it.   A fantastically chill vibe even though the place was fairly crowded at 9:30 on a Thursday. Bloodhound is like your cool friend who never seems like they're trying too hard, and you're just looking to blend in.

cmAHVj0b5Wz5Tun6Op0ksw.review_text: Who am I kidding. I heart Bloodhound- one of my go to fave neighborhood bars.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: Having been relegated to the South Bay email list of ELite events, I've not been to an SF one in a long time. I suppose if I had the time and will I'd be scouring the calendar more often but work keeps getting in the way. When I found out one of the old school Yelpers was leaving the area, I made it to Bloodhound for the rendezvous. On a Sat night this place is packed to the gills. I had to wait outside for a few minutes, though the door man was cool. Going inside, the rustic bar with a number of hard working bartenders were scurrying around while, tons of young drinkers clamored to get around.   Running into various Yelpers I'd not seen in years, it was like an event back in the old days. I sidled up to the bar and deciding that I didn't want to get back into the crush of things again, I double fisted with a Recoil and Ward 8. Both Bourbon based drinks, they hit the spot as I made my way back to the group.   I can't count the number of times I was bumped into, elbowed, pushed what not. It's like college had just let out or something. I figure this place makes a much better weeknight bar than weekend but the people watching was interesting. Drinks are solid, though I wish I had free will to punch each jerk off that just showed zero respect for anyone as they made their way through the crowds.

BeKjLTfH6iOrrxLb_Gc9tQ.review_text: my best friend and i were in the city and stupidly parked in a tow away zone... so we had to go find the place that had our car and get it. While wandering around, I really had to use the restroom. Like, no joke! So, we started walking around and stumbled upon this bar. Much to our surprise, it was actually really lively at 6pm (guessing all the business people there for an after work drink). The atmosphere is chill, good music, different types of crowd, not just business or hipsters. Free wifi was a plus and our beers were only $3 each! we had Pacifico since they didnt have Corona, which isnt too bad. All we wanted was a chill place to relax, use the restroom (VERY clean, too bad only one stall) and have a beer. Great place to stumble upon. Definelty coming back if im ever in the city in the area again

WOlfaz4vzUNvNxCScXeYrg.review_text: Loved what they did with this place.  The decor is is really cool and cozy.  We felt like we were in Tahoe or Colorado or something.  Great bartenders as well.  I would definitely come back for after work drinks or even after dinner in the Mission.  Good spot for when I am in the neighborhood

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: This ended up being a really great spot to meet some folks at on a Friday evening.   I tried to call them but no one ever picked up so I emailed to ask about reserving a table and someone responded super quickly.  I wanted to reserve a table area at 5:30pm and they were happy to do so. They have a bunch of long tables where you can sit.   Good cocktails and some coming in the jars!   They also have a shooting game where you have to put four quarters that seemed fun.   Powell BART around the corner from this place (which is sketchy to walk to especially on 7th) and Specer's On The Go French Food drunk nearby.   No food at Bloodhound but I ordered pizza from Extreme Pizza and they delivered and we enjoyed there. Glad they accept outside food.   Would go again for sure.

k_6JJl12UTicAEt6Ji8yTw.review_text: I like this bar its chill, drinks are cheap, interesting decor, I can chat and just chill!

Al1VNe0pPEODkUGSIyA9rw.review_text: I love this bar, it has good vibes. It doesn't get too crowded and when it does, it has never been an issue to find a seat at the bar. The decor is very cool, i really enjoyed the black birds hanging from the ceilings. Check it out. But I believe there was a female bartender who mistaken my wording for sssssailor jerry please with an ice water. Other than that this place is a go to spot for a laid back date type of deal or any deal.

3PsbKUWWqXTHcDFRxpU8-Q.review_text: I don't leave the Mission very often (or, maybe more accurately, I don't leave Mistro PoBern very often), but I came to Bloodhound with a friend a few weeks ago, and I am a little in love. I would go out of my way to come here anytime but the best part is that it's not really out of the way. A few blocks from Civic Center Bart? A bike ride from my work in Potrero?    The decor is misappropriated frontier-pioneer objects without the Manifest Destiny bullshit, the bartenders were super friendly (saved me from drinking an 11% alchohol beer without making me feel like a rube), and I think the best part is that they keep the bar incredibly clean by immediately picking up straws, napkins, etc.  So damn good.

U-gPI5JtAQZOpZJUZGNYKQ.review_text: This place is usually over packed with alcoholists who are drinking from jars which might look classy for the first time but in overall just an addition for the extreme cheap atmosphere. If you like sedated people around you exhaling partially processed terrible alcohol smell from every possible direction while you can't really move or stay in position without being hit by someone who is just loosing control over their basic motoric system, then this place is for you, otherwise think twice before enter. If you're forced to go there, make sure you wear something really cheap or disposable outfit to fit in.

s_p_UCBxyYGX-_1eU8cp-Q.review_text: Excellent cocktails but its your typical grimy, crowded bar. Good for work outings.

YDelRDHO4JkuZwWV7law1g.review_text: Unfortunately I won't be living just steps away from this cool bar anymore.  I love the decor going all the way with the "be bery bery quiet, I'm huntin wabbits," theme of all wood and more wood, as well as antlers.  The beer selection doesn't fail, but you may fail from drinking enough of it while hunting for deer, antelopes, and other wild thangs on the arcade or from pool.  Very cool, chill spot to have drinks.

EYLy8HaGh8SzP9vZbRAFzg.review_text: Welp, I drug Mr H & one of his friends there the other night, and it's now their new go-to bar to play pool.   True, there are sometimes some DBs & DBettes cluttering up the joint, but overall, it's a very chill lil spot. If the sound of popping collars is not more cowbell to your ears, skip Thursdays.  The mustachioed midweek 'tender (my impression is that he's the owner, could be wrong) is very cool & seems to always have a good mix on his iPod or whatever the juke overrides.  They've got some compelling drink specials (one of which has become my at-home cocktail of choice), a well-stocked bar (sip a shot of the Zaya, neat - you'll be glad you did), and Mr H gave a thumbs-up to Mendo county beer on tap.  Solid neighborhood joint.

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: After a weird, long, and stressful day, I ended up at a dive pool bar called Club 93 last night.  Shot some fun pool and then ended up hitting Bloodhound afterwards with a new friend that I had been shooting pool with.  I'm sure those who know me on Yelp will most certainly smile when they hear that I went to Bloodhound.  I mean...how could I not love a place with birds painted on the ceiling? :)   Hung out, shot some great pool, played a girl who takes bar pool far too seriously (lighten up, Wendy...it's supposed to be fun!).  Interesting decor with a midwestern feel.  Those horn chandeliers always make me think of that scene from that film The Lost Boys.  Had three Ketel Citron and sodas and one Bloodhound which was made with Hangar 1, Campari, and grapefruit.  The bartenders were cool (forgot the big guy's name), but I'm just not a fan of Campari.  I should have ordered a Greyhound instead.  Looking forward to trying some of their other drinks in the future...maybe a Ricky Ricardo next time.    Fun, friendly place with a good crowd...I even got to pet a cute dog inside named "Lizzie", right before I ran into a co-worker there.  That was a real surprise and totally unexpected.  Was tempted to hit some other bars afterwards with him, but hadn't had dinner yet and was hungry.  Nice place to hang with no pretense.  I will be back.

vZ0IpI0a-TNbXhQKk9YQ_g.review_text: Neat space full of friendly startup/tech types :)  The drinks are good, they have decent beer and scotch selection and best of all bartenders are friendly and you can get their attention quickly unlike most places where they try to avoid eye contact.  And this even though the place was packed.  So other bars, you have no excuse.    Mason jars are a good idea too so you dont waste/slosh your drink all over the floor.  This way you are getting your money's worth.    Birds on the ceiling make for interesting drunken pix of your friends too.  Their website has some cute game too but i havent played it.

y5BWogG5nO9jH7Fi-ss7GQ.review_text: A very heartfelt 5 stars for Bloodhound!    Yes, the decor and layout is cool and roomy.  And the place does have a refreshing new-car smell about it.  Also, beer in mason jars speaks to this Southerner's down home roots.  But the service absolutely clenched my love of this place.    The fiance and I stroll in around 9:15 on a Saturday.  Definitely not crowded yet, but we notice that 3 different tables have reserved signs on them.  We chill at one of the tables for a bit, knowing full well we'll need to get up when the party at hand arrives (no biggie, it IS Saturday, and people have birthdays to celebrate).  They do arrive, and one of the managers comes over to shoo us away...in the most polite, apologetic manner in the world.  Truly, the guy's apology was so sincere, I was a hair shy of giving him a hug and telling him everything would be ok.    We relocate to a corner of the bar, and order another beer.  One of the other bar owners attends to our order, and insists that it's on the house for us having to relocate from the reserved table.  Incredible!  The place eventually gets packed, and each bartender continues to check up on us regularly, including refilling water glasses without being asked.  Oh, and the staff was a-ok with one of their regulars bringing his dog in.  Just another random little touch to indicate the chill yet attentive vibe of Bloodhound.  Great beer selection, but I have to say that the Red Rocket is pretty funky ("Tyler no likey").  Once we switched up our selection, all was right with the world.  Go and enjoy!

vi1Ta_3XtGTqkl4p83ZbEQ.review_text: The B-hound can be quite inconsistent... but most of it's not really their fault.  I'm talking more about the crowd/ambience.  I've been a few times.  Once, the place was goin off the hook, good diverse crowd, hip hop jammin over the speakers - it was likely the best place to be out that night!  Another time, it was d-e-a-d as a doornail at 10pm on a Thursday night so we had to walk ourselves across the Street to 1984 at Cat Club.  And then, another time it must have been filming a new reality show entitled "SF's Next Top Hipster".    All in all, it's a cool bar if you're in the mood for a western/ski lodge theme and you don't want to party somewhere with flashing strobe lights... but my advice is to have a friend go first and ask them how it is before going.

D2b4DENpkezsw90fC2vWdw.review_text: I've been wanting to check out Bloodhound for so long!! Love the decor in here, especially the flock of birds on the ceiling!  Crazy strong drinks (might be too strong for the faint of heart or taste) on a delicious sounding drink menu. I had the recoil - ginger beer and elderflower being two of my favorite things - and it was really tasty!  Nice bartenders who will remake a drink for you if you didn't like it the first time around.  My only complaint is the one stall for the ladies restroom, c'mon now.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: This is where you want to go on a sunny afternoon or one of your chill nights out.  The Bloodhound is welcoming and stocked with a fantastic list of alcohol.  The beers (both on tap and bottled) are amazing!  I especially love the La Chouffe on tap!  Also, the bar is spacious and warm.  The only thing missing from this bar atmosphere is YOU!  Come and enjoy a great place for drinking.   P.S. The have Buckhunter Pro - a bonus star in my BF's book.  Also, minus one star for the location:  I love the stuff of Folsom St. but I'm spoiled and I hate how everything is so spread out.

16bb45wlxtXdBYZBw612Xg.review_text: A bigger, more upscale version of the Bigfoot Lodge on Polk that seems to attract an interesting, mixed crowd. Strong drinks, cool ceiling, good seating options.   HOWEVER....   (1) They had a $20 credit card minimum, which is a violation of Visa and MasterCard merchant agreements. Merchants' Visa and MasterCard agreements DO NOT PERMIT merchants to charge a minimum for credit card use.   (2) They have installed a partition in the men's bathroom that hides the urinal from view when the door opens but makes the bathroom inaccessible to wheelchairs. I brought this to the co-owner's attention, but I have not been back to see whether they've done anything to fix the problem.   Someone at Yelp needs to change "wheelchair accessible" from yes to no.   Boo on Bloodhound.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: Have been here a few times now as it's right around corner from new office. On popular happy hour days like Thursdays and the noise is deafening and it's standing room only.   However people tend to be friendly and make room to squeeze you in to their seating. Really solid well priced cocktails.   Beer list looks ok, but I'll let my Beer Snob be the true judge of that.

rWLI-KeG6u1Y7zLIEGWJlA.review_text: My favorite bar in SF.  Period.  From the fantastic bartenders, to the spot on drinks, to the shockingly reasonable prices for the gouge fest that has become SOMA, this is the only spot you should be spending time in.  The decor fits the vibe they are going for perfectly.  If you know the story behind it the vintage wood planks, its even better.  It would be like giving away the end of a movie in a review, so ask someone who works there about it sometime.  The boys have done a great job here, if you are in the area, you are doing yourself a disservice if you haven't been.  Grab a beer in the canning jars your Grandma uses, shoot some ducks in duck hunter, play some pool, and just chill.  Great spot, vibe, music, etc, etc.  (Mike/Darin - Miss you guys already!)

7luXny1U62Tt9PiCNBkQ5A.review_text: They have Enjoy By, which was awesome, but apparently, if you want a beer and you're here with your husband, they won't let him close his eyes for a few minutes even though it's midnight and he's been up working since 5 am. They call it "passed out" even if he isn't drunk. They literally said "You know how you can't kill people? You can't lay down at a bar." I. Kid. You. Not. Because the two are so similar.

jxs7SnriWMiLPXfEMft9nQ.review_text: One of the best old fashions I've ever had.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: Bloodhound is a Pac-NW bar lifted by its foundations & transported magically from Portland to San Francisco. I absolutely love the Lodge-like atmosphere, although the prices are quite steep ($9 for a cocktail? Christ!), which is very un-loggerly of them.  This is the perfect place for sensitive bearded men in flannel shirts & nouveau chunky black-rimmed glasses to play an ironic game of Big Buck Hunter underneath an antler chandelier. In a way, it's almost fitting for Bloodhound to have landed here, in the footprint of the much beloved punk & metal dive that preceded it. The frontier-like atmosphere of the place is fitting for this particular as-of-yet-unvogued corner of SOMA.  Sure, people may still be pooping in the alley next to the bar every night, but today's human poop is tomorrow's fertilizer (see: Hayes Valley, The Mission). A few years from now, the whole neighborhood will likely be full of high end cocktail bars.  With a name like Bloodhound, I'd expected a grapefruit juice & vodka frou frou-type experience, but the vibe was is great. I have a hunch it'll be around for awhile.

mGuGQd6UMwhFH3AZsr7pDg.review_text: Saturday night was busy with a friendly mix of people. Toucan, Amanda and Steven are some of the nicest, friendliest, downright best bar staff you're ever likely to encounter. Even though amanda did screw us with some tequila shots!   Just about quiet enough to have a chat, loud enough so no one else can here it.   All in all, a great bar.

W_MuoJIhSJYCXJ3q6TkyWA.review_text: Really enjoy this laid back feel to the bar.  Came here after the line at Raven Bar was too crowded.  I was glad we made it to this place.  There is usually a good amount of people without it being overwhelming.  They have one long bar with enough bar tenders to keep the lines short or none at all.  They serve their beer in mason jars and the prices are not too bad.  In the middle is a pool table and they also have the duck hunter shooting game.

C6O8YdUeQS1DMNKdDQY_VA.review_text: Bloodhound is a classy, yet laid-back bar great for grabbing some drinks after work. Even when it's crowded, it's not overly uncomfortable.   The TV's are kept on sports, and dogs are allowed inside.   Prices are pretty standard, and pretty well made too! Good beer selection, all drafts are served in Mason Jars.   Definitely a place to check out for yourself.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: I liked Bloodhound.  The bar with all its alcoholic glory was beautiful.  Huge space, decent seating, pool table, clean bathrooms, nice bartenders (on a Wednesday night).  There was a great crowd there tonight, quite possibly 80% of them were couchsurfers.  It did get a little stuffy but once they opened the windows, it was a lot better.  Plus they played music from the XX.  Love them =)  P.S  Strict about alcohol outside.

EDwgntEyg69iTtbjM2wHYw.review_text: Dig this place fro Decor, beers and I think u can bring your dog in with u.

sgxfAc-8qvEsslPMlWVP0Q.review_text: Have been here about a half a dozen times with the wife after work during the week.  Got there about 5 and left around 9 each time.  The place does get packed on Friday's but isn't that why you go.  The crowd is starting to get just a tad hipsterish but isn't  all of San Francisco.  There are still enough normal people in there to make it tolerable.  I like it because the drinks are very good if not great, and I have never had a problem with any of the bartenders that other posters have had.  Show a little patience when they are busy and tip big on the first order and try smiling and saying thank you, they will remember you!

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: *happy hour fun in the city*  this place felt cozy after a few drinks and bloodhound is a pretty lively watering hole after 4pm. darin, our bartender, took care of us and remembered to place two limes on my chopin and tonics. kudos.   awesome selection of liquor, beer and wine. they even sell chicharones. i'd come back here again. plus i love to glance at their ceiling! ;o)

IFm5fxeP9CCW9A0JX2Cqgw.review_text: Went last night during happy hour, and this is definitely in my top 5 favorite bars in SF so far (only been here a few months, but trust me, I've been busy doing lots of research...) Amazing whiskey selection (and liquor selection in general). Great atmosphere - a relaxed, cabin-y feel, nice open layout, and Buck Hunter to boot. Bartenders were great and the crowd was a good mix of hipsters, locals, and after-work types. Kind of a solid, clean dive bar feel - the kind of place you feel really comfortable in, but aren't afraid to use the bathroom.  The cocktail menu was truly impressive, and I say that as an ex-bartender. I'm usually an old-fashioned girl and definitely enjoyed their "New Fashioned" with maple simple syrup, but the bourbon cocktail with ginger beer and elderflower liqueur was one of the best drinks I've ever had, hands down.  They had a DJ spinning vinyl (on a Tuesday night!), which was awesome, but it still kept a very chill vibe. I'll be back, many many times, I'm sure.

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: A bar in the middle of nowhere-ish (ok, a decent number of bars/restaurants on this block, but on a Monday night this was the only one that was alive & happening, yet not overly packed). Dark wood contours. Drinks served out of mason jars (that always gets me). A laid back yet lively crowd. Awesome ceilings - I won't try to describe it - just go there and check it out. You won't regret it.

wrhOaPospStRs5q15ot4bA.review_text: Love the vibe and the quality of the drinks in this place. Feels a bit like an old hunting lodge (dark paneling, some taxidermy) but nothing too stuffy, and plenty of room to mill about. We sat at one of the tables opposite the bar and didn't have any trouble hearing each other.  I gave the bartender my order (4 diff drinks) and despite having to finish up someone else's fairly complicated drink order she kept everything straight and got all our drinks done right - thought that was nice. There's a long list of prohibition-era/style drinks - pretty much any kind of alcoholic concoction. I kept it simple with a 209 & tonic and the proportions were right.  Was pretty crowded when I was here so had to keep an eagle eye on the chairs we were using lest some hoser came over and stole one if someone got up to get another round/use the facilities.  Only downside from my perspective, and maybe all of San Francisco is like this, but if I was a lady I might have been a little creeped out by the stalker-ish vibe of all the dudes hovering around just waiting for their "moment". Hint: it's not gonna happen, move on.

EqDIZSQ1IsSGZwBkEh9TjA.review_text: Work trips to San Francisco have taken on certain patterns:  1. Attend training sessions in the mornings.  2. Grab coffee and catch up with coworkers I rarely see.  3. Get my ear talked off by bossman.  4. Have lunch at the Sentinel or Algiers.  5. Go for drinks at Bloodhound. Rinse, repeat, and wish for more of 5 during steps 1-4.  If I lived in the city I'd definitely be a regular here at Bloodhound. It's just my kind of bar - laidback and unassuming, but carrying an interesting selection of beers and spirits for a bar its size. Old Speckled Hen at $5 a pint? Yes please. House special cocktails for under $10. Yes please x2. I don't know how well this rustic-chic look and feel fits in SOMA, but, really, I don't care. Plus the bartenders are friendly and efficient, which is ... a plus. That's two plusses bookending that sentence. How quaint. Why edit it when I can comment on it further.  Anyway. Bloodhound. I have no wish to quit you. We've got a good thing goin', friendo.

30uXSd0uV4P_1eRwfrpHWQ.review_text: This place has a great vibe.  I was there early on a Saturday night, and there were maybe 10-12 people in the entire place.  It seemed pretty roomy, and the entire place had this cozy rustic look. Great beers on tap.  The bartenders were really friendly.  And it was a nice place to catch up with a good friend I hadn't seen in a while.    I'd definitely come back, just for the cool vibe.

JRwfZBgGZ3O7JYGTNIxeDg.review_text: I liked that they had beer in mason jars.  I like the spray painted stencil birds on the ceiling.   I didn't like the wack douchemobile clientele made up of 40% fratboys and 40% marina bimbos. It's unfortunate that another cool dive bar with local flavor (cassidy's) has been transformed into another chain bar gentrification station.

SO0SJmAWjSEv--qPt1Q7mA.review_text: Like everyone's said, this place looks cool and has dead animal skulls--score! Wide liquor selection, pool table, no lines for the ladies' room. I subtract one star because I ordered a Yamizaki on the rocks and it didn't taste like it-- I drink it often so  I wonder if it was something terrible like a blended scotch. Also, the music is cool but there's no place to dance-- it's a good place to start off and move onto something else for shimmying. Unless of course pool is your thing, which is mine even though I'm mediocre, then you can play that to the bitter end when the uptight bouncer tells you it's time to leave at the end of the night. P.S. They also have Old Speckled Hen--on tap! It's like butter beer, yum!

vRziAXWI72nOFWNml4ldMA.review_text: Simple and straightforward. It's a dimly lit bar with lots of tables to stand around and a long bar. They had a special drink with bourbon which was a plus. It was a bourbon, canton, sweet and sour and Fever Tree ginger beer. Uber tasty. They make quality drinks and they had a pool table which I didn't partake in but the drinks were good.

IbWSdnPb8UXbOS_J-sjrSQ.review_text: Decor takes me home, and Old Speckled Hen on draught, I will have one more.

lJ6XPasUHaSDvIkonzQ7oA.review_text: If Tennessee were hip, it would be Bloodhound.  interior is clean and classy enough to take a lady friend, yet familiar enough for when the redneck side of your family comes to town.  enjoy good alcohol, hustle the pool table, and bust a cap in deer, all under one roof.  very relaxing and fun environment.  PS there is a $20 card-minimum, ATM inside as well though...

h3KpLypa9SZEw2ydFNC19Q.review_text: 3/5 strong  strong drinks. the atmosphere was the SOMA crowd, interesting decor inside. some arcade games towards the back, and it was definitely full of folks. nothing particularly striking about it though.

xh5JpGXzrhnrVi2eQyRrtw.review_text: Fun bar, can always find a designer or two here. They have a great hunting arcade game in the back. This is great for those who take it seriously and those who are feeling pretty good after a few drinks. They also have a pool table in the back but you will find it very difficult to play when the bar is full.  Stay away from the bathroom, its disgusting.

0qvijl9gnUNKZ4YilSlsqA.review_text: This is close to becoming one of my favorite bars. I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could. I am not a mixed drink kind of lady, but they have some amazing cocktails. If you think one on the menu looks good, but you're not sure about one ingredient, voila! The bartender makes you something new and creative! They have great beers, I love the vibe of the place, and it was a bunch of really good looking people right around my age. It seems like a really great place to go with some single ladies because there were a ton of guys there, the bar staff was all male, and very cute (especially boy with the beard and flannel :), and every time a group of girls sat still, they were flocked by hungry, well-dressed men.  It was quite a spectacle to observe. I drank the Finley, which is gin, dry and sweet vermouth, and a touch of ginger beer. I also had a Monte Carlo, which involved bourbon and deliciousness (something like a Manhattan), and I had sips of pretty much everything else on the menu. If I had stayed out later I would have gotten an Old Speckled Hen. They also have some crazy strong beers, and $3 cans of Olympia and High Life. This bar is awesome and worth getting out of my neighborhood for. I like them so much I left my debit card there last night. Curse those cocktails!

6PUVu4rdS-HX79pOcgGbbg.review_text: Very cool bartender the Saturday night we were there and an open pool table.    Cool place, I'll definitely go back.  Love the bartender with the handle bar mustache!!  Love this place!

aVaJyebvmw4-xa_Mx-PhOA.review_text: I love the look and feel of this place!  The lighting, mason jars, drinks...it's fun.  I had a few Sidecars and they were yummy.  Not all bars know how to make a great Sidecar and I feel like it's such a simple drink.  The crowd is also pretty diverse.  You get a little bit of everything, it's very San Francisco.  I've only been to this bar once but I plan on bringing friends back.

erEO0r8ByJbtxMdXnpwZGw.review_text: I liked this place. It was pretty crowded when I was there but the drinks were yummy and the decor was impressive. I love all these old timey woody bars that seem to be in fashion right now. My kind of place.

YlJNqoHqIssCHP25h2sUFA.review_text: What a find!  Came to Bloodhound last night to celebrate a SF anniversary for a friend whose lived here two years.  I'll definitely be coming back.  The things I love about Bloodhound:  Awesome hunting lodge decor - I almost felt it should've been in Disneyland's Frontier Land.  But it was just short of being kitschy which made it perfect  Beer in mason jars - Very unique...and what a great selection of beer they had!  But I wondered if the mason jars were to distract us from the fact that you're still paying $5 for a beer but not quite getting a pint?  At least that's how it seemed to me.  Jukebox - Awesome selection of music.  Thanks to Andrei Z, we had a great time picking out songs and playing "name that artist" (or drink) whilst doing so.  Pool table/duck hunt - I love having entertainment in a bar....also played in to the lodge feel.  This place is open with a lot of windows (which provided much entertainment through the night...naked man, man brushing his teeth, women walking a pygmie goat on a leash).  Just across from Terroir, you can do wine one night and beer the next.    I'll definitely be back for more Bloodhound....

tXLQqwkyKor_W2B4VXHEZg.review_text: I live in da hood.  I took a date here once.  She was lame, but this place, rocks!  Pool table, comfy couches, nice bar, wood paneling and a great arty ceiling of flying birds.  I feel like I should have brought my 12 gauge.  To shoot my date, that is;)  haha. Advise?  Get a greyhound over their bloodhound, it tastes much better...

xIi1whPhlngewfOSTv_PMQ.review_text: um yea, i like this place. it's a special day when i walk into a bar in sf and don't feel 10 years older than everyone. i'm not that old people, but respectably in my mid-30s now and there's nothing more annoying than being the 30-something in a bar full of 25 year olds. was i really that young and annoying? probably not, because i'm me, but still. we walked in around 8:30 and the place was still happening from happy hour. i'm sure it's madness right after work.  this is not a dive bar. those who are calling it one have clearly never been to a dive bar. dive bars do not have decor themes, matching chairs, or toilets you can actually sit on. most importantly, dive bars do not have balanced and classic cocktails. bloodhound has all of these things.   the decor is kind of eery-fabulous, i'm always a fan of an antler chandelier and taxidermy is growing on me, tho we kind of stole that from the seattle folks. i was slightly mesmerized by that creepy-cool painting on the ceiling of fluttering birds. the music was great as well. i appreciate a bar that delivers consistently in all of these areas, and they brought it home for me with my cocktail. i had the boulevardier. smooth rye with a bite of lemon peel. yum.   i'd go here anytime.

JtDSgyfHPl7GzwdiVY1uZA.review_text: I visit this watering hole every week with a group of my friends, and I must say, it's one of my favorite places in the city to hang.    The service:  Great.  Friendly bartenders (some of them are the owners), they remember your name, and the conversation is pleasant when they aren't that busy.  The crowd: The 9-5ers, techies, artists and other pleasant company.  There are no trashy 20somethings or obnoxious over the top gays, hipsters or yuppies. (If they show up, they're very far and few.)  It's a nice mix of folks.    The drinks:  Amazing beer selection served in mason jars.  Cocktails, from what I hear, are really good.  All are reasonably priced.    Food:  None in the bar.  BUT, you can bring food in from local establishments or from the number of pizza, taco, or hot bun trucks parked outside.    Bloodhound used to be less crowded than it is now, but the volume of people doesn't bother me so much since this place is deserving of a packed house.

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: I absolutely LOVE this bar. I can't say enough good things about it:)  The bartenders are super nice,  and they make killer drinks. The cocktails are creative and delicious. Some of the best I've had, and not overpriced either. There's also an impressive beer selection. (I'm not a beer drinker, but my husband is.)  Other patrons are friendly, and the overall vibe awesome.  I SO wish this place was in my 'hood, I'd be regular.

RgDVC3ZUBqpEe6Y1kPhIpw.review_text: If you've always dreamed of hanging log-cabin style, with birds overhead and taxidermed game adorning the surrounding walls, Bloodhound is the  solution.  The other night I walked into this redneck junk-tion. High class funk-tion. On a rendezvous with some buddies. On the ceilings, airbrushed sparrows (put a bird on it) decorated the walls above and then at the bar, the very wooden bar, all sorts of lumberjack looking bartenders appeased my whiskey order.   If you're looking for that bar where you can metaphorically admire the star-studded sky and think about buffalo running wild, Bloodhound makes you feel like you've drunkenly arrived. So, takeaways include: crafty cocktails, wooded bar, log cabin city respite, and the best place to go when you're in the surrounding Mission.

BGz9AwJynzDCABAEKVlang.review_text: I support Bloodhound.  nice staff. . . good drinks.  well done interior.  beats Cassidy's.

uSwHDLTsD9ZQXPoAG3E-eg.review_text: Amazing/original cocktails Great mix of music Cool decor, with a warm/divey feel without feeling gritty  Diverse crowd Friendly staff Knowledgeable bartenders  But above all The Deerhunter Game is what puts this place at #1 in the area for me.

YnN4QR6HXr79iwtBs8gF5A.review_text: BUCK HUNTER. Nuff said.  No really though, this place is casual, makes stiff drinks and is just a fun place to get together with friends. Low fuss, high fun.

4uhpiOBNzIUZLqh7bskj_Q.review_text: I would like to give this place 3.5 stars.. Great decor, not really a dive bar but not quite a lounge....Maybe an upscale dive bar??? I mean, maybe, this place does deserve 4 stars. Great western/hunter theme, antler chandliers, and buck hunter in the back. Good music to top it off, the drinks could probably have been a bit cheaper, but its San Francisco, so thats to be expected.  Try the Ward 8 (bourbon, orange lemon, and grenadine) or the signature Bloodhound (pretty sure you'll enjoy both)

5Ep1wVoIeTjbA1mk9-6HhQ.review_text: Crows and antlers abound, have yourself a wood laden hotspot with expert drink makers offering outstanding cocktails that make me believe SF may possibly have the best tasting drinks in all Cali.   Hot. Sophisticated. Crowded. So recommended.

iBUQXbfJpPCft4l1zjPj3Q.review_text: Well duh.  These guys are the best and they did a damn good job on the place.  Everyone that works here is friendly.  Bartenders, owners and bouncers.  My review of Cassidy's?  Horrible.  Bloodhound?  GREAT!  Friends to the end.  Especially when they brought a great bar to the neighborhood.  I've seen about a hundred old friends here since they've opened.  I've also met a lot of folks from the hood who are really nice and glad to have a quality spot to have some drinks.  Great jukebox also!

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: Edward K. and I came here on a Saturday night. It's a chill spot. The beer that has a long ass name and starts with an F is good. I got the Kid-Sized 8oz beer and it was the perfect amount. Pretty decent prices. Definitely come here if you are looking for a place to catch up with friends and don't want a stuffy atmosphere.   Also, too bad the food trucks were not out when I was there. I would of totally eaten some food truck goodness. Oh well, next time!

PmrFSehNLWAn8pMWtB53Lg.review_text: I keep thinking I'm not cool enough for Bloodhound.  It's my tattoo envy.    No - really.  I will never have a tattoo, partially because I've never really gotten along with pain or needles and partially because I live in lurking fear that whatever I ended up permanently inking on my body would turn out to be super, duper dorky.  So every time I see a cool or witty or interesting tattoo, my inner dork sighs and turns green.  What does this have to do with Bloodhound?  Have you seen their ceiling decor?  It reminded me of a big tattoo the first time I walked in.  My inner dork sighed.  Beyond that, Bloodhound gives off this vibe of being always a bit in the know and quietly cool, sort of like all those people I know with witty and interesting artwork on their bodies.  I don't know how Bloodhound does this, because the crowd is frequently post-work FiDi (not really what I think of as 'edgy').  But somehow the bar maintains a low key, interesting vibe, even when packed with people at 6pm on Thursday.  I come here more and more often because it offers decent wines at a very decent price for me (hallelujah!) with a full bar for friends who prefer cocktails.  The interior is usually roomy (except when the post-work crew descends) and the bartenders are low key.  So despite the tiny internal crisis every time I come here, it's well worth the visit.  Even if I have to speak sternly to the inner dork...

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Decent bar. Super crowded on a Friday night with an ummm, i dunno, trendy, hipster kinda sorta crowd. Not really my style. Plus, some dude was kinda stalking me and it gave me the heebie jeebies.

VeZ8Wx1TWJcPMkK0ogi7-Q.review_text: First off, they have Pappy!  What's more, their whiskey selection is stupendous.  The vibe was great, mostly a younger crowd.  The bartender was a nice guy too.

e7RkJGYr5Yg0iZoGdUhyMQ.review_text: So good I want to give it 1 star so people don't find out about it, but I just can't do that.  Great drinks and beer selection served in mason jars.  They have big buck hunter and pool to keep you entertained along with great music.  The place looks like a hipster hunting lodge, but it somehow works.  Good, diverse crowd to watch and interact with.

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: So I've walked and drive past this bar so many times I've lost count.  But I finally found the occasion to actually make it inside after dinner in the neighborhood.  It's a rustic theme with antlers and hunter motif spread throughout the bar (down to the entertaining hunting video where you score points for shooting buck but lose if you accidentally hit a doe - who comes up with these?!)  It was kicking on a Saturday night and the place exuded a laidback, casual feel that I enjoyed.  The bartenders seem pretty experienced in their craft (they were making some intricate cocktails in addition to our straight up drinks).  A little on the pricier side for drinks but not that bad.  Overall, not a bad place to chill with your friends.

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: Really solid cocktails for cheaper than SF market rate.  I came on a Wednesday evening and both bartenders were friendly and carefully measured out the ingredients and actually tasted the cocktails before serving it to the customer.  I had 2 cocktails:  Brooklyn ($10) - a superior version of a Manhattan!  Served in a coupe, rye-based, and used French vermouth (dry), so it was more bitter than sweet.  Also, the orange peel essence pleasantly shone through.   Woodsman ($9) - like an old fashioned but spiked with Fernet.  I got it with scotch and was very pleased.  They don't have the house-infused spirits and herbal tinctures that are trendy nowadays.  But they make excellent drinks with classic ingredients for a moderate price.  Why haven't I frequented Bloodhound more up until now??

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: Why does Bloodhound deserve 4-stars instead of 3?  Not because of their 1-toilet ladies restroom or the unusual 3-urinal compact men's restroom where anytime the door swings open, a bunch of dudes are whizzing uncomfortably in front of a long line of ladies waiting for their turn.  No...  Bloodhound gets 4 stars for their stiff drinks and killer bartenders!  How strong are their drinks?  For our crowd, we couldn't really enjoy it because all we tasted was alcohol but man, do you get your moneys worth of alcohol.  Came here for bday drinks and the bday girl didn't like her Spaghetti and meatballs drink (no, that's not the actual name but that's what I called it all night).  Bad-ass bartender, Rudy, was nice enough to make another drink for her but warned us not to get anything on the menu if we weren't looking for a bite.  The convo went something like this:  Me: I'm sorry, would you mind replacing this drink with something else? Rudy: What was it? Me: The spaghetti and meatballs Rudy:....the WHAT? Me: This one! *points to spaghetti and meatballs Rudy: *SMH* What's wrong with it? Me: It's too stiff! Rudy: ...alright, what you want? Me: uhm.., Rudy: You didn't think of what you wanted?! -brb- Me: I GOT IT! The Whiskey Apple Sour! Rudy: *nods* Me: THE WHISKEY APPLE SOUR@!!!@ Rudy: I HEARD YOU!!! Me: No Spaghetti!! Rudy: -_-  I love a bartender with a sense of humor and can handle obnoxious people like me.  It's a quality that all bartenders should have, in my opinion, because they carry the event!  The drinks they make and the kind of service they provide can really set the mood for the evening.    It's hot as hell in this joint.  Why the fan on the wall wasn't turned on beats the crap out of me.  The crowd was a mix of hipsters, weirdos, and Santaconers.  By weirdos, I mean this conversation:  dude: Is this your local bar? friend: No.. dude: oh, because you look really familiar? friend: Oh.. heh *hesitant laugh* dude: You really do!  I think I've seen you from somewhere! me: You prob have cause she's a model friend: No.. no I'm not dude: Oh, yea you look like a model! Like a charlie's angel.  *points to me* You could be a charlie's angel, too me: What, because you think I look like Lucy Liu and all Asians look alike? dude: ....  me: I'm just messin with you dude: yeah.. cool *nods head..awkward silence*  I'd come back for beer.

ATvdj2Znnh_zcVyGkA0vAQ.review_text: This is a great spot Dwtn and actually walking distance from me. I love that it's not overly crowded and the atmosphere is really fun. It has a pretty eclectic crowd and it's a good place to meet up or just keep your night there. The drinks are pretty tasty!

1ljLfQwW9E0M3zv6kW0Pmg.review_text: Very laid back place.  Cool scene and happy hour on Saturday :)  Dog friendly too with a beer list which always seems to have something new on it I haven't tried before.

4InFkxzE3nxy5hd5IfLSFw.review_text: The drinks served here are awesome! They are very strong.  I had the "Recoil" and was very buzzed after drinking it.  All drinks are around $9 each.  The bar has a bit of a hipster -ish atmosphere.  It's a fun place to go out and hang with friends before hitting other places.  Tends to get a bit loud on weekend nights, but that s expected for a bar.  Will def. come again to try the other drinks on the menu.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: Bloodhound is a nicer bar than what's around it, but rather than compare it to the rest of Folsom it's probably more apt to compare it to venues like Alembic, Blackbird, Bourbon and Branch, Nihon, Rickhouse, Rye, etc. And in that company Bloodhound fails to impress.    While I had a pretty good drink here made with whiskey, ginger beer and lime, we felt that we had exhausted what was good about the cocktail menu after just 1 round.    And the decor comes off feeling half way there.    The wood work, rando dead animals and surfaces just seem dowdy and dreary.  The birds painted on the ceiling as the one contemporary element in the place would have looked great in a richer environment, but here they had me looking around for a wizard bong, dragon incense burner and old gateway desktop.  Slap up a poster of Jessica Alba and I've been in this house before.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Excellent (and strong) cocktails, a decent selection of beer (mostly local brews), and warm, rustic/modern decor make this place a winner. The service is average and it can be a bit on the loud side, but neither is a huge detractor.

RUAb4yMazoRbbCNAxlbsFQ.review_text: Bloodhound?  More like spacious yet cozy wood cabin lodge.  Although I did see a dog inside the bar for whatever that's worth.   A bit rustic, with rich brown tones.  Large leather couches, pool table in the back, not overly crowded.   Super friendly bartenders.  Good crowd. The music isn't too loud so you're not yelling at each other.    If you look up, you see doves painted on the ceiling.  I got the sense that if I were a German yodeler, this would be the place where I would pound some beer and do a series of flick kicks.  But as fate would have it, I do not yodel, nor am I not German, but the idea does sound intriguing.     Ah-de-lay-hee-who!!!

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: I wasn't the biggest fan of Bloodhound, but it really depends on what you're looking for in a bar. I came in on a Thursday night with co-workers, and the place was 75% full, and also almost as hot as sauna inside. Although I was impressed by the variety of whiskies/scotches/bourbons/alcohol in general they had on the shelves, I was yawning status from how bored I was just standing there in a group people watching. There was nothing of interest going on, unless you want to play video games on their TV or try to play pool on the table that people use to rest against. You could barely hear the music playing in the background, and there is no dance floor here. So, if you enjoy just standing all night and chit chatting with your friends and/or strangers, this is the bar for you. If you're looking to dance or do something aside from standing around and drinking, then head elsewhere.   At least it's modern/clean inside and there is no cover (Thursday night anyway), but parking can be difficult in this area and there is only one bathroom for the ladies.

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: I usually don't go out in this area but Bloodhound is a gem of San Francisco happy hour hunters and drink enthusiasts. When you step into Bloodhound you immediately feel hip. This is San Francisco drinking at its core. There are dive bars, and eclectic places like Kozy Kar but like it or not this is what SF is becoming. Trendy and ironic and tech people with a ton of excess money to spend.   We came for a pop up dinner event so it was extra crowded but even after the even closed up the place got more crowded. There were a lot of people with backpacks loaded with clothes and computers coming from work in the area. A lot of work meetups and happy hours as well as some first dates and social gatherings. It was super busy but kind of comforting to be around a ton of 25-40 year olds who had their own things going on and were actually really nice.   The bar is super clean and the aesthetic is undefinable which I have kind of gotten used to in SF. Its like local edition but not underground which is a great thing actually. The lighting is really hazy here but its great to be able to step outside if you want to. The bartenders were relatively nice despite being incredibly busy. They also have a great selection of cocktails. Really that's what it comes down to with bars like this. There are a ton of them in SF so what do they have to keep you coming back?   Location, the crowd, and the drinks are usually what get you. Bloodhound has all of this and its evident by how many people are there at all times that they are doing something right. Ultimately if you are cool with drinking around a ton of loud and enthusiastic working adults and sipping on obscure drinks in mason jars then you are going to love this place.   If any of that sounds awful then you should find another place. In a world of tattoos, mustaches, ginger infused drinks and odd things hanging from the walls this place is going to satisfy but its also going to feel just like every one of the 50 other bars that do it as well.

6JeTaXe3rtyvoPQP71IbKg.review_text: If you either didn't make it inside Raven Bar or had the honor of being escorted out with your tiara on one hand, corona on the other,  Bloodhound is luckily right next door.    A well decorated and curated bar with a gorgeous whiskey display complete with regulars  from the SF ad agency cool kids club.  Bloodhound also has a pool table and Deer Hunter Arcade machine (eats up your dollars). Overall,  Bloodhound is a chill place to hang out and get a few drinks in on a Friday night.    Now, I was pretty amazed by this place's Old Fashioned since the ONLY place I know that somewhat perfected it is Sip Bar on North Beach.     So to sum it up  - Try their Old Fashioned. A must - While you're at it, also check out their Moscow Mule!

h5qf9owtv9q8HjaNcrz3OQ.review_text: I actually like this place more than the rating indicates.  Drinks are good (namely the whiskey-based cocktails) and the decor is pretty cool.  I guess the lack of stars might be an impact of its popularity since the two times I've been there I've found it to be insanely crowded, ridiculously hot and it takes a long time to get drinks.  The tough life of a popular bar I guess.

TNadmDgzBNQJm5M-a94v3A.review_text: Love this local bar not simply because it's within walking distance, but for the helpful service by the bartenders and chill, non-pretentious folks that go there, yes, even the ones that bring their dogs.

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: They have TVs in there? Apparently I'm always ending my night here, and not starting it.   This place kind of feels like a saloon, but if David Lynch decorated it. I mean that in a good way.  The first time I came here, it started out with a very light crowd, then about 30-60 minutes later you could barely walk through the place, and then 60-120 minutes later, everyone left. Don't quote me on those times. But yeah, the number of people is very much in flux here. During that crowded phase, a smoker friend and another friend went outside, you know, to have a smoke. Then they couldn't get back in because they were told it was too crowded. They had to argue with the bouncer that they were 'just' inside and all their friends were in there. This was hilarious at the time.   Not only will I be back, I already have been back. As a matter of fact, I wanted to stop in tonight before the Psychedelic Furs show over at Slim's, but didn't get my ass moving fast enough.

A51KqJ7ZtwIZ8Q1bymiMaA.review_text: Bloodhound, a hunter's paradise. In all seriousness, this is definitely my kind of bar.  The place is decked out in anything woodsy. There are a few couches to lounge, and there are high wood tables to sit at. And of course, there's the bar where the liquor and beer stand in front of some beautiful wood panels. Sparrow stencils are all over the ceiling, and an antler horned "chandelier" hovers over the pool table. Best part of all, they have Big Buck Hunter, too so you can get your virtual hunting game on. Hunter's paradise, see what I mean?  There's a pretty sweet selection of beers on tap. Berkeley's Trumer Pilsner was $3 all night thanks to my roommate's mixer with co-workers. Beers are served in mason jars--guh, this place is definitely making me happy, and the bartenders are very nice.  Maybe it's because we were there on a Monday night, but this place is very clean. No strange smells or fears of piss on the bathroom floor. Even the bathrooms fit in very well with the whole hunter theme.  Bloodhound is a charmer.

NQ0REATs1_MehrNtnCaV2Q.review_text: Another great spot for cocktails in SF. Bloodhound is a bit unique in that it's decorated like a hunting lodge -- think gun ranks & antlers. I was skeptical at first, but happy I gave it a shot because the cocktails are excellent!  Many of their libations are whiskey-based, but there also tend to be several tasty non-whiskey options as well. Try the Jack Rose or the Ward 8! If you're not a cocktail person (gasp), they also tend to have pretty decent beer on tap as well, and a pretty good selection of higher-end whiskey (& some other stuff) for sipping on.  Cocktails run the SF standard $9-10 each. I do like that there is some non-bar seating (a few vinyl couches & tables scattered around the far side of the bar), and I've always had great service. My only beef is the noise level -- the place can get REALLY loud if it's at all crowded, to the point where you sometimes have to yell so that the person ten inches away can hear you. Try it on an off night or go early if you can.

_vk88Fk8e7_HkXSMb9M9AQ.review_text: This place fucking rocks Drinks are delicious.. Wine pours are heavy They have black birds painted on the ceiling!  I love black birds!!  Seriously, one of the best times I've ever had in SF!  So good I can barely remember details.. but trust me, it was FUN!

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: Yup, this is officially one of my new favorite bars in the city. The mixed cocktails are really fresh and delicious (reminds me a bit of Rickhouse on Kearny in the Financial District), and the general vibe is very chill. A mix between a dive/hipster/no category bar. Pool table and arcade video game. Not crowded at all on the earlier side, once it hits 1030, it does become quite a bit more crowded -- just need to plan accordingly. :)

HPk2ZLal86WmmnC5424DYQ.review_text: Went there today for happy hour  - waited at the bar for 20 min - both bartenders never paid attention and kept skipping me, what a waste of time.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Not bad, not great. My friend JUST missed the cut off to get into Raven for free, and we were really just going to go for a couple of drinks...so we walked outside, and promptly into Bloodhound. This...seems quite typical.  Crowd...young. Overwhelmingly white. Couple of Asians thrown here and there. No other POC's around, unless you count security.   Ambiance...is ok. A little dark (who doesn't like to drink in a dark place??), and area is set up so that people crowd away from the bar. Nice. It might be good to remove a couple of chairs so people are forced to go away after getting drinks, or people won't lean over groups to get a drink, but who am I to judge.   Staff were friendly, and quick about getting drinks. The drinks themselves are a bit pricey ($10+ for like, 5 oz of liquid) but well made in general.   Upon leaving, we walk by a guy super drunk and his 2 friends taking care of him. Says the friend, "don't worry, he's ok."  Says me, "I couldn't really care less."

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: fun cocktails, old school music, laid back vibe, not a ton of youngins. i like.  spaghetti western = tasty and potent.

HmqbJjQtH97S5qlPZGYFJw.review_text: Always busy on a Friday for happy hour nice crowd. strong drinks . Wish they would open before 3pm on the weekend

Mrthxi3A-RP73R7WL_IGaw.review_text: This is a cool spot! We almost missed it because the sign is hard to read and there's a club next door with a line out the door that can lead you to think the stuff around it is closed, but alas, it's worth looking for.   We came later in the evening and the bar was pretty dark and loud inside. It's not dancey or club like at all, though -- the vibe is hipster meets western. There are antlers, crows, unfinished wood, etc. but the crowd is your typical SF tech/grunge look and there seemed to be a lot more men than women there (no complaints from me and my girlfriends -- we're all spoken for, but that's beside the point).   Despite the crowded space, it was easy to get served and the drinks we ordered all packed a punch in terms of flavor and strength. I'm terrible at remembering what my drinks are called, but the one I had here was apple-y and full of spice.   As far as people watching went, we had some good entertainment. A couple making out in a corner for longer than any high schooler I've ever seen, some bizarre pool table interactions, and then a girl who was fondling my hair while her boyfriend struggled to gather their coats from the coat hooks.   In any case -- seemed like everyone was having a good night! I'd come back.

dIQnYbjf-rTxn5dQoRr0bg.review_text: Interesting interior.  FULL bar.  Casual.  More of a beer place for bikers than scotches for suits.

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Super chill but busy bar with a diverse group of patrons. They made my friend a mojito, how many bars are willing to do that?!

2aLW8ItlscUSyOxTi-j0MA.review_text: "A nice bar trying to be a dive bar trying to be a nice bar." - Mikey  Good prices, good service, and you get to drink beer out of a jar.

XDIJZGOqPkv2Sp6mpkyhFg.review_text: Western dive bar. Such a great atmosphere and awesome decor! Good open space for larger groups. Good selection of beer on tap as well as spirits.

4Po_4vgdBFk2GPeKfJqVww.review_text: I ain't mad at cha...  I like your laidback vibe.   I like your bartenders.  I like that you set a pig on fire during the Super Bowl and then served it extra crispy to us drunks.  Upscale for the neighborhood but to the rest of us, just appropriately dive-y enough.  Well done.

Eajmmu8_GcU93rCOrMj17w.review_text: Love this place. Not fancy, not shady, with a hunting man's decor to boot, plus the right mix of good folks. Drinks in mason jars? Awesome. Where else in SF can you get drunk with buddies and shoot at deers (arcade machine in the back).

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: This might be in the middle of nowhere in SOMA but there's a few good reason why this place is one of the better bars in the city:  1. No B&T crowd = no posers 2. Pool table and big game hunting 3. Plenty of room and tables to chill to not feel claustrophobic 4. Great prices for drinks 5. Dog friendly (it is named after a breed after all)  Simply put, this bar epitomizes the true culture of SF and for that I salute you Bloodhound.

s2u8pZLgMZor2qGb8f-4xg.review_text: I met up with a buddy here last night. I dig the "Fox and the Hound" feel of the place, complete with a "Buck Hunter" video game.   I would've given 4 stars, but they didn't have Effen Black Cherry, which I loooooooove taking chilled shots of, with a lime wedge as a chaser. However, they DO have a crap load of other liquors that you probably won't find elsewhere. Seriously, they had a whole wall of stuff that looked as exotic as a Black person with blue eyes!  FYI- Try the chicharonnes! Very interesting stuff. Per the ingredients list on the bag: A little chili, sugar, salt - in that order- and you got yourself a tasty snack. Soooo Good!!

lc1wSn-TQPPmLsAbjFW7Ww.review_text: Excellent cocktails.. try an off the menu favorite of mine... oaxaca old fashioned (mezcal)

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I finally was able to hit up Bloodhound after wanting to try it out for a while but not really on the bar scene any more.  What a great place and I'll definitely come back.  The decor is very woodsy, cabin like but not in a cheesy way.  They have a small pool table and a rifle shooting arcade game which was a lot of fun...probably because I won :)  The bartenders weren't super attentive but the beer selection more than made up for that.  I tried three different beers that I had never had before and all of them were really good.  Kudos to Bloodhound and I'll see you soon.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: One of my favorite Soma bars, Bloodhound always impresses with its laid-back vibe, good drinks, and a nice mix of cool people you wouldn't mind striking a conversation with.   I love the beers on tap here; nice selection ranging from Scrimshaw to Franziskaner to the Old Speckled Hen but their cocktails probably steal the limelight. I quite enjoy the Bloodhound #2 and Negronis. Friendly bartenders concoct cocktails fairly efficiently here and they're good. It can get packed but it's a wonderful spot to savor your drink when you come during off hours like Saturday afternoon. Off hours also makes for pretty interesting people watching here. Once saw a greyhound meet up. Yes greyhounds, not bloodhounds I know. That would be just too matchy-matchy.   Stop by, grab a communal long table, enjoy drinks and conversation, and shoot some video game deer or pool. Whatever you do, it's probably going to be a fun stop at Bloodhound.

t1UZNFVtkDAYi1YGwzhJKg.review_text: The 'cabin sheik' decor is a bigger contradiction than the Scottish Korean guy in the Skittles commercial. However, it makes this bar in the SOMA an interesting place to visit. A spacious dance floor, duck hunting video game, good size pool table and nice mixed cocktail will have you leaving satisfied. I came here on a Wednesday night, which was packed with the young professionals or hipsters of the SOMA. The scene was unpretentious , lively and definitely not a bad place to spend a Wednesday night..  I will be back.    FYI, this place is animal friendly.  If you don't like animals or are allergic be weary of coming here.

L5rw1x2M5I3SOrZq_WAi3g.review_text: Great little neighborhood bar - not really crowded and a large bar. Would definitely come back here! Oh and the bartender had a heavy hand. I ordered a vodka soda and I think it was all vodka :)

rcU7ysY41qGppbw4pQgjqg.review_text: Straight chill. Second only to Burritt Room, the wee hunter's hidey-hole that could poured the best fashioned Old Fashioned this week. And you can trust me; I quaffed quite the scale.  With a well hung bevvy of zootopia past, the collection is just shy of Buckshot's breadth yet suckers me in with chanteliers and a surrounding darkness that incepts the ultimate PETA nightmare: moving mounts and shifting lines of sight that track every sip of your Mason jar beverage.  It's like mother/pet guilt all at once. Uncomfortable? No. Increasingly disconcerting as you pound drinks? Maybe.  Doesn't need a lot to ride this wave of effortless cool, so the pool table and funky j-box spread icing on the cake. It's a guaranteed stop in the SF rotation.

W5cwxNwGiZJd393PCDQEvA.review_text: I dig this place!   I used to come here every now and then for a beer when I first moved to the city on Monday's or Tuesday's when I got off work since a couple friends of mine who live in the East Bay have those days off and apparently know the owner (the fact that they would actually drive into the city close to rush hour just to come here says a lot about this place in itself).   I really like the atmosphere. It's divey, but not too divey, but it's not one of those bars that's nothing remotely like a dive, but thinks it would be "cool" if it's dive so it tries too hard (does that make any sense?). It's just an overall laid-back atmosphere. The decor is pretty cool (the ducks on the ceiling are a plus) and I really like the whole "rustic" feel."   They have a great beer selection and I love the fact they serve them in mason jars! For no good reason really I've never tried any of the specialty drinks here even though they all sound delicious (I'm also a big fan of Hanger vodka, which they have).   Another big plus about this place is that despite what you would think might be a tough area for parking, it's actually pretty easy (I've only been here on weekdays when I got off at work and since I don't live or work in the area that's a big plus to meeting up here).   I think if I actually lived closer to Bloodhound (or even came to SOMA more often than I do) this would be a regular stop of mine, and would inch up closer to five star territory. Next time I come I gotta try a specialty drink!

wcsHPHmoeDaMLltHFQbPcw.review_text: We live around the corner from this place and have been visiting there once in a while for some time. The service has plummeted since it first opened. The bartenders there are really rude. The guy with the beard and glasses and a red beanie, should be fired. I don't know what he's doing there, when he can't handle the stress of a lot of people wanting drinks.  Tonight we visited, and it was my one night off in a long time. After opening a tab and grabbing one drink, I wanted another one. After waiting for 30 min I waived at the bar tender and in response I got "Hold on! Wait! Fuck!" His response shocked me and really almost brought me to tears. All I wanted was to spend a night having fun and he ruined it for me. Never going back there again and I urge the management to turn things around. If he was having a bad night he should not have been working. He insulted me so bad that I signed up for Yelp just to write this. Blood hound is a great place, but they really need to be careful who they choose to work there. Never going back again!!!!

pOsSRzm0ZOXE9FcJ5pWxYg.review_text: I came to Bloodhound to kick off my new diet. nyti.ms/cVcGcV "Metabolic studies show that after men drink alcohol, they experience little if any metabolic change."  (Sorry fellas!)  "But alcohol appears to slightly speed up a woman's metabolism."  (Goodbye gym!  Hellooo cocktails!) I almost ordered the "Peach Blossom" but I just couldn't order a drink that sounds like / makes me look like a Geisha Girl.  So I got the "Recoil" which was an interesting mix of Buffalo Trace Bourbon, Ginger Beer, St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, and Lime.  This liquid lipo cost $9.  My friend ordered a beer and admired the wide array of alcohol bottles in front of us. I also burned some calories admiring the creatively painted ceiling, counting the number of animal skulls on the wall and mason jars on the bar, scanning the large room to unsuccessfully attempt to categorize the odd crowd, and dispensing Dr. Phil-esque dating advice.  ("You don't need Zsa Zsa Gabor to make out with somebody's platypus."***) I'm feelin' the burn! ***mangydog.com/games/drphi…

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: Bloodhound is my kind of bar. The decor is cool and dark, there are leather sofa chairs and couches, saw a couple of shooting games, a pool table, and strong drinks.  I even liked the dark western vibe they had going on with their mounted cow skull and antler chandelier. The bartender knew what he was doing and made an amazing manhattan.  It did a few of us in pretty good for just one drink.  I liked their own creations in mason jars as well.  I arrived right around 6pm and was able to find parking right in front. It was early enough to grab a section of the couch to lounge and before the real post work crowd swarmed in.

VexWkVF1SOf6xpw8jUNjzQ.review_text: This bar reminds me of an upscale Lake Tahoe establishment that is content with keeping business/hardworking folks in and crazy mofoes from the 6th/Mission area out. No problem with me. Im with it. I like to enjoy my drinks guns and knife wielding peckerhead free anyways.  Great selection of bottles and beer. The bartenders are really friendly and knowledgeable about all-around drinks. If not, they're more than willing to learn from ya and still charge ya the minimum. I dont come here on a regular basis but when I do, make sure you get a piece of the pool table at least once, have a decent game to watch on the TV and play at least 5 bucks worth of BuckHunter Pro.   Spacious, lodgy feeling and good enough to get your pre-drink on before the next move. Yeeee

w7CvXX2dtmPCm67TRJw7kQ.review_text: This is my new favorite bar for a few reasons.  #1: The location. Easy parking, doable one-way streets from my place to there and back. It's also next to a parking lot that usually has a hot dog cart, which I don't usually partake in, but my friends have and fully support.  #2: The couches at the front. Cozy! You know how bar couches either are too stiff or too bouncy? These are perfect. I could (and have) spend many hours there.  #3: The bathroom. It's clean and well-maintained, a not-so-difficult thing, but one that bars in SF seem to have a problem with.  #4: The bar staff. They're on it (with the exception of a few times a couple of them have been too busy flirting with each other behind the bar--that's probably where that fifth star went).   #5: The clientele. [Usually] pretty.

vaR1poWePLL9HWN9Bkxgog.review_text: Showed up on a Friday night after hiking over from AT&T Park. Very nice decor and atmosphere; hits the woodland cabin theme nicely. The bar has wood paneling and it doesn't even look tacky! The beer was quality, the cocktails were well mixed, the leather cushions were ample and comfortable. Good people-watching, too. The French cuisine food truck at Folsom and 7th didn't harsh the experience none, either.  I was with a couple other younger twenty-somethings and we did notice that we were obviously the kids in the room (not that we were treated that way!), but hey, after a couple months in Berkeley it's a nice change of scenery.  And yeah, the ceiling is great!

y_GMw0XBty_LRrFgSciPeA.review_text: I'm a sucker for a good theme. Bloodhound, you're doing it right.   Drinks in mason jars are adorably rustic, but also tasty. Nice beer selection and the ginger cocktail is delightful.   Antlers all around and Big Buck Hunter are the perfect amount of kitsch. Bartenders are really friendly and the clientele is pretty polite. You likely won't have your toes stomped on, your ears assaulted by drunks, or your night ruined by overcrowding rowdiness.  Bottom line: Great location and just a great little bar. I'll definitely be back.

iZpUe9cfZX4p_JpKK60psQ.review_text: I've been here several times now and I see a trend emerging, which leads me to drop a star back. For two reasons.    One - Your cocktail experience will hinge entirely on which bartender makes your drink.  If you get the skinny shaved head guy, order a beer instead.  He is way too busy chatting up the women at the bar, and way too focused on checking his phone and texting to see what he's putting into the shaker and into your glass.  If you get the portly red headed gentleman - where are you?? - order down the list, one of each, and have a ball.   Two - The other current feature of this place that warrants a dropped star is, unfortunately, the people.  Rotating mix of marina white chicks - "ooh oooh, let's go check out the guys in SOMA! ...  Yeah, let's totally do it, rawr!!", skin-tight flannel plaid shirt bicycle people talking loud to ensure they get noticed, hyper professional skinny cougar types with way too much lipstick, and some after work crowd taking group photos they'll probably immediately post on their "about us" page on their website.  So what is my problem with these people?  It's certainly not their dress or make-up.    My look no doubt will offend some hyperbolic critic too.  I get it.  So what's my beef??  In short, the vanity.  It's that the people here each seem to be here for a distinct and instrumental purpose.  No one in the room seems to be enjoying someone else's company or just themselves being there.  Instead, it's like they're there strictly *for something* - to find a loud talking skin-tight flannel shirt bicycle boy to take home, or to show their co-workers how "chill" they can be, or just to sit and enjoy their spectacular selves no matter who they're talking to.  If you're thinking... "hello, this is almost every bar in this city" I'd say you are mostly right.  but i think it's still useful to know which ones tend to be this way and which ones don't.  And my previous review failed to mention this about this place.

OlSKi8O7-nabg91tXduUAA.review_text: I just moved to SF and I'm happy to have Bloodhound as one of my local neighborhood bars.  Delicious drinks (try the Recoil -- ginger beer mmmmm), awesome ambiance and friendly bartenders. If you have a complicated drink order, they got it.   I also LOVE the fact that they have Buck Hunter; however, it's the HD super high-end version which actually makes it like 100 times harder than the original! Never thought I would complain about Buck Hunter being too high-end  :-D

2844knqT5JznVAJqiDVyBw.review_text: My kind of place to grab a drink. Good amount of space and seating. Good crowd. Not too overly packed. Good drinks. Good beer selection (was impressed by the options of belgian sour beers) No complaints. Would definitely be the kind  of place to meet up with friends/coworkers/a hot date! Would definitely go back again!

IVHG626qHPDhc3ObO_nYOw.review_text: Fun hipsterish bar in a slightly odd location in SOMA, but it all works out. As others have mentioned the décor is designed to engender feelings of being in a hunting lodge or a trapper's cabin, which is a kind of entertaining for a neighborhood where you're more likely to find an Aeron chair showroom. But as I said, it all works out.  Not a huge selection of beers, but they have a good selection of spirits and good bartenders. I would also like to note that they have bartenders willing to serve you so you won't feel like you're invisible when it gets a bit busy.  I had a Hendrick's g&t, and I was pleased to see they use Fever Tree tonic by default. I then tried the "new fashioned" which was a nice drink as well. Not quite as good as the truffled old fashioned at Canon in Seattle, but it was still quite good.

ba-WbH2sxdAZqjt64gHirw.review_text: Two words. Buck hunter. I def spent an epic afternoon here after a giants game. I have literally been searching for a bar that has ths game as the only other one I had been able to find was in SC at the boardwalk. We got there right as it opend and had the place to ourselves. The bar was clean, the bartender was nice, and the drinks were strooong. Def made my BART ride home a lil more enteraining than I had planned.  Didn't really see any other people in the bar before we left so can't comment on that but so far I heart and will be making this a repeat destination.

2v6MNYvkUi-vdRn0G0xArg.review_text: Fun, loud, albeit simultaneously 'laid back'. Good service, good music, and... If there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness from the mixoligists...  Automatic 5... Simply one subjective opinion... and...  It's not saying much...  but... I'm an easy 5-star sell.

JfjiBofOmQq-ElukTWKlKQ.review_text: Bar decorated like a hunting lodge. Crowd depends on the night, but usually very friendly. Service is friendly and price is about average for the city.  Definitely not a fancy place - IMO, almost divey.. Fun, laid back atmosphere and crowd. Friday and Saturday nights are good nights if you actually like a good amount of people. The other nights are hit or miss - if there's a group holding a celebration of sorts, then it'll be crowded but not too crowded. If no group, it'll be fairly quiet with just a handful of friendly locals.

-r7eyvyw0wnGOv6kV7Q6nA.review_text: I'm really happy that bloodhound moved into the hood..  They have a pool table and.. big buck hunter which is like completely appropriate for the decor, being hunting lodge-ish and all.  Man, I do love to hunt me some bucks (of the video game variety).  The buck hunter thing is huge on the east coast, and I'm happy to see that it's (maybe) starting to take hold here.  I mean, shootin' and drinkin' go so naturally together, don't they?  The drinks are well made, and the fact that their namesake drink, the bloodhound #1 contains a healthy dose of campari warms the cockles of my heart, which I think is a good thing.  If you like beer, definitely try the old speckled hen, which is a tasty, tasty beer.    One night, the friendly bartender explained to me the whole socio-political makeup of Irish Whiskeys: apparently Jamesons is the catholic one, and Bushmills is the protestant one.  Then, he promptly poured us the whiskey that was non-affiliated.. I can't remember what it was, so it must have been good.  See? I learned something.  I'm not sure what the other reviews are thinking since sizewise, the bar is plenty big for San Francisco.. and as for it smelling, um.. I guess they were never here before, nor do they smell any of the other bars in this city (especially the one in the mission that rhymes with assanova.. great bar, but man, that place smells awful.)    Oh, and +1 star for being open EVERY NIGHT of the week.  Too many places in this hood seem to think that (a) people aren't here past 6pm (ahem, new pho place on 9th) or (b) people don't go out on mondays or tuesdays (I'm looking at you, Rocco's)..  So, I'm super happy that bloodhound is open every night, like a proper place in a city should be.  Anyway, welcome to the hood, bloodhound folks..  I'll be seein you a plenty, methinks.

s2WFkH5_j2fmMrX1QPotkw.review_text: Nice selection of beer and cocktails.  Loved that people brought their dogs into the bar.   The place has a nice open feel with a hunters lodge look.

WYojx8oXz4QUDpjkQ8Xi1g.review_text: Normal bar. Came here for a kickball shindig. The "open" bar was only open till the tab was met.   Lame.

9sxvJvvTtw8y2YRDcaL9nw.review_text: Dive bar in SOMA. I love this place! It is clean and roomy. Great place to have happy hour with a group of friends.  Came here for Cinco de Mayo and a celebration for my friends' relay team accomplishment this past weekend. What better way to celebrate than to have a few good drinks at the Bloodhound. They have a pool table and 'Big Buck Hunter' video game! Tons of seats and tables. It reminded me of a hunting lodge in the middle of San Francisco. Prices are great and drinks are stiff. It is a comfortable place to just hang out.

v1TIkPyClu5nS-rJDuswEw.review_text: delicious drinks in a cute bar, just wish the area wasn't so sketchy

5yyuvyNnwAqTxUHs474_uw.review_text: Such an awesome bar from the decor, drinks, easy parking, and the people that go there. A coworker of mine says that it is her favorite bar and numerous friends have talked about what a cool spot it is.   I went last night for a friend's birthday and had a great time. The cocktails are $9, but I believe they are a dollar cheaper during happy hour?? I could be wrong, but that is what someone told me yesterday evening.   One of my favorite parts about the bar are the ravens (I believe that is what they are) that are painted onto the ceiling. So rad.   Also, on Wednesday nights, the Chairman Bun food truck is outside and you can bring the tasty treats into the bar. SCORE!   They have a full bar with a wide assortment of beers (bottled, draft, etc). I also noticed some of the ladies drinking wine and champagne.

WtZyXabdl1bP1XJ7vQRG-A.review_text: This is my housemates + my go-to bar as it's just a block and a half away from our apartment.  They have a pool table and I learnt to play Big Buck Hunter here, a small dece cocktail menu and delicious Old Speckled Hen in mason jars.  You'll often run into Zynga and Airbnb engineers here (may be a good or a bad thing).  In any case, I've had some awesome fun nights at Bloodhound!

K1lkv1Zpnzsl3n08Zv04kg.review_text: Went here several weeks ago for a happy hour with the coworkers. And happy many hours were had. This is a chill place to go for drinks. I love the mason jars, it's been years since mason jars have been kitschy, but I still adore them.   They also have a pool table in the back, which we used more like our couch to chat while sitting atop of. Mixed drinks were good. And what was awesome was... Chairman Bao was parked outside! We could walk out and get some grub to bring in, and it was delish!  I did learn here however that I hate IPAs.

Zt3Vpw0rMRVh6Os4PKiH7Q.review_text: Cocktails in mason jars...  I love this place so much - great vibe, great decor, great crowd.
