WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Follow the scent.  To extremely well priced drinks. Can't remember the last time I paid $6 for a vodka soda. Oh yes I do. Here.  To a lively and unique scene. Mason jars. Pool tables. Birds on the ceiling. Antlers for chandeliers. Wood accents and vintage lighting. Loud and contagious conversation. Here.  If done right your next night out will lead to one of the best bars in the city. Here.

OC4flAEFeI-3NKv44HU39w.review_text: I went here on Saturday for the first time after reading about it in Daily Candy weeks ago. I really liked this place. The decor (except for the animal heads, sorry, not my thing) was great. It is divey, but cleaner than a regular dive. They serve the smaller beers in ball jars, that's quite undivey and trendy these days. I definitely was not a fan of the neighborhood, but I would recommend this bar to friends and go back myself...

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Bloodhound is my SOMA equivalent to Rye. When I'm with the BF at his place, Bloodhound. When we're at my place, Rye. Both make a killer Old Fashion (or in Bloodhound's case, 'New Fashion') and they both have that edgy/rugged/old-timey feel that I adore.   Look out, Regulars, you're going to have to fight me for a barstool.

K97i0e7MaxYfvCCwPFMjuw.review_text: This place has all the makings of a great bar. Cool atmosphere-check. Excellent tunes on the jukebox-check (heard both Little Dragon and The Ramones within the span of 15 minutes-love it!)..Crowded but still able to carve out a small space for ourselves-yep. Oh wait there's one minor detail- the drinks were awful!!! We tried four different cocktails off their menu, as well as a Hemingway Daiquiri-all terrible..If you enjoy beer and nothing else this may be the place for you. Otherwise you're just wasting your cash.

G1EQySgLTrqgtywHmyI1mQ.review_text: When I think of a great bar in SF to go to that doesn't require me having to dress up or anyone in my party to abide by a dresscode - I think of Bloodhound. This place holds a special place in my heart given the fact that it encompasses many winning factors for the Bay Area patrons.  1. 4pm Happy Hour - a dollar off regular prices. We arrived yesterday promptly at 3:43pm after our SF Food Bank volunteer event via @Boobs4Food. We were thirsty. Very thirsty. Since the doors weren't open, we went to the liquor store on the next block and downed a couple beers to quench our thirst. Point being, they open at 4pm. If you arrive earlier, you know where to go.   2. Quality environment that makes you want to stay all afternoon - I love the decor, the painted birds on the ceiling, all the Hunting theme mumbojumbo. The excellent longbar with tons of comfy barstools.  3. The Bartenders - they know their stuff and they make great drinks. Whether you want beer or liquor - they pretty much have it all. I tried the "Dusty Road" yesterday as Anthony cranked out a few for our party. Bulliet Bourbon + Bundaberg Ginger Beer + wedge of lemon. Delish. I'll be getting that all the time now if I'm not getting 1 of their many beers on tap. Love the La Chouffe!!  4. $3 Chicharrones Bar Snacks - the perfect compliment to a jar-ful of beer or a strong cocktail is a bag of these swine-a-licious rinds courtesy of Ryan Farr's 4505 Meats. Tasty, crispy, dusted with a spicy goodness and clearly indulgent. Grab a bag on your next visit.   5. Closely located off the freeway - whether you live in town or BNT - it's a quick getaway to soothe your weekday stress with strong libations, kind service and good company.   Bloodhound is definitely where it is at.

iK4QagEgn0q30ys4bhBb1A.review_text: Good beer list.  Pretty good cocktails depending on the bartender.  Good atmosphere.  Fun crowd.  Like the lodge look but wish they went a bit further with the kitch.  Good Bar all around.

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: This place is solid. Good atmosphere, wide range of (strong and delicious) drinks, takes credit cards and has tables and couches to kick back and enjoy whatever beverage you are sipping on. AND the prices are reasonable. Went to a happy hour here a few weeks back with some friends and would be inclined to go again, for sure. If this were my neighborhood, this would probably be my bar. I like it.

DAikVU-yTq7nIRZmeR7gwQ.review_text: In kind of a random spot but the decorations are awesome. There's a pool table and they have a lot of random yet wonderful beers. The service was good.

ywGjaThM4oTv3IwUuys_gA.review_text: Great bar.   This is a great addition to SOMA.  First impression is that it is a Marina bar transplant but upon further inspection you realize its good ol' SOMA with just a bit of a face lift.  The type of crowd shifts heavily depending on when you go but there's always good people watching.   + Dogs are allowed Good beer selection.  Old Speckled Hen is great. Bartender has a sweet stache, and not adverse to chatter Nice interior.  Modern lodge. Buckhunter and a sweet pool table  - Crowd is a bit lame sometimes Cocktails didn't seem too great

x8K1ynWiL5z627ZykSGn6A.review_text: Ooo! Loved it! Yummy drinks (I think I had 2 Palomas) and I liked that I could sit. I like to sit & drink bc I'm just that lazy.

G7SbuMP5zz1h6iFbkT9FNg.review_text: To the skinny guy who has something to prove behind the bar. You work Tuesdays for a reason. I am always a good, respectful patron and to have someone attack me from behind the bar with no cause is insane. Good luck, not going back.

zmRtd0SOoYqsjtcqkOFsEQ.review_text: Came in a few Saturdays ago for the first time. Loved the decor and my beer was good (I'm a sucker for the mason jars). It was super crowded, so obviously it's going to be loud but they had the music turned up SO loud we could barely hear each other. Minus one star for that, minus one star for the bartender being super rude and snapping at my friend just because she raised her hand to flag him down after being ignored for 15 minutes. I think I'll be back, but probably either way earlier or later in the evening.

AONG2lZsnm1iV8Rf7zR-GA.review_text: Awesome interior, good beer but a little limited on the seating which made the place a madhouse!  I would absolutely go back here, though I'd make sure to get here early. My friends and I arrived around 9ish, and all four or five seating areas were taken. The place could use a few more tables, especially considering how much open space it has. Even with all of the seating taken, the place was still pretty empty. However, just as we began contemplating a new bar (around 10), the place exploded with people, including a party bus with a bachelorette party. Even without the wedding-goers, it would have been nuts. Took a REALLY long time to get a drink at that point, but the bartenders seemed to be doing their best.  Inside it felt like a cabin, with wood  throughout. In a good way. And the ceiling was painted to look like birds were potentially attacking the drunks inside. Also had a single pool table in the back that never seemed to be available.  Final word: Cool bar, but get there EARLY!

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: Stopped in after getting all boozy at Coqueta for a company lunch. I'm a little surprised the bouncer let me in considering my general state and my expired ID, but honestly, who's going to turn down a girl in a plastic silver tiara that says Birthday Girl with 10 people in tow?? It happens, judge away.  After lounging on one of the couches with some friends, three waters deep, I started to feel like a real human and sipped on a Mason jar of beer. Sadly passing off shots of Fernet and Jameson, I staggered around the bar for hugs while I admired the blackbirds painted on the ceiling, low-key lighting, and pretty mirrors placed around the bar. It's a smaller locale, and I was worried about the twenty or so friends I had showing up later in the evening, but all turned out well.   Everyone was being abnormally nice to me, and then I remembered it was my birthday and I was wearing a ridiculous birthday girl crown. I suppose this occasion was such fun mostly because all my friends showed up and the whole bar sang happy birthday to me, but I truly want to go back when my head is right and I can take in the full effect of the place. Until then, here's 5 Stars for putting up with my white-girl wasted a$s on a special night.

iCsA9Ak88i6GHHdJ6zJxHg.review_text: DIGGIN the rustic saloon vibe:   -Antler chandeliers  -Beer muggin  -Tall wood tables n stools, leather nooks   Great spot for any vice - make it your own. Quick drink or big party night...works either way :)

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: It's such a chill place. If you go early enough, you can grab a seat at the booth along the wall. It's supposedly a whiskey bar, so they offered many types and kinds of whiskey. Making a decision at this place was hard. Also, they ran out of the moose drool, which I only wanted because of the name. I can definitely smell the whiskey from my boyfriend's drink, which is like a manhattan he said. Our group of 12 were comfortable getting drinks from the bar with no wait and sitting on the sofa. I like places that aren't super crowded you can't find a seat.

Ql14HxvcPeQZNF47eOL8qA.review_text: Anywhere that serves me beer in a mason jar is A.O.K with me. A great combination of the SOMA and Mission. This is defiantly a go-to bar if you are looking for a good central spot in the city.   Good beer in mason jars while playing Deerhunter, that's the life for me.

sd2rDgYYERWQL5iO6XN88Q.review_text: Went to a friend's exhibit at Back to the Picture and met up after viewing.  Was there on a Wednesday afternoon with my sister and the place was still pretty quiet.  We found two stools at the end of the bar and were pleased to see the assortment of quality cocktails they had to offer.  The bartender was very attentive, informative and friendly.   My friend eventually arrived and we moved to the cool bar height tables by the window.  The ambiance is great as they had plenty of seating, pool tables and interesting decor.  It seems even if this place gets super packed you can still have room to get around.    We had a couple rounds and I was pleased to see they use fresh ingredients and loved the mason jars used for the beer!  Glad I was introduced to the place and look forward to coming back with more friends!

WJnEifJRkI6bCH2iw8brFg.review_text: I liked it!  It reminded me of a lodge I'd go to in Tahoe after a full day of skiing, but who am I kidding:  I'm a wuss now and haven't gone skiing in years.  Lots of wood all over the place, plenty of couches, $9 special cocktails that were really good (I liked the ginger one the best) with fast/friendly bartenders without a hint of attitude. And were those antlers I saw on the wall?  Best part of the nite was when we started smelling the bacon covered hot dogs being grilled just outside the place... yummay.

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text: Strolled in here several weeks back after a friend's house party nearby.  I guess they'd just opened.  Who knew?  I don't do much drinking on Folsom St.    It's an interesting space, the hunting theme seemed a tad overdone, but not too annoying.  Personally I'll take the taxidermy at bigfoot over the antlers here, but that's just me.  Lighting was appropriately dim and drinks were appropriately strong.  I'm sure people will shortly say it's full of Marina douchebags,because I really liked it, and while I'm NOT a Marina douchebag, I could sub for one in a pinch.  :)  Any place that I can walk into with one group of friends at 1:15AM and walk out of with a completely different group of new found friends at 2:00AM is my kinda bar.

Suj8GaI5vDuwGzw91UH6Jw.review_text: I kinda like this place. The drinks are pretty good, but it gets crazy packed in here for a bar with no real dancing. I guess that's 'meh.' It's stumbling distance from my place, and the people who work here are pretty nice.  Neighborhood joint to chill with the neighbors: Ok. I'll come back, but not always my first choice (eep! - sorry!)

beEEMmT0SPrKBcAb7WH9CA.review_text: Love it. Sometimes hate the crowd, but it's worth it.

nHnNraNUct25HJJTRAGYkA.review_text: Reviewing bars is such a tricky beast but I'm going to put it right out there that Bloodhound deserves a serious thumbs up. They did an absolutely incredible job on the decor. I get so tired of the same minimalist concrete and wood combo at every other bar in the city. It was refreshing to find a rustic but cozy interior to Bloodhound, almost like you're at a ski lodge but with well-dressed pretty people ready for a night out on the town. You can chill here with your friends or you can put your game face on and get in on the action. Either way, you're going to have a good time. The beers on tap are $5 and the cocktails are different, in a good way. Sit, stand, mingle, or wallflower. This place offers something for everyone.

BVDRbz4XB-oAWfVOVEXewQ.review_text: I work near here and this is by far my favorite HH spot for a real cocktail! The bartenders and typically pretty quick and the drinks are tasty. They also allow me to bring my pup with me from work which is definitely a plus!! Good mix of people here in the after-work crowd and not dressy or pretentious.

SeXllobv1m9LGc67QN30mw.review_text: We come here every week. The new security guy is a dick. He wont except my girlfriends legitimate Foreign drivers licensee. Other security guards in the past don't care. This one was outright disrespectful. All i can say i wont be going back.

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: Loved this place!  Great spot if you're looking for a chill bar, wanting to play a little pool and just sit back enjoying the music and the company.  It was crowded, but not ridiculous.  Decent selection of alcohol and if I recall correctly, price was moderate.  One compliant is the card minimum though.  No issue with the bartender, very attentive and seemed to handle crowd demand well.   Another plus was they were passing out donuts last Friday night.  I shit you not, it's 1130 pm and when someone asks if you want a donut,  you obviously have to say yes.    Of all the bars I've been to, I feel like the design here is really amazing; the light fixtures, bird scene above the pool table, rolling chairs, comfy booth, the liquor layout all done exceptionally well.  Obviously, the music matched the decor, eclectic and perfect to add to the ambiance.  Small compliant, no dance floor to fully take advantage of the playlist.

sVy5pmUN2J0sE2AzmgoBvw.review_text: A sports bar with free wifi, and quite possibly the best Bloody Mary in SF?  What's not to like?  (Well, I can think of one thing: it can get pretty cold in here on a January afternoon.  Other than that, it's great.)

n3yuhFrDhXjW7c3xud7lnQ.review_text: Its just one place after another opening up in my hood...love it!  Cant say how relieved I am that the shit hole of a bar Cassidy's is gone.  Now I should say that I have nothing against dirty dive bars, as a matter of fact I love them, but Cassidys was the pits.  Anyway, out with the old and in with the new!  Bloodhound has an excellent diversity of cocktail and beer selection.  Although not as extensive as other places maybe, it covers pretty much everything you want.  Also, I highly recommend ordering a greyhound here....very fresh grapefruit...yum!   I can drink those things all night long.  I lived in Florida for 17 years with 4 different kinds of cirtus trees in my back yard, so when i tell you citrus is good, listen to me!  The newly designed interior is very well done, with perfect lighting (a pet peeve of mine), a really cool but not cheesy hunting lodge motif, and plenty of space, except at the single pool table.    I dont think I'll be going there on weekends too much since I live a block away and the crowd can get a bit Marina-ey (go away pink popped collars and obnoxious factory-produced blond bitches!).  Other than a few exceptions, its usually a very nicely balanced diversity of people, which is nice to see.    Oh, and the bartender with the handlebar stache (who i think is an owner) can make a mean cocktail.  Ask him to make you a custom one if its not too busy, you wont be disappointed!  Tip well too!

ZEc1ZQ6bvv_yG-tpMhmBiA.review_text: overly formulaic, yet solid.  the build-out of this place with the wood, taxidermy, decor, etc. is well-executed, but too well executed IMO, if that makes any sense.  i just feel like this place is trying too hard to be hipster-ish.  its kinda like the California Adventures equivalent of a whiskey bar.  like they serve beer in jars?  creative yes, but c'mon.  beer in a jar??  not cool.    but don't get me wrong, there's a lot of stuff going for bloodhound.  there is plenty of space to sit, and the bar is very long.  drinks are very reasonably priced, I had a bourbon old fashioned (they used george dickel, a plus) for only $7.  the crowd was a decent mix (I was here on a Wednesday) and the lone bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable when I asked him about certain whiskies.    i don't think that i'll be back anytime soon, but I'll be back eventually to see how this place evolves.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Cool spot for a drink if you are in the area.  They have some couches up front and tables toward the back of the place.  Casual and fun place

Byo0hbnRlg0pRTUpZDYJfQ.review_text: Let's say its a wednesday and you really need a drink 'cuz you're kind of an alchoholic. Enter Bloodhound...WIN!  Mid-week, this place is pretty chill, but not romantically quiet. Nice vibe inside where you have a neato blend of sportsman kitch mixed with some low lit candelight tables. Wait, that's not a blend at all, its a polar opposite...ha! Fear not, the deer antlers hanging from the roof and the sports on the TV out-manify the girlitude of the candlelights.  Comfy couches (yay!), nice, helpful, chill staff. The taps at this place are pretty solid - its tough to go wrong with anything they have up there. There are some belgium bottles they have too if you start asking. Some people may drop the rip that you don't have an infinite selection of beer here, but seriously...sometimes its nice to not have to choose from a laundry list of weird european names.   Liquor and cocktail selection is similar to the beer selection. You aren't going to get crazy Bourbon and Branch or Alembic style cocktails here, but they will be classic and made well. No weird funky shit - just light citus and whiskey and the like. My favs!  I'll be back to drink som'more here.

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: An excellent establishment in a micro neighborhood that needs a great bar. Top notch brew selection, tasty cocktail list and fun decor. Weeknight or weekend, this place is consistently busy.  The Greyhound and Bloodhound drinks are good but will run you a hefty nine bucks. And speaking of bucks, Bloodhound has an interesting decor: Mood lighting, weathered wood paneling, painted crow silhouettes on the ceiling and plenty of antlers strewn about the walls.  There is also a interesting food scene here. On Thursdays, a few guys set up shop out front with a kiln and cook overpriced mini pizzas. There is also a girl dressed as Alice who occasionally walks around the bar and sells cookies (note: family friendly cookies). I've also heard of pig roasts and cookouts in the adjacent alley.  If you're in the area and looking for a solid bar that isn't a snooty beer store, clubby club or quirky laundromat, then this is your place.

DqvPZh-crUdz4vN4tuVw-Q.review_text: I remember this place as Cassidy's, and boy the interior decorator really did a fantastic job sprucing this place up! Bartender's are super nice and jolly, not snobby hips. Mixed crowd. Props on the Old Speckled Hen. Mason jars are too sloppy.  Drinks were strong. I left perved. supa perved. A bit out of my usual way, but was not the hipster bar I thought it would be.

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: quite impressed with this bar. the place has a friendly atmosphere and has great imported beer. they serve almost all the drinks in these jars which is unique but i hope its not less than a regular pint of beer. the interesting thing is that they allow dogs so watch out under you because you don't wanna be kicking someone's dog. there could be a few more seats around as it a lot of people can come in and if u're unlucky u will end up standing all night.  on some nights, the chairman bao food truck will be outside and so you can get some great food to go with a great drink

SE12F7KiHtaTLxNBBsIPvg.review_text: chill bar. within walking distance of one  of my fave restaurants - Bossa Nova.  I don't know how busy this place gets on a Friday night, but it was nice, not packed, easy to stand around chilling without getting bumped.  Ladies bathroom was clogged though, so that shortened our stay.

WB_BwBAZlipXu1RTUMrUlw.review_text: Bloodhound is one of my favorite spots in SF, because it provides everything I love in a good bar:  Excellent people-watching. Bloodhound attracts a unique assortment of people (it can't lure in too many of any specific type because of the location). A perfect platform for start-up tech nerds and beanied hipsters to collide and argue about their respective integrality to SF culture.   Strong drinks, complimented by the beautiful wood-paneled antler-clad interior. And, most importantly, lovely warm lighting: you look good at this bar.   Guys with beards in flannel. Full disclosure, I have a highly sensitive radar for this.   It's essentially an urban cabin, which is my best-of-both-worlds ideal. Not a place to get wild, but definitely a fun place to grab a couple of drinks on a Saturday night.

CXjcyxflFGHvtKlvoT8rqw.review_text: Good beers on tap. Great old-fashion drinks. Friendly bartender. Old Western Saloon decor. Excellent happy hour deals.

Ii2yQ3qHWu9mbF1pzCpGoQ.review_text: Favorite bar we've been to in San Francisco.  Not only do they have Old Speckeled Hen on tap, but the atmosphere with a unique rustic theme is a refreshing change.  The night we went, there was plenty of space, no yelling just to converse with your friends, and the bar tenders were quick and pleasant.  If you are in SOMA, check this one out!

bA76zS8M82XNhrOrvr_N_Q.review_text: Went there last night for drinks, it was really great! Drinks were potent but very tasty.  Get the Bloodhound drink. I definitely recommend it because they use fresh squeezed grapefruit juice.

MxluzI5vFj4f8nB1bPJk_g.review_text: I can't exactly put my finger on why Bloodhound is such a great bar. It maintains a bit of a hipster vibe, but yet is totally friendly and unpretentious at the same time. The decor is very frontier - woodsy, open, and super laid back . . . and it's still one of the coolest places on this side of the SOMA. The drinks are not only served in mason jars, but they're stiff and delicious (try "The Recoil," if it's available). It's a chill, local spot to hang out on a sunny Sunday afternoon, but at the same time transforms effortlessly into a Friday night happening destination.  So, yeah. While I can't succinctly conjure up exactly what it is, I can definitely say that it's worth five stars.

j_S6baOIOglL6H6E95SphQ.review_text: Love the hunting theme of this place. I usually don't order off the drink menu, but this one is not to be ingored. Had one with bourbon, ginger beer, lime juice and elderberry flower liquer. Top notch.

b0fp-eS8_MKTg4tcZsCNqQ.review_text: A really cute SoMa bar with fun decor and mason jars for drinks. A little on the price-y side for some of their specialty cocktails, but definitely a perfect places for a drink after work or a laid-back night.  The greyhound-like drink was good, but a little too sweet, bitter. Would prefer less juice.

0niNpv8X_2I7wIWVWl3ZyA.review_text: blood.hound. Noun.  1: any of a breed of large powerful hounds of European origin remarkable for acuteness of smell.  2: a person keen in pursuit.  While I've been likened to a dog on several occasions, none of them had anything to do with my sense of smell.  Even still, I do like to think of myself as a person keen in pursuit. The pursuit of happiness. The pursuit of laughter. The pursuit of truth, self-awareness, enlightenment, nirvana....  It just so happens that all of these things are much more attainable when I'm actively pursuing the pouring of alcohol down my gullet.  This brings me to my next point- I can smell a tasty manhattan from a mile away.  And since I live only .5 away from Bloodhound, you can bet that it didn't take me long to find out that their manhattans are awesome.  Oddly enough, my acute sense of smell also can perceive when this place is inundated with hipsters and bros.  Thus, I go early early or late late.  If it happens to be busy, I order two drinks when I get up to the bar, and I tip the bar tender graciously.  I don't think it has helped get me better service, but oh well. Maybe they will notice one of these days (when I was a bartender, I could definitely smell a good tipper...).  I love the birds on the ceiling and the antlers on the way to the bathroom. I love the hunting game, even if the reason I'm closing one eye is because the manhattans got me a little unsteady.  After a few drinks here, someone will need to put this hound on a leash and walk her home. On second thought, the Folsom street crowd might get the wrong idea... someone call me a cab please?

rgJA_FjtKqOujjukAhqYbA.review_text: I hadn't heard of this bar until a friend and I walked past and decided to stop in for a happy hour libation. i was instantly impressed. great decor, fun crowd and an impressive selection of cocktails and beers (in mason jars, how cute) they have a $5 deal for any cocktail made with hangar one. i recommend their signature cocktail: hangar, campari and grapefruit.   i'll be back fo sho.

2twrvYU4GR6ZYrdS-DfQhw.review_text: Awesome bar, great for happy hour and I can bring the puppy! Their specialty cocktails are yummy, especially anytihing with tequila in it.  The bartenders are cool and friendly, and theres usually a mellow crowd in there. They have buck hunter, which is kinda the greatest game ever.....a pool table, and they're next to one of my favorite thai restaurants in the city.

f4Q_T2KcOaiAJg_i6fkZrw.review_text: For a start to your magnificent evening in San Francisco, start with a few drinks at this joint. I've been here only a handful of times, but Bloodhound consistently attracts a crowd of individuals which I tend to enjoy. I don't find it pretentious or yuppy, but it's certainly not in the drags like some of the dive bars you'll find in the area.   As for the drink selection...it's decent. I don't head to this place because of their spread, but they do serve some quality beers and unique thirst-quenchers.  I haven't stayed Bloodhound past 11PM, but for a place to get a "taste", it's a win.

MGPQVLsODMm9ZtYQW-g_OA.review_text: I might not get wild at bars these days, but do I enjoy drinking in the wild or in the very least, at a bar decorated in haute hunting lodge fashion replete with taxidermy dripping from the walls?  You bet.  Between Bloodhound's bevy of handsomely-bearded men, strong cocktail & craft beer programs, laid back vibe, and plethora of patrons sporting plaid flannel shirts, it's no surprise that I really dig it.  Is there anything else to say? Nope - all my bases are covered at Bloodhound. Arm-twisting not necessary!

JSPE5bMOg6rAKvKVEdfIXw.review_text: If I were to tell you how close I am to this bar, well, then you'd know where I live. Let's just say, pretty damn close and therefore am a regular visitor. I keep a low profile, I'm not trying to be pretentious by knowing the bartenders, but all roommates and friend's are fans. And can't forget the memorable photography of SF Street Food Festival Scavenger Hunt our group pulled off or the joys of playing Buck Hunt.   Give me my Makers and Ginger, I'm a happy FolSoManer.

0iXsfZQ8m7melVL8AtkUlg.review_text: I celebrated the old birthday here recently, and it was a great time.  Here's a familiar trade-off. You go to a bar where you feel comfortable, but the only drink the bartender knows how to serve well is a pint of beer. Or you go to a place that has got quality bartenders, but then you're hemorrhaging cash and dealing with a pretentious clientele.  Bloodhound gives you the best of both worlds. Dylan, the bartender and co-owner, mixes up some great drinks, but they don't cost you an arm and a leg, and no one expects you to be dressed to the nines to get past the door. The hunting lodge aesthetic seems to say, "If you're just a fella tryin' to do a thing, then yeah, come on in, brochacho." It's a dive bar that's not at all a dive bar.  One thing to be aware of: when I was here last Saturday, I saw multiple waves of different sorts of people come in over the course of the evening. The character of the clientele here has not yet been irrevocably defined, and I'm hopeful that the patrons on the whole remain unpretentious and laid back as time goes on. So if you're not a douchebag, please come on by -- let's not lose yet another cool, relaxed place to the d-bag element.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I spent a good couple hours in this drinking establishment playing pool and enjoying a few beers. This should be an item on everyone's bar-hopping list.  The highlight of my experience here was this. When I was getting ready to hop to the next bar, this Asian guy outside named Petey said something along the lines of, "you guys can't leave, we're going to take a shot right now." We all walked back into the bar, he threw down his jacket, and began to barback to earn 6 shots of tequila. Apparently he works with the bartender at another bar and he was helping him run the show for a little bit to get the shots for free. We found a table while he was doing his thing and 10 minutes later Petey brought us 6 shots on the house--made possible by his hard work of picking up glasses and stocking shelves. We hung around for another 30 minutes talking about the rigors of life and New Years Eve. This was a moment where a nice person did a nice thing. This man deserves a good break in life.  At any rate, this is probably now one of my favorite dive bars to hang around in SOMA. That night, we ate at The Chieftain Irish Pub, went to the Tempest Bar (another awesome dive bar), then spent most of the night at Bloodhound. This was a fun battle plan that night. I thought about the Bloodhound Gang (band) when my friend was initially telling me about this place.

O91sRO4-zLBpXZT5VrklOg.review_text: Cool place. I have to be honest I'm not the biggest fan of birds & the blackbird decals on the ceiling creeped me out a lil bit, cause  I've been shat on 3 times& definitely not keen on winged creatures.   As for the experience  My wine was good & the bartender had such a genuine smile even though it was packed for a Thursday, good sign!   I'll be back, no birds will keep me away!

HKIskLgx4fM3XnoGkvJvRA.review_text: Great bartenders reasonable prices great neighborhood vibe

qewG3X2O4X6JKskxyyqFwQ.review_text: As a lover of all things cozy, Bloodhound is the hipster bar for me. With antler chandeliers and plenty of surfaces covered in wood and dark leather, I wanted to snuggle up in a corner with a good book, alas the general activities of a buzzin' bar prevented that from happening. However, I did manage a cocktail and a ringside seat at Big Buck Hunter. I simply said "I'll have what they're having," when I ordered, but I think it was a New Manhattan. Regardless, it was well executed and delivered quickly. The also have a nice beer list and a pool table. My visit was on a Sunday, and it wasn't too crowded, but definitely not dead. It's a comfortable spot for cocktail and beer lovers to snuggle up.

A2y4lQt9hOsBHuQJMqIrHg.review_text: The guys from Double Dutch and Ambassador do it all over again!  In a totally new fashion they've managed to one-up the dive bar with an urban lounge feel that doesn't get ahead of itself and keeps it real with a rustic theme.  Only these guys could put together a urban/modern bar using construction materials that would build a Montana hunting lodge. (That raw wood panneling was stripped from a 120 y.o. barn, so awesome I had to ask).   A great bar, great staff and a great feel.  The relaxed vibe and the drink selection had me coming back but the addition of a Pool Table and Big Buck Hunter will make it my home away.   And finally, there is a great place to go thats walking distance from Slims.

TVJoa1isoHj02_iToGaXcA.review_text: Right, so this place is as creepy as it looks. Namely because it begs the questions:  1. What the hell is this?? A high end white trash bar? What? 2. Um..this is Soma right? Does IT know it's in Soma? 3. .. uh..3's a little racist so I'm going to withhold this one. But trust me, it makes this place even weirder.   That said, I didn't answer your question did I. Yes, this place is definitely worth checking out. I love the unfamiliar vibe because it's something different, and I love the lost soul/evil genius who thought Soma was the right venue for it.   Come here for a beer, a casual game of pool and a very different vibe.   ps - The boy who lost the game of pool to me still has to make good on his bet and play the next game in his boxers. You know who you are.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: Alright, I ended up at bloodhound a couple times last week when the crowd wasn't as douchie as my previous experiences, and I was able to better appreciate the solid (but not superior) cocktails, rustic charm and Old Speckled Hen in a mason jar.  Not a bar I would go out of my way to reach, but I will no longer cringe when invited there for birthday parties.

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: I've already been here twice since the opening this past Thursday. It's definitely a nice addition to the Folsom Street bars, which tend to be a little seedy. I like the saddle ranch/hunting vibe to the place.   Uncertain how to interpret the crowd...there were a lot of "older" people there last night, but a younger crowd on Thursday...

C41Ri65R6UCV2H6yfvgt3g.review_text: I went here after work with a coworker a few weeks back just for a chill drink.  It wasn't too crowded or rowdy.  Music was a little loud but we were still able to make conversation! the bar tender was nice and the drinks were strong enough and still tasty.  I really need to start writing down the name of my drinks but.... I forgot and will probably have to update for the next time I come around.  Parking wasn't too hard to find at night but it's street like any other SF area!

MRikel04XRpu-vE43R1-Kg.review_text: Friendly atmosphere, great bartenders, superb cocktails.    California lodge dolled up with San Francisco flair, Bloodhound is delicately rustic.  Akin to The Page in attitude, crowd, and presence of a pool table, but with more leg room and a place to set your coat and hat.

N_5eitlIGDavnjUuxQVRzA.review_text: I live across the street and have been here literally a milion times. Yes literally. This is a really great place to have a drink and just chill. The signature drinks are very good but a bit pricey for how little alcohol they have in them. There is a pool table and a couple arcade games. The floor is rather spacious but nothing too big. Security is always super chill and never looking to kick someone out for no reason.  There are a couple couches in the front so there is seating but it's almost always taken. If you're looking to grab a drink and be able to hear and converse with your friends then this is a great place. There is no dance floor but if you want to dance go next door to Raven.

nwyn40lYhUyEZn3J2a8Xyg.review_text: Professional mixologists. Straight-up booze alchemists. They have a specials menu and all of them are just...fantastic. I'm not sure I've ever had such well-crafted cocktails as I had from Bloodhound.   They're pricey...but worth it. It's also pretty spacious in there. I will most likely go back!

lY4j5kHYxCP7Ctg2LEHhIQ.review_text: Solid bar. Great bartenders, a funny ass doorman. He messed with me because I had a paper ID from Oregon but he was cool about it.   The decor is right on. Not too much, not too little, tasteful and natural. That dog roaming around is pretty bad ass too.  I will return!

F8UXRG5R_TgSNJmKKQMTSA.review_text: drinks are absolutely strong. I love the way they make 'em!

D6ErcUnFALnCQN4b1W_TlA.review_text: Good beer served in mason jars, awesome bartender, laid back but not divey.  I'm a big fan of dives but sometimes you want a place a little nicer and the bloodhound fits the bill.  I agree with Jared Z that if it was in the Mission I'd give it another star.

aiGHNhyHcFo0TVHyL7C4sA.review_text: Great beers and even better spirits. If you're in SOMA, this is your living room. A great bar, with a very cool decor (love the painted bird shadows) and some bartenders that are very skilled. The young lady particularly knows her whiskey. Don't challenge her. This is also a fantastic place for some nice rums and a decent bit of tequila.  I'd give it a 5 for as much as I love the place (particularly being able to play Big Buck), but it gets way too packed and they could keep it from getting so full a little better.

Dp9vtkpgNti0BuG3202PGQ.review_text: The random hunting lodge motif is fun.  Friday crowd was a mix of Fidi, Mission and SOMA folks.  Standouts about Bloodhound: tons of seating for big groups, good beers on tap, hip vibe and a pool table.  $9 cocktails to enjoy in rustic cabin stylez.

mI7qhszlDChPNbaQy9AHIw.review_text: The decor of this place is out of this world. It's got a kinda rustic vibe that is hip beyond comparison. This place might be too cool for me. Anyways, the vibe is amazing and the drinks are rather interesting. It was kinda fun trying each one, but beware of the ginger one. If you've ever had chinese medicine, its kinda like that.  My only downside is that it was ridiculously crowded. Maybe because there was a game on TV or maybe because it was a Friday night and everyone needed to get a drink. Either way, I would come back. Hands down.

5HXGmAaYwgDrHprTdGVhNQ.review_text: This place is bomb! Not only are their drinks plentiful and stiff, but you see a glimpse of the eclectic SF scene here: a guy in a suit, casual hipsters, and yuppies.  But the best part about this place is the fact that they ALLOW dogs! It really brought out the creepy-dog-lady in me ... I was eyeing all the dogs in the room. There was a 3month old yorkie pup sitting at the end of the couch, and a small terrier-mix right across the room ^__^ bliss.  Gotta thank my buddy's buddy for recommending us to this secret gem.

GjgCf_M6Bhil-D4cGo5irQ.review_text: I really like the feel of this place. I love the mason jars, the dead animals and the alcohol selection. Furthermore, the first time I was here there was a super nice bartender and friendly people at the next table.   However, this review is reflective of a crappy experience I had here Monday night with a bartender I will refer to herein as "Little John" because of his resemblance to said Robin Hood character. I came in there with a middle aged woman, a family friend of my parents' from out of town for an after dinner cocktail. We were slightly indecisive at first which annoyed Little John but we finally ordered our simple glasses of booze and he quickly made them and plopped them in front of us and then with a look of pure contempt asked us if we wanted to start a tab, to which we replied in the affirmative. Now I'm not sure what exactly this man didn't like about us but he was clearly unwelcoming. When he poured some fancy brownish cocktail for the guy next to me I (out of my love of weird herbs and bitters in drinks) curiously asked what it was three times; the first two times he pretended not to hear me and ignored me and the third time he glared at me and said snobbily, "a Fernet cocktail". Of course I nodded to this and thought, "whatever the fuck THAT is... thanks for the explanation you condescending bastard".  We slowly and slightly uncomfortably sipped our drinks and when we were done and walking out we heard a very insincere, "Have a good night, ladies!" come from behind the bar.  Dear Little John- I'm very sorry that a) my guest and I didn't meet your culturally fascist expectations of customers for asking about an interesting looking drink and b) I brought someone who could very well be a suburban mom-type into your awesomely hip bar.  Get over yourself! I hate to say it but I'm assuming the reason I had a pleasant experience here the first time is because my drinking partner that night happened to be in her late twenties and covered in tattoos.

jOZheuOkUGKp4htT0xHIlA.review_text: This is one cool bar.  Probably too cool for someone like me.  Very dark atmosphere, wood paneled walls, & lots of good looking folks sipping drinks out of mason jars.  We were on our way to SO for some grub but had time for one more bar stop.  I had this place bookmarked for ages & I was excited to finally give it a try.  It was right before the holidays so I ordered a  hot buttered rum.  I really didn't know what was in a hot buttered rum but apparently it is hot water, butter, & rum.  (See?  I told you I wasn't cool enough for this bar.)  It was good & damn strong.  We would have stayed for drink #2 if our dinner destination didn't close so damned early.  I was surprised at how nice the surrounding neighborhood is...not sketchy at all.

hkEmdF3NXVS7H4CzSDlqkw.review_text: PLEASE BRING BACK THE MARIN BREWING COMPANY BEER, ESPECIALLY THE MOUNT TAM!  Sorry, that was my favorite beer there and I miss it! That's the only reason this isn't five stars, because Bloodhound is one of the best bars in my backyard. Any place can have a bar, but what separates great bars from the rest are the people they attract, and damn if Bloodhound doesn't attract some of the best in the city.   I'm new in town, so that means a lot of bar-crawling alone and I've been offered cupcakes, been swapping travel stories - even had someone I'd never met stop me as I left to give me her phone number. The bartenders are chatty and know all the regulars, and they can mix up a great cocktail (their Sazerac is my favorite) when your favorite beer disappears from the taps. This is a great first or last stop on your night out, to shoot some pool, chat up some new people, and Da Beef is just down the street for some great Chicago dogs late into the night.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: This place just got upgraded--for two reasons.  Chairman Bao's truck comes by every Wednesday night..nothing like delicious Bao to accompany your libations (more drinking and less hangovers). Also, Anthony the bartender is AWESOME!

Pf7FI0OukC_CEcCz0ZxoUw.review_text: If there's any bar in SF that makes me feel like I'm hanging out in good 'ol Portland, Oregon, it's Bloodhound. Why?   1. Beards and beanies. They're everywhere. Plaid shirts, beards and beanies. I felt like I stepped out of a Pendleton Woolen Mills commercial and onto the lumberjack-chic streets of PDX.   2. Hunting lodge decór. I have been asking around for years and still have yet to determine what made hip people decide that a hunting lodge theme complete with taxidermy animals, hunting cammo and antlers is... well... hip. Is it the city-dweller's only connection with the natural world? Maybe. Were these kids all raised by hicks that hunt for fun? No. But I see it everywhere in Portland. If anyone can answer this one for me, please end my years-long confusion.  3. Laid back vibe. This is something that just doesn't seem to exist in many SF bars. Why? Because SF is not a laid back city.  Sorry, it's just not.   4. Good beer on tap. Not the best tap selection in the world, mind you, but good enough.  5. Buck Hunter. No, I'm not going to claim that Buck Hunter is a Portland thing... it's a hipster thing. But Portland is disproportionately full of hipsters, so many of which are vegetarian. I cannot for the life of me understand why this game is so popular. I've tried playing it a couple of times and... well... I am just not in to killing animals for sport. Also see #2 above.   6. Beards and... wait, did I already mention this one?   Seriously, I walked in here to meet with some folks, and I was the first to arrive. As I sat there drinking my brew I surveyed the scene and determined that I could just as easily be at a bar in Portland instead of SF. And that's definitely worth 4-stars to me.

UXAPXFo89WUeG0xm1dlF6Q.review_text: Bloodhound. More people in black thick glasses than I can count. I came here for a beer tasting event and it was packed like sardines.  The event itself gets 5 stars but this is a review for Bloodhound. First thing I noticed were the black birds across the ceiling. Then the black glasses. Then the oddly large amount of hipsterly dressed people.  I have nothing against hipster; just noticing. Maybe I should have known when IPA was on tab. Most of the stars go to the friendly male bartender who gave my friend and I a free beer. I wish the venue had more seats and it would be nice to have a dimmer setting. I didn't venture far enough to check out the bathroom. Was in and out in an hour.

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: Really digging the ambiance and vibe in this place. Lights are dim, nice space to walk in in the middle of the bar, booths and tables on edges, and pool table towards the back. The bathrooms are little funky, and it gets pretty packed in here because of the club next door, but drinks/cocktails are made very well. Little pricey, but it's the SOMA, and you still get served pretty quickly, so no complaints really. Be prepared to do some body surfing on your way to the bartender.

SkfABmNvBaEcltG0PWaFuA.review_text: I came here to grab a drink for two before an event at 1015 Folsom down the street. The music was so good here that I almost did not want to leave. They were playing hip hop and "ratchet" music which made it the perfect place to get pumped up.  At first glance the bar may seem very hipster or pretentious but it was actually really down to earth. The bartenders were all really approachable and the drinks were delicious! It was pretty packed but it was pretty easy to find a place to sit.  I would definitely come back here when in the area and would bring out of town guests as well! Great vibes, tunes, and people.

FRi4pcAyEj7xdWmj1PpQXA.review_text: My favorite San Francisco bar, hands down.  Didn't even mind the drunk college kids who used me as a post to lean up and make out against..  Coolest bartenders and without being kiss a's the nicest folks that have a keen interest for booze!  That is an a f'in plus to me.  Oh yeah, and no one wears those stupid, embarrassing vests "mixologists" wear.  Amen.    So, if you enjoy a laid back bar with cool bartenders go, if not go somewhere you can get your a$$ kissed and leave the awesome bars for the rest of us.

ccQvyiUeqsXhweY2hHrHAw.review_text: The ambiance is arty hunting shack. The birds stenciled on the ceiling is a nice touch. Good selection of beers on tap, including Old Speckled Hen and Scrimsaw, and served in jelly jars.   There's a very nice and big pool table in the back with plenty of room to play.  Minus a star for their internet jukebox, because then you're always just one douchebag's dollar's worth of Dave Matthews Band away from running out the front door.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: As promised, Bloodhound was a blast.  I love the decor, they did a great job.  It was absolutely packed over opening weekend and I'm really looking forward to stopping by on a quieter evening for some pool and casual drinks.  Looks to be a good happy hour addition for a group with commuters since parking is usually a breeze in the area at that time of day. It's hard to get a read on the crowd just yet (really really young kids, hostel crowds, Marina spillover and Double Dutch regulars all mixed together when I was there), but it seems like a good group.  They have lots of beers too, not just your run of the mill PBR and Anchor Steam, but their official cocktail menu left a little something to be desired according to my palate. I spent way too long trying to decide if the birds on the ceiling were stenciled or wallpapered before I noticed they were the exact same layout on every panel.  Like anyone else in the world would care.

cjY5ms_01e8V3N2VdBd0WQ.review_text: I've been to Bloodhound a few times now, and it never fails to be a good time.  They have a great selection of beer, wine, hard stuff, you name it; and a great low-key vibe.     The decor is country bar meets hipster, with leather chairs, wooden bar height tables, and pretty cool bird stencils on the ceiling.  They have BIG BUCK HUNTER! and a pool table.

BR7KTgEGHrD-FoR19yDSXw.review_text: Oh the bad bartender. The one the looks at you, then turns and walks away. This happens once at a bar and you ignore it. Happens a second time and you say something. Happens a 3rd time and you have your final drink there. You use to be soo good bloodhound. Then you got cocky and started acting as toranado and serving drinks like a dive.   So long.

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: Bloodhound is a cool bar with a nice vibe. I was there last Saturday night with a few of my buddies and it was filled with a pretty mixed crowd. You get everyone from hipsters to wannabe Hollywood types, hippies, nerds, geeks, preppies, etc. I love going to place with a diverse crowd because I enjoy people watching and, well, I just love people! I'm kind of chatter box around strangers. Yeah, I'm that guy who walks up to everyone and strikes up a conversation.   The decor is pretty cool. It has, what I call, a hipster gothy cabin look to it. Really dim with hanging antler chandeliers, a long bar that looks like it's made out of old barn wood, a ton of communal tables and a pool table in the back. The bartenders are cool and they pour their drinks pretty heavy, which is something I appreciate - anything to get me closer to blacking out.   Overall, I'm a fan of Bloodhound. It's mellow but has an upbeat vibe at the same time. It's a great place to grab a drink with a big group of friends.

o1wIg2IXN4kaI7y7D_a6Vw.review_text: I love this place because I can bring my pooch here!  Fun, chill, trendy, cool, hip, maybe a taaaaaaaaaad pretentious, but the bartenders know their stuff.  Love it.  I come here on Sunday afternoons sometimes and just let me very well behaved social butterfly dog work the house while my friends and I shoot pool.  LOVE IT.  (bartenders always offer great tips and things to try if you ask)

zN0L5F4Ng6d5FHAO_ME5cg.review_text: Chill & Hip Bar in SOMA... Popped into this spot in a wednesday  for happy hour... Didn't wait long for a drink & even found a seat right away. And I love LOVE LOVE... the 80s music playing! Decent size crowd for a Wednesday, but still some lounge seating available.

qGi0xjK3HM3Lfr6kSwKZdw.review_text: I don't really go for blood, I go for booze.  I am a boozehound.  We stepped in here after Pride because we were tired of drinking with people and The Castro didn't seem a good place to wind down. After partying with the gays and their friends en masse, I didn't know if I could keep up with them up on their stomping grounds.  But this was a pleasant surprise. Nice raw woods made up the fixtures of the place, chic interior, lots of character. Lots of window space take advantage of the SOMA neighborhood and the place was nice to duck away.  There was a fun shooting game in the back. I think the sight of me holding a gun was slightly pathetic.  Oh, Jolene.  But down to the drink. Off the cute bartender's suggestion, I did the Peach Blossom from the menu. Watching him mix it was almost like having breakfast. I got slightly turned on watching a cute man pouring honey.  It was perfect. Crisp, slightly sweet, and a good tang. And straight up in a martini glass.  I am not kin to SOMA, but if I was in the hood again - this would be a definite stop.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: Decent neighborhood bar with an eclectic crowd and pretty good beer menu. Pool table in the back that seems to get some decent use and the game "Buckshot".   They don't serve food here, but they are completely fine with you bringing your own food in. The first time I came here someone totally saved the day with loaded cheese fries. Was that you Seong? Or maybe Luis? On my recent visit here there was a guy making gourmet pizzas outside with just a little grill and a pizza stone. Pretty awesome. There was also a Chez Spencer food truck parking in the parking lot of the oil change place on the corner.
